GKVzuyfHfYoTHgMpH2mR9Q.text: Delicious fresh prepared food with a French flair. Walking through the door one forgets they are in a suburban strip mall surrounded by chain steak houses and the mall. Cafe Monte is as close as you can get to an authentic French cafe in the queen city.   Our table ate:  1. Smoked ham crepes. Perfection with a generous dollop of cream.  2. Kids crepes with nutella and strawberries. Um, can't go wrong with chocolate and strawberries.  3. French country breakfast. Includes hash brown, sausage, toast, eggs. Traditional fare, but with flair.  4. Eggs benedict - this also included the hash browns and eggs were poached to perfection.  Food was delivered within 5 minutes of ordering on a busy Sunday, service was always there with water and coffee refills.  This is a gem of a brunch spot. Can't wait to try their lunch menu.

tdPGtOp6zPzCpa3mJgf0qQ.text: I'm in Charlotte for business and asked the staff at the front desk for restaurant recommendation.  She enthusiastically recommended CM.    I was very disappointed.  The service was terrible. I asked to tell me what most people (regulars) ordered when dining there.  He replied "steak, chicken, fish.". I said I wanted to know what items the ordered from the menu.  He pointed to the Trout.  What a jerk.  He brought my dish, which came 5 minutes after I ordered & was not very appetizing in presentation or taste.  I ordered the wild mushroom & chicken crepes... Not good.  I left him a 10% tip which was over tipping.  Wish I had gone to PF Changs instead.  Beautiful city however, I wish I was staying longer.

9mNf812gLBrsomIHZWiOMg.text: I love breakfast.  I especially love eggs, with warm, runny yolks, oozing over some variety of carbohydrate ... mm mm.  Eggs.  Ok, I digress.  Do you know what else I like? I like Cafe Monte.  Why? Because they fed me some excellent eggs.  We had been wanting to try Cafe Monte for quite a while, and once we discovered that they were in our Citipass (the best $25 you can spend, btw), we decided to give them a go for a late Saturday morning breakfast.  The restaurant's space itself is beautiful.  It has a turn-of-the-century Paris vibe that really sets the mood for the food.  Our waiter was helpful and polite in an unobtrusive way that seemed peculiarly French.  Mind you, I've never been to France, so that's a statement of instinct.  Let me not forget the food, for it was delicious.  I ordered the Benedict Monte, with two beautifully poached, wispy eggs, ham, tomato, asparagus, potatoes, and Hollandaise sauce, served with a croissant.  It was fabulous.    Though our Citipass voucher is now spent, we will return to Cafe Monte at full price with no hesitation at all.

o80iZK2scBY5X-LrhkFqbA.text: The food and ambiance were great! It was hard to choose what to order because everything looked so delicious! We will definitely be back to try more on the menu! The only negative was the cappuccino that I ordered was served warm rather than hot. Otherwise great experience!

W8DP0mi5jrM98Um7fjyWGw.text: I love a place where you can get great food but at the same time be able to relax and enjoy the company your with while you wait for it to come out.   On our first trip there for dinner my wife and I were first taken by the openness and decor of the restaurant and as we looked around you could slowly begin to hear the music playing in the background. "We need to come back here again," was our first reaction before we even tried the food.   I had the steak and frites and they were incredible. An even better reason for coming back again.   We tried brunch on Sunday morning recently and instead of waiting the 10 - 15 minutes we decided to sit at the marble topped bar and enjoy the morning. Again a phenomenal time and we had a chance of discovering a different part of the restaurant and the time someone had taken to try to make it feel warm, inviting, and almost cozy. They succeeded.

S57fkBz3iY3a7mXt8rGaFw.text: The wife and I recently went for dinner at Cafe Monte on a friday night. From the moment we entered the building the ambiance was perfect, low lighting, french classics playing in the background, pretty lively but by no means overwhelmingly busy. The food that I had, warm baguette to start, steak frites for my main course, finishing with the creme brulee, was all excellent. My wife also enjoyed her risotto and french macarons. Excellent experience, would recommend.

3ryi8vAsq3n5H19rHZF3ZQ.text: Very poor service. Food is slightly above average for a typical brunch place. Restaurant is grimy along the walls. This place used to be great for brunch, but you can tell the owners have really allowed it to settle into mediocrity. They have also botched two take-out orders recently - made me wait 45 minutes once and completely messed up the second time.  Also, don't get the lobster salad - made a family member sick for two days.  Avoid and go elsewhere for brunch.

yFx-MGCmyZ_F_MYkUH9uFQ.text: We went for brunch today, and it was our first time visiting Cafe Monte.  I was immediately impressed by the atmosphere - it feels like a French cafe complete with a pastry case, and it was great for lounging and slowly waking up on a Sunday morning.  We got the Benedict Monte, which was delicious on a croissant instead of the traditional English muffin, and the French Country Breakfast, which the chef very nicely substituted egg whites for the eggs.  The coffee was delicious, and the service was friendly.  The $30 price tag was a little more than some breakfast/brunch places, but it was definitely worth it!  We'll definitely be back.

JdQgdWaDF5AAMeAORmUHlg.text: I have eaten here 5 times now, either alone or with a friend. The food is really good and so is the coffee and bread. Friendly service and great outside seating in the shade. A relaxing spot to have a meal or snack. Bon Appetite!

6-v5FCCV9Pc6cI-ZAffRUg.text: My family hosted a rehearsal dinner here for my wife and I (60 guests in our party), and had a fantastic experience from start to finish. The staff, including Monte himself, consulted with us to create a unique food and beverage menu specifically for our event. I can honestly say the entire evening was flawless, which is a testament to the caliber of people that work at Cafe Monte. In fact, many wedding guests came back to Cafe Monte for brunch the day after the wedding. I highly recommend Cafe Monte for large dinners/group events: the food and wine, service, and atmosphere are all top notch.

lldsBGr447Gm3xL6-gRz_w.text: First the food is good but the restaurant service is bad. Today is not busy and service still too slow and never come back to my table .

PfG1QHxaJWbuvRZg7MoXzA.text: I went there earlier this week expecting to be wowed. I was left feeling underwhelmed and a bit upset. Being a new transplant to the Charlotte area I've looked to groupon and yelp as a way to explore my new city and find new gems. Based on the reviews here I jumped at the chance when groupon offered a deal a few months back. Anyone who knows me knows that I'm a francophile...french food is my weakness.   I chose 4:30 on a Wednesday so I could beat the dinner rush and just enjoy some quiet time by myself with my Kindle. I was the only table there so my waiter wasn't busy. He slammed the menu down and disappeared. No nice greeting, no specials, were given. Five minutes later he comes back and asks am I ready to order? I asked for wine recommendations...none were given, he instead gave me the wine list and left again. Cam back a few minutes later...I ordered my glass of wine, starter and main. Five minutes later he brought the soup and none of the oft praised bread was offered. Disappears, never checked on me.   Half way thru my soup the entree was dropped off. Never checked on. Are you getting the picture? The place was empty, what was his excuse for such poor service? At this point I'm livid. The soup was meh but my entree of Chicken With Mushrooms crepe was pretty yummy. I knew I should have just called it quits but I'm a sucker for creme brulee. Big mistake. It was flavorless, thick and had this weird pasty taste and mouth feel. I thought that was the final insult but no...there's more. Not only did the waiter not look me in the eye and thank me for my visit...he reached from behind me and dropped the check over my shoulder. WOW! I was pissed...I debated asking for a manager but at this point I was just over it and said screw it. Why bother? Just never come back and leave it at that. I'm not sure why I was treated so poorly. I was an easy table, an easy 20% tip for the waiter even though he was a douche. I've worked in the service industry so I tip well even if the service is crappy. All I wanted was a nice afternoon out by myself.

amyKIJ2rMvlFzqvh4A4q-w.text: I really loved my experience here and I can't believe I haven't been here sooner. I came for brunch with a friend one Saturday and I chose to have breakfast. It was really good and they were not stingy with the bacon!! The eggs were cooked perfectly to my specifications and the hash browns were delish!! The atmosphere is really nice although the seating is only so so. That would really be my only complaint.  It definitely has that cafe feel and I can't wait to get back there and try dinner and one of their chocolate croissants!!

HAhbvUHp66-xlvwJ-LI1vg.text: Ive been there for dinner and breakfast. Breakfast is great ( croque madam is the way to go) and dinner is yummy as well, great wine and sometimes they have live piano playng. The chocolate ECLAIR is the best I've tried in my entire life. amazing, amazing, amazing!

jTB0PE3HaqgS5bt2hlWNXQ.text: I've been here for lunch and found the food ok, the service less so. Mainly, I've come because of the outpost of Amalie's bakery.   Still, I was excited to hear about the breakfast hours and made the rush-hour trek to try it out. Unfortunately, doors locked, lights off, nobody home.   I don't know who posted the breakfast information but, if they are going to start serving in the mornings, they haven't yet. One start for getting me out into the rush hour.

NrexnEygrGl8hdRh4IzfJQ.text: Step one foot into this Parisian Bistro, smell the coffee, see the people, fall in love! If you've never been to France, the decor, music, and food will take you there. Right here in Charlotte!!! I finally made it to Cafe Monte one Sunday for Brunch and the place was full of people!!! I was alive when I walked in. Really reminded me of a Bistro in Paris. I waited for close to an hour for my table, which is reasonable on a busy Sunday afternoon with no reservation. After being seated, my only complaint was that I wasn't getting good natural lighting for food pictures lol! I had coffee to start, the Cafe Au Lait (I think). Wasn't all that thrilling. Anyway, I ordered the Waffle with flambeed bananas, bacon, and of course frites! Everything was good. The bacon (which I call a gateway meat seeing that I don't eat pork) was marvelous! My guest had the quiche. She thought it was a little overcooked. Our waitor wasn't the most attentive, but other than that, we really enjoyed this place. Hope to get back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flambé Bananas!
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quiche
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cafe Au Lait

Z_br9d8SepPOPcMTCiFZ4w.text: DELISH!! The food is amazing here and the service was wonderful! As soon as we sat down we were greeted with waters by our server Naida. Plus, throughout the entire visit I never saw the bottom of my coffee cup - for those like me with the coffee addiction this is a huge plus!!

djYGcXgdX5JmG1jb0-iKeg.text: This place has it all--great food, wonderful atmosphere and a charming decor.  I have been here many times and always enjoyed my food. The eggs benedict is marvelous and the wine list is superb. The servers will help you choose a good wine to go with anything.  Sometimes we go just for apps and wine!  The bakery is part of Amelie's and is delicious!

X5hIigfJ4I9o3hkzo9lYqw.text: We had a wonderful experience.  Food and service were great and we got the chance to speak with Executive Chef Jon Ernst.  He was dead on with his recommendation of duck confit salad followed by steak frites and beef short ribs.  I'll be back soon!

QSBPCAjKWILHwdUl2YSYvA.text: The food is delicious but the service is less than desirable.  For lunch with a friend it took 2 hours and it is not because we were sitting around getting lost in conversation.  We both ordered iced teas and two salads with chicken on top.  I got my tea refilled ONCE, and after finally taking our food order, it took 50 min. for the salad to be served.  During the lunch hour, this is just unacceptable.  I have not returned to the restaurant since which is unfortunate because this used to be my go to place with friends.

gUS-_frGLhtuSKCdLRIIew.text: Excellent food and attentive wait staff.  Never felt rushed nor looking for service.  Food (mussels,  swordfish,  chicken, pasta) all arrived quickly and hot.  Everyone loved their selections.  Decent portion sizes.

JkOVRZ_ToUyHDxVvPD_uAA.text: This is probably my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The food is always delicious and the wait staff are friendly and helpful. Lisa is wonderful and will make your visit special!!!

RJlfK0ppBXlbE4Md7dPvuw.text: Awesome brunch on Sundays. It feels like authentic French. Nice atmosphere. Great food.

as3x-qMVFMnRH7N2wywyWA.text: This place is a sure bet for great food! My boys have extremely discerning taste and this place is perfect for them!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Benny!
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussels!
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Club!

14X1mjKHSmX2DY9UcRVE1A.text: If you'd like to be treated like an American in Paris with snobbery, nasty looks, and complete lack of service then Cafe Monte is for you. Not only was the hostess rude and uncaring but the food took forever to arrive and was lackluster when it did. The bland omelettes needed salt/pepper badly but we couldn't seem to get any. The coffee tasted like stale diner coffee. It was just an awful experience overall. I don't expect to be treated specially with an infant but do expect some basic understanding.   When I told the hostess my babies hands were ice cold outdoors and we really could use an indoor table, I was told we would now be at the end of the wait list (which was now 45 mins long). No "I'm sorry mam", straight face, inconsiderate tone. She was also unfriendly to my husband when he initially approached her for a table.   My suggestion- dine elsewhere. For $14 an omelette it felt like highway robbery.   Update: the owner was very prompt in responding to our negative experience and offered for us to come try cafe Monte again. We certainly will, as we had heard great things. His attitude was professional and apology sincere. I was impressed with the communication and it assured me our experience wasn't typical.

3Ztj40YRcDLq267hQIvbzw.text: Cafe Monte was a great choice for dinner last night. The setting and ambiance was great. They had a band playing Christmas music. The place was busy. We started with French onion soup which was great on a cold day. Then we got the steak frites with Bernaise and the salmon. The steak was cooked perfectly and the frites were crispy and hot. The salmon was really delicious. The prices were very reasonable for the quality. Hot chocolate tastes like Swiss miss and our service was a little lacking. The baguette and butter you get with dinner is so good too! We will be back

UlHUykjF20iSBKPPj0YlDQ.text: I love this restaurant for the wonderful food, lovely atmosphere and excellent service. Today was no exception. My husband and I came for lunch to celebrate my birthday. I received a birthday certificate for a free entree which made made the experience even sweeter. It was wonderful!

BwMSD3Rpq-hykhglGKG5Sw.text: Met some friends here for Sunday brunch.   The food was delicious!  I had the Crab cakes Benedict.  Service was good and there were nice size portions.  The mimosas were a little small but good.

JXxUt4GT-RciKjW8cOlFJQ.text: I came here with a friend for the first time yesterday, and the food is amazing. Since I'm part French, I had pretty high expectations for this place, and I wasn't disappointed. I ordered the chicken and wild mushroom crepes as well as the banana flambe crepes. Both tasted absolutely amazing! The banana flambe wasn't that sweet either which is a good thing. The prices aren't too bad, but I do think it's worth it for how delicious the food is.  The customer service was alright. I made a reservation at 1 on a Saturday and it was completely packed in there. When they seated us, they forgot to lay out the silverware. Our waitress seemed snobby and slightly rude at first, but she got much nicer afterwards. I don't know if it was a coincidence or not, but I felt like they didn't pay attention to us as much as the other customers.   Parking was horrific. There wasn't a single space in front of the restaurant. I ended up parking near the movie theater. The walk wasn't too long, but it was extremely cold that day, so it was painful. And I ended up getting sick.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana flambé crêpes

zeLSFw4CU5y2uCGGxqNEgQ.text: After the 1st experience we had with the hostesses and my review, management reached out and apologized and asked to give them another chance as this is not how their customer service usually is. So we went back today and it was a total 360 degree difference. The food and service was outstanding and we will return the next time we are in the mood for the brioche french toast and monte benedict.  Best eggs benedict around.

ynLSadhmWda35lwWC94LQg.text: I have been wanting to try this place and when I saw the charlotte dealsaver it was a sign that we should try it!  We made reservations for a Sunday morning for brunch.  I'm realllly glad we did.  They were slammed!  We were seated promptly and immediately were brought waters and asked what we wanted to drink.  It was too early for mimosas so we both went for an espresso.  It was yummy.  We both ordered the ham and egg stuffed crepes with some kind of heavenly cheese sauce.  For dessert we ordered beignets.  They were delish but I wish there was a cream dipping sauce instead of the jam.  The service was excellent and the environment was nice.

SwufwQysgJizH1FN9gMaQA.text: Great food and service. The crepes were stellar!!  Desserts were wonderful. Check this place out.

zok6PC1WxeO11TIyAJcANA.text: This place has gone down hill from what it used to be.  Dined here Sunday morning and was surprised that there were a number of empty tables at 10:00 (the service will tell you why).  We were a party of 2 and the snobby hostess wanted to seat us on the back wall bench seats between two tables that each had crying babies.  When my wife asked for a different table she huffed and puffed like it was a big inconvenience.  So she puts on on the other side of one of the tables full of kids.  Seriously?  There are plenty of other open tables.  We should have left at that point.  Waiter was terse, slow and never asked how our food was. Food ok.  All that and its $45 for 2 for breakfast.  I don't think so.

ASRMmqzI8cADodLAZDMhXA.text: The food is amazing but the service is horrible. I sat outside a few months ago and waited 20 minutes for a waitress to come to my table. When she still hadn't come after 20 minutes, I left. I decided to try it again on a week day to see if the service was better. Once again I was seated and waited about 25 minutes for the waitress to come to my table. She was neither pleasant nor attentive. When I asked for a water to go, she did not ask the other customer at the table if they would like one as well. She never asked us how our food was. The food is always fantastic but the multiple bad service experiences will keep me from revisiting.

JgFLbo5VuXxuEpt-kHccEA.text: I love the ambiance here. It was like being in France (art, decor, music, lighting). We came for dessert and were pleasantly surprised by the options given to us. I was a big fan of the fondue with dark chocolate and the variety of dipping options! Croissants, macaroons, and strawberries yum!!! Also great service and coffee was bold.  Can't wait to go back!

I2cto7EZnxTP-M1ZFwP63g.text: You know, I came here once about five years ago and never came back. I'm not sure why. This past weekend I met my friend for breakfast around 9am on a Sunday and we were seated right away with no wait. The table was tiny, but it was fine. Our server was very friendly and attentive. I ordered the open face vegetarian sandwich and it was so delicious. The pomme frites were thin and crispy as well. I'm so glad that I decided to come back to cafe Monte. I will be a regular for sure!

AoSjpBnvKAcLwlAejzY_nw.text: Cafe Monte is one of Charlotte's truly great restaurants.  We have been going there since we arrived in Charlotte and the food and service have been consistently outstanding.  There tonight and found a new favorite meal - Short Rib Poutine.  Absolutely outrageously delicious and totally decadent!! Live in Ballantyne now but the drive up to South Park for Monte is so worth the time. You owe it to yourself to go if you have not as yet.

SQMxkvYX4S4A9Giwhq0cVQ.text: Had their smoked salmon Benedict and it was amazing atmosphere was great but it's a bit expensive.

Zfoi4y_USzUpzlQR0PMb9A.text: The croissant and omelet were amazing!  I got the smoked salmon, crab, lobster, tomato, and chives omelet with egg whites and it was very fresh and delicious.  It comes with a choice of bread (I got a croissant...best choice!), fruit, and potatoes.  My husband got the French toast, which I might get that next time because it was so good.  Coffee is awesome too.  I think we will definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

2rIUFSoIYRN5DHiI3_14vA.text: Amazing service. Delicious. C'est magnifique. Crab cake Benedict had perfect poached eggs.

3lpemWX0zf1F1luXFhALGw.text: Excellent service, great food. I had the trout amandine, which was a great blend of textures and flavors; my wife had the shrimp risotto, which was also delicious (although not as visually appealing). We shared the escargots, which came cooked into puff pastry and were very tender, but they lacked the snail flavor we expected. Still good, though. My wife had the french onion soup, which she also enjoyed. Overall, a great place for an anniversary dinner.

XqIyn-shUFFzmVW4B60Sfw.text: I have tried Cafe Monte for the 4th and final time.    I keep wanting to like this place.  Nice decor and while the menu isn't large, there are many things on it that sound great.  This time I ordered the mussels and the duck confit.  Both were very disappointing.  The mussels came out in an unappealing cream sauce that I can very easily trump at home.  The duck confit was just so so and did not have much flavor.  How duck fried in duck fat isn't an explosion of flavor is beyond me.  I find the frozen duck confit from Reids to be much better.  I do have to give them credit for their starter bread, however.  It was fantastic and may be the bread that I've had in Charlotte.    Sorry Monte, but that's the last time that I will see a credit card charge with your name on it.

FO_qUGOH4qhAFHLxNpb2yA.text: Cafe Monte is a great place for a Sunday brunch.  I just happened to run into this little spot while visiting the Palm steakhouse.  Cafe Monte is located at the adjacent parking deck.  The interior of the restaurant is clean, lively and very inviting; everyone seemed to be having a great time when we went.  The service was great and the waitress was very accommodating and didn't mind taking a few minutes to explain a couple of menu items for us.  I enjoyed the "french country breakfast" along with a side of french toast.  I must say, that Cafe Monte has some of the best french toast in Charlotte.  The french toast was crispy and golden on the outside and nice and soft in the middle, just the way I like it.  I washed my meal down with some very good french roast coffee, and I must say that this was some of the strongest coffee that I've ever had in my life, it was a real pleasure to drink such a beverage.  The best part of the meal was the check.  My two entrees (french country breakfast, coffee and french toast) totaled around $22 and it was totally worth it.  I don't recall what my frat brother had, but he really seemed to enjoy his meal too.  I recommend giving this place a try.  The lively atmosphere alone, makes the meal very enjoyable.

Ner87bWTYsiYPJshHrtqBg.text: Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread.   This is what I chanted as I walked into Cafe Monte, knowing it was a French restaurant.   Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread.  I continued to mutter underneath my breath as my stomach complained about its emptiness.   Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread.  The baguette comes sliced. It is soft for a baguette but nonetheless delicious with olive oil. We ask for more  Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread.  pieces of it swim in my French Onion Soup, which has the perfect thick cheese on top that I don't care to finish. _______________________________________ My Duck Confit comes. I know it sounds snobby but a girl can't help what she likes and I happen to like. Confit.  The outside of my my duck confit was a little dry but the fingerling potatoes on the side were still delicious as well as the broccoli florets. My coworker's lobster and crab risotto was tasty as I snuck a bite but I got a little sand grit from it admittedly. Maybe it was my bad karma. _______________________________________ Time to pay for the meal and it requires a decent amount of:  Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread.  but before we go, my boss has ordered crepes with strawberries and rich chocolate filling to share. I enjoyed dessert so much that I as I walk out the door, I no longer think:  Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread. Bread.  only...  Crepes. Crepes. Crepes. Crepes. Crepes.

2SaB_-ZqY7Po8bY8aSSsoA.text: Love going on sat night to enjoy the musicians.  Think the staek and frites is a great value. Wonderful mussels.  Place just FEELS like Paris.    Great staff

QHQR-EBVzKiinstEZVhpew.text: This is such a great place to eat, but try to go at an off time. At the popular times, they still serve you well, etc. But I just like to go for a relaxed meal. On a Friday recently we made sure to go before 6pm and it was so nice. We had a relaxing meal, and the food was awesome. My husband had a nice thick swordfish steak, and I had the Chicken mushroom crepes. YUM! My martini was the best I've had in a long, long time.

0qE0Fp66ME1WaVcG9k3kdA.text: We went here for breakfast when they first opened and it was delicious, so we decided to try dinner last night. Bad move. While the desserts were good, everything else was sparse, bad, or both. My scallops & shrimp entree was a salt bomb that boasted 2 measly scallops & 2 small shrimp atop undercooked risotto with green beans buried under it. My husband got the large portion of mussels and frites and while the broth was good, the portion was quite small. My mother-in-law ordered the salmon, which while it was the only meal sized entree, was overcooked to a dry inside, brown outside finish. I had a coupon for $15 off the bill and I still feel like I've been had. There is no way we're going back for dinner. Beware of restaurants bearing coupons.  EDIT: Owner messaged that they make their own desserts and have not worked with Amelie's for years.

kHVuq2SCq4aG433gtHFV_Q.text: Superb food served timely with excellent service. Amazing selection of food choices. Great atmosphere- can't wait to go back!

MYlLYNBbSZ7GLvpqZuxHHA.text: Meh. I got the salmon croissant and it was flavorless and my husband got the hamburger royale and it was super greasy. Disappointed in flavors. It seemed their clientele consisted of elderly people and middle aged woman. What earned them 2 stars? Bread and pomme frittes.

dKVQVWCNsB_IGhBxI4bb_w.text: This is still one my favorite places in Charlotte. The food is always delicious and the staff is exceptional. If the beef wellington is on special- definitely try it.

wsiYn4hb8ptR9-1hhaCdZw.text: Fancy little brunch place. Came here with my family so it definitely meets their uppity standards. Good place to take your parents when they come in town. Decor makes you feel like you're in Paris.   All I can remember is that the potatoes were so flavorful and delish. I would come back there just to eat a plate full.

ys0Db44bE_UtprDyR1pL6w.text: I like to keep things short, so the skinny is: Very good food, very slow service. For me, that is not a huge problem, but I've been here 5 times and its always the same, does not matter if crowded or not. Trying to keep your girlfriend engaged in cheerful conversation when she is hungry and wants to order is not the most pleasant experience! Gentlemen, when your gf wants to order, don't attempt to make light of the situation and crack some jokes, track down the waiter and make him take the order! - Life lessons.

rHvQY3_WOI-KsKJj6b3j-w.text: If you love an authentic French restaurant this is the place because they are rude & stinky

fIdqLFPOYyNmmNoZW9F1Ug.text: I've had Cafe Monte in my brunch/breakfast sights for quite some time now. Just waiting for the right moment.....to no avail. I made it in closer to 1pm with my wife and started wavering on whether or not breakfast was the right call for sustenance. Cafe Monte was welcomed, despite my late rise.   I had heard whispers of this French cuisine in the quaint corners of Southpark...bistro music filling the art-laden walls. I was happy to find all of these. The interior is welcoming, spacious and occupied by very cushy chairs. I was enthralled with the music. Timeless and tasteful for the French decor.   I was a little put off by the host. We waited for a few minutes before anyone even acknowledged we were waiting to be seated. A minor faux pas that can be fixed for sure. The service, once seated, was fast and friendly.   I ordered the steak and eggs. A rather generous portion of sirloin, cooked medium rare, croissant, beautiful hash browns and eggs. My only hangup with this meal were my eggs. I had ordered them over medium and they were served waaaaay over hard. More along the lines of hard boiled. Rather displeased with the texture, but the rest of my plate made up for it. The steak is wonderfully cooked, flavorful and seasoned. The hash browns are served in a "puck" shape and need no ketchup.   The coffee is also delightful. Black, bold and piping hot.   I'd definitely venture back in to Cafe Monte. A few slight changes and they'll be a 4.5-5 star in my book! Oui!

3PIJjlKOX9rYdB8tUI7lkw.text: Good ambiance, pleasant selection of french songs, food though not that great. Heavy sauces flooding your meal is not quite what you would like to eat. The vegetarian crepes were ok but too much sauce. Penne pasta hasd a heavy sauce, again too much. Tea is grocery store type, coffee not great either. Service unattentive. I would recommend it for the ambiance and maybe a glass of wine or beer.

b2idqWjlQWh6OHj-1u2MpQ.text: I don't get to travel to Paris very often - okay, not at all - and all flights to Paris from here can be pretty costly, even if they're direct flights. But when I'm jonesing for un fixe Parisien (I made that up), I can't go wrong with Cafe Monte.   Portions are generous - I recently got an arugula salad with a pretty hearty serving of roasted chicken, with a massive side of berries - so you won't leave hungry. And don't forget to sample their pastries, with a delicious cup of fresh brewed coffee to go with it.   Love, love, love the decor and the atmosphere. Okay, so it's not really like the bistros that line the streets of Paris, but, what the hell, this is Charlotte, and this is as close to the City of Lights as some of us will ever get.   So don't whizz all over my dreams, okay?

wfzqqJUHMnEdk0ftzNB7tQ.text: On my birthday my wife knew I wanted escargot so she called around and found that Cafe Monte would be willing to make it for me during breakfast hours. The owner was a fantastic person and even brought me a complimentary glass of wine to compliment the garlic butter of the escargot. Needless to say we have found a new IT place for special occasions and random cravings for French food and top notch customer service. I insist that you should give this restaurant a chance; you will leave very pleased.

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

SR_MlYLNCOlmeoEH_M67aQ.text: The food is ok...and ok is not word I wish to use to describe French food. I had the duck confit...it was ok. I've had better at Asian joints. My wife"s chicken wasn't seasoned to her liking. I had the French Martini and the beignets. Both were good!

SrBeWFwwzoA-zbHlLMmr5A.text: My boyfriend and I just checked out Cafe Monte for the first time. As soon as we walked in, I felt like I liked the place. Soft jazzy music playing, interesting art on the walls, lots of tiny bistro tables and a beautiful marble bar. Very French feeling, and I would imagine if you were visiting for dinner it would feel downright romantic. The wait for a table inside was about forty minutes so we opted to squeeze into two seats at the bar. We waited for almost fifteen minutes without anyone coming over to even get our drink order, and my boyfriend got seriously ancy at the wait. He finally went to talk to the hostess and after a few minutes the bartender came over to take our order. He seemed very nice and competent, so I would venture to say the issue was more of the restaurant being pretty majorly understaffed vs poor service from the bartender. I ordered a Bloody Mary and Ham & Egg Crepes and the bf went with Bananas Foster French Toast. The Bloody Mary was very good and tasted especially fresh. And the bartender seemed to have a very generous pour of the vodka which I always appreciate! Our food came out in a reasonable amount of time, and I couldn't have been more pleased with my crepes. The crepes themselves were perfectly thin and airy and filled with scrambled eggs and smoked ham. The best part was for sure the rich and creamy four cheese sauce drizzled over the top. Very toothsome. My boyfriend's meal, on the other hand, was not so great. For one, they brought him a plate of plain french toast instead of the bananas foster he had ordered. Since he was hesitant to send it back and wait even longer, he resigned himself to just eating what was in front of him. After a few bites, he put his fork down and described it as "flavorless." I was skeptical that he was just in a complainey mood at this point, and tried a bite for myself, but he was right. "Flavorless" was a pretty accurate description. The bread was very visibly burnt and it tasted as though it has been quickly flipped in the egg batter and would have benefitted from more of a soak. I could taste a hit of cinnamon in the batter, but other than that there wasn't much going on in the flavor department. After awhile the bartender came to check on us and my bf mentioned he thought his order was missing the Bananas Foster componenet. The bartender studied his plate for a moment and agreed. He came back with a teapot full of the elusive Bananas Foster topping and suggested my boyfriend spoon it over the top. He left without giving him a spoon to do so with, which kind of drove my boyfriend over the top. His french toast was by now cold and he was just over being in the restaurant at this point and ready to go. Can't say I blame him. All in all, I really enjoyed my food and wasn't particularly bothered by the service hiccups. I would happily go back to try it again, but it's safe to say it will be a pretty tough sell to entice my boyfriend to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ham &amp; Egg Crepes, Bloody Mary, and &#34;Bananas Foster&#34; French Toast

WUAi0yMnY44cfNDdbT1X8Q.text: This is my favorite restaurant in South Park. Whether you go for breakfast, lunch, or dinner... you will not be disappointed. For dinner, I order the chicken salad with a side of fries. Oh my gosh. The fries are the best I've ever had and the chicken salad is incredible. I love the romantic atmosphere and the attentive servers (always kind and welcoming). I feel like I'm eating at my Aunt Diane's kitchen when I eat here. Well done.

5Xa-ia01Xwxn-GURarVY-g.text: We love coming here! Best food, prices and service. Love the trout and French onion soup

FPoQWOOQjfFuEfSPs7gN5w.text: I came here for a working breakfast with my team at work. I've had this place bookmarked for years now. I don't venture to this side of town often so I was pretty excited.  The restaurant is very large but still intimate. The place is clean and the restrooms are lovely.   I didn't have any coffee but others claimed it that it wasn't very strong.   I ordered the smoked salmon eggs Benedict. Very good. The eggs were properly cooked. I didn't care for the side of hash/potato at all. My meal was good but honestly, nothing wowed me. Others at my table ordered the french country breakfast and the seafood omelet with no complaints.   Overall, this restaurant wasn't too bad. Personally, I don't understand all of the hype. I would probably come back to try lunch but probably not breakfast. It could be a possibility that maybe my palette isn't refined enough to appreciate Cafe Monte but it is what it is.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict

4uupZ029ftbjEAAlGG-6vQ.text: Always a treat to dine here. Enjoy the scratch made Hollandaise sauce, beniets and brunch service. Friendly staff too.  Can't go wrong.

Z6-VrHYCwPxQ-eQT07pgHA.text: This place is located in the south park area ergo it gets a lot of traffic and its always packed. That being said, it's not all its cracked up to be. If you go on a Saturday, expect a large crowd and loud music to the point you cannot hear yourself.  The food is ok. I'm not going to do a cartwheel over it at all. Definitely not worth the long wait.

fE72sIqyn7ds6BS7eL6amQ.text: A wonderful place for a meal, treat, or drink!  Ask for Maddy - she was behind the bar, and her service was brilliant.

IYEZcZA98GHylv7MRD9dFg.text: I love this place! It's right next door to my apartment so I often find myself here for weekend brunch. I dream about their Florentine quiche. It's so dang good. Also you can get it with their shoestring fries which are addictive. Adorable atmosphere and attentive, kind staff.

Ho3yhBA9om_jjvz-SREoEA.text: I just finished my meal and am waiting for dessert (tiramisu) and I have to say this, this is one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. Along with the rest of the staff who are all lovely. I have to appreciate the waitress, Lisa. While she is very knowledgeable about wine and will make the best recommendations not only with wine but food as well. She will make everything sound exactly as it is... delicious.

WN_0coqP4vrtJ7ZQLXt2Ng.text: When I  was first moving to the area, my realtor brought me to Cafe Monte for breakfast, and I remember a good experience. We sat inside, and I had the Eggs Benedict. Today went to lunch, and did have a reservation--my dining companion likes to eat outside.  Our reservation was for 1:00.  Our table was not ready and had to wait about fifteen minutes.  Another person showed up, and was seated right away at a table outside, they too must have had a reservation.  My guess is they were regulars, as the waiter seemed to know them, and spent a fair amount of time talking with them. Our waiter was very slow and seemed to spend a lot of time socializing with the regulars who were seated before us. We finally did give our drink order.  We have a running test, my girlfriend likes lime in her water, and we will always order, asking for lime--the test is if they actually listen and bring the lime or lemon--our waiter did not pass. My girlfriend had the Quiche Lorraine, and I had the Beef Short Rib Baguette, which is supposed to be their more popular sandwich.  The sandwich -- short rib, caramelized onions, provolone cheese and arugula.  I could not detect any onions, and the sandwich was too greasy for me--I couldn't finish it.  The quiche was very good, and my girlfriend finished her whole plate, which doesn't happen often, so you know it was good. Our waiter never did come around to ask how everything was, never asked if I wanted another drink, must have been too distracted talking with the regulars at the other table.  I was finally able to flag our waiter down to ask for our check.  The hostess didn't seem very friendly as well. I would think management or the owner realize that the hostess is the first impression and the wait staff represent the establishment.  The restaurant was not that busy, so I really can't understand the slow service.  Based on this experience, I don't think I'd go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Short Rib Baguette-the menu sets with caramelized onions--I don&#39;t recall any onions, and too greasy for me.
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Quiche Lorraine with frittes- very good

55124dHp_fQqJlmfhffQNw.text: My friend, Arlene, told me that I would love Cafe Monte and she was completely correct.   Normally, I am a little hesitant on fru fru French places as I don't like all the heavy sauces and cremes.  Today, I might have had the best egg white omelet ever. I told the server exactly what I wanted in it. It was elegantly presented on the plate and simply  delectable. They served it with a cup of fruit, some really good toasted bread, and a potato cake that looked like a muffin. Not sure where they got the strawberry jam from, but I need access to their strawberry patch!  I had to get a little extra, which was no problem.  My bread likes lots of jam.  /  Superb service, stunning atmosphere, and overall one of my best dining experiences yet.  Parking can be a bit challenging, so go there knowing that it might take a few circles around the parking lot to find a place.   Trust me, it's well worth the effort.   Two Thumbs up and then some.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

DorHBVwPF2Bo40KIJgxYLQ.text: Wow, what a great find.  Our first step across the threshold told us we discovered our "go-to" place.  Can't remember the last time such a warm and embracing smile greeted us at a podium.  We were there for a long lingering supper and after a moment or two, Alex knew exactly what we wanted.  He brought a sip from which we selected the night's special red, hot "crusty-on-the-outside-soft-on-the-inside" French bread and European cultured butter as only the French serve.  We selected the 4-cheese fondue which we lapped up to the very end.  My only suggestion is it could have used a little more gruyere or something to give it a tad more zip.  Our salmon was better than we could have done ourselves - and probably a better grade, as well.  We finished with the lemon curd tart: a perfect end to a wonderful evening.  I want to return, again, tonight, but Kate says she accepted an invitation to have to her sister's.  What I love about Cafe Monte is the ability to have what you want for as long as you want, or even to sit solo at the bar.  No place is nirvana to everyone, but Cafe Monte comes close.  If the young people would yank themselves away from their corporate chains just once, they'd learn to spend less on better food while supporting the local economy and our Charlotte families.  Cafe Monte sets the standard for quality, ambience, creativity and service.  It exemplifies how horrid the corporate chain restaurant is.

7HdvU-l8FMnOw-I8hqPJ9Q.text: I really like Cafe Monte but the service is either excellent or really subpar. Sometimes you get bread sometimes you don't. The last time we went our lattes weren't lattes. I wish that it was more guaranteed service and quality. But when it's good it's fantastic.

Fgb1ZFpWqzltX3NCRIKPsw.text: Food was delicious. Quiche was wee bit over-cooked. Had to wait/ask for dessert fork; server seemed to be new. Will definitely be back.

pqFr425K5SYJf23FDWM0ZQ.text: New favorite brunch spot. The food was delicious. The eggs were perfect and not dry, the bacon was crispy on the edges & it had flavor! The beignets were hot and tasty. Our server was on point and so professional. Only negatives which are so minimal... but the water doesn't seem filtered so get sparkling water if that bothers you. Also the mimosas are $8 which it would be nice if they were a little less since they come in champagne flute. The food is reasonably priced for the quality and quantity. Will def be coming back soon.

QUd_BlO0JP4NNIZQvr1xmQ.text: The area was very quaint and the restaurant had a cute French set up. You can tell the thought that was put into constructing the concept of this restaurant. The food was good but it in my opinion nothing too extravagant. I ordered the salmon which came with mashed potatoes and a veggie medley primarily made up of squash and zucchini and I would say my fav part was the mashed potatoes. My cousin let me taste the trout which I will say I can see why it's a fan favorite but her potatoes and green beans looked extremely dry. I will say if in the area I would go again but def don't see myself craving the food here

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

ab1BsVLw5HZMLEt-VDzZFA.text: Cafe Monte is one of our favorite places to eat in Charlotte. Our waitress, Fabiola, was very personable! Love the brunch items on the menu like Eggs Benedict and the Country Breakfast. Our son loved the Croque Madame, which is Croque Monsieur with an fried egg on it! Celebrating Easter early since they are booked up on Sunday. Glad they are on Open Table.

wD9Qxi5rFLzHxJl4RUw9OQ.text: Make a reservation, or wait.  I ordered the seafood crepe...overall the food and coffee were great.   However, the atmosphere in this place is just stale. The people aren't very pleasant at all. I'm from NJ so you'd think I wouldn't care, but I do. When in Rome...since moving down here, I find most of the places I visit, the people are extremely nice and accommodating, I mean SUPER NICE! So whenever I go to a business and people are not, it really stands out.   I like to enjoy the COMPLETE experience of eating. I would never eat with someone I didn't like, not unless there was endless wine, so I'd eventually not even care. Point is, the food is really good, but I doubt we'll be back.

JInhkerap5N5nXppswFMJw.text: Great french restaurant in SouthPark (in the building next to Whole Foods)! I was in town due to Hurricane Irma and staying in the new Homewood Suites hotel across the street.   The location is great with plenty of parking. They have outdoor seating as well for the beautiful weather lately. I came in early Saturday and it was definitely busy with a 45 minute wait. Thankfully, the bar seating is first come first serve and there were two seats available.   The service was excellent and the food was just amazing. I had a delicious almond latte and mimosas with my meal. We ordered the rib sandwich and baguette with various butter and jam. Everything was so good! I came in a few days later and also tried the waffle and fresh berries. It was great!   There are so many great selections! This is a great place for brunch, business meetings, or just some time to catch-up with family and friends. I look forward to visiting again!

5SYYw8YQhW-p-2erhGTNxw.text: When it comes to brunch benedict, I expect a variety of flavors with savory spices and delicately poached eggs. While cafe monte had a quaint atmosphere and charming staff, their lack of flavor will keep me from going back. The poached eggs were over cooked, the hollandaise sauce was bland, however, the beignet was light and fluffy. If you want a cup of coffee and a French beignet-this is the place for you! Just stay away from their brunch options.

ZOCt_LNjVCSDPFuyO2LBcg.text: I really enjoyed my crab cakes benedict here and the shrimp crepes looked fabulous as well.  It was super-busy on a Friday at lunchtime with a 45-min wait!  Luckily I was able to snag some bar seats that you can seat yourself.  The lovely girl behind the bar was swamped as she was the only one working behind the bar at that time taking care of 20 customers at the counter, plus walk-up/take-out customers as well as making beverages for the table servers.  She took good care of us though and with a smile.  The restaurant itself is very tastefully decorated with some delicious breakfast, brunch, lunch and dinner options.  I definitely would call ahead for reservations in the future and not chance the long wait.  The parking lot fills up very quickly as well, but there is parking at whole foods lot (if you're lucky) or around the Hampton Hotel or the other Phillips Place business.  There is a stair up to the restaurant from Phillips Place, so it's easy to get to if that's where you park.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Crepes

Bd9Zd0jALADH8-b3P2EwYA.text: We have visited Cafe Monte several times. The food is always good. One of our favs is the French onion soup but today they ran out of it...hmm a French restaurant runs out of French onion soup. The wait staff always seems overworked and rushed. The restaurant seems understaffed. However, our server was excellent!! Two things that need attention are getting tables cleared off in a timely manner and the manager actually "managing". When we left the restaurant at 9pm on a Saturday the manager was sitting at the bar. Meanwhile there was definitely work to be done.

xWG_MIa73IzIsGCBxCrxzw.text: If I could give this place no stars I would. Terrible service and terrible food. The food is dry and bland and nothing about this place is represented here in the reviews. We took my mother here for an early Mother's Day lunch and we ordered after waiting forever and then my mom found a bone in the chicken salad sandwich, the French toast tastes like a kitchen sponge according to my sister and and nothing but onions in the Lorraine quiche and not gluten friendly as far as many options for those. AVOID IF YOU WANT A GOOD MEAL!!!!

QxSn-ddsUU6Kkk2MnZr38g.text: seanis the best sever I've ever had please request him always kind and prompt the food is literally some of the best in town burger royal and short rib sandwich are amazing

bj6dQFgM3TpVIQHBw-d9oQ.text: I ordered the tuna melt and it was amazing!! Super friendly stuff and awesome vibe! Definitely would go back

CFyNyIe_MvBOgiIvsX8haA.text: Very cute place. Reminds me of a french cafe upon walking in. We were seated quickly but our server took some time to get to us. I will say it was busy though. We had the pate as an appetizer, was alright. My husband got the steak and frites, it was delicious! I had the mushroom pizza, nothing to write home about. The bottom was not crispy at all. Id like to give it another try.

Cyiv49vPJtNBuba98gzgeg.text: Second visit was better than the first - we brought our 4-year old who gushed over the grilled cheese (and I agreed, good cheese in a grilled cheese makes all the difference)! My lump crab salad was delish and my husband's risotto was perfectly cooked. It's not a "cheap" meal out, but you pay for quality - the place was definitely jam packed and proceeded to stay that way.... We ended the meal with the vanilla macarons and while quite pricey, they were fresh this time around (they were broken and semi-stale last time). Quality was by far improved - the only downside was the hostess who took awhile to see us and approached us while talking on the phone "I will be right with you" - felt a bit off but as noted, it all came together!

8uGGtHr8KjNBQl_7jAKZPQ.text: Just enjoyed an amazing meal.  Excellent service!  Our waiter, Jay, suggested the Duck Confit Salad and Escargot appetizers which both were excellent.  The specials, Beef Wellington and pan fried Grouper equally delicious!  Wonderful atmosphere.  We will be back for more!

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef Wellington

z-JvJvehJpEdpn55UNc0Zg.text: Everything was perfect. Especially the poached eggs. Which is so rare. The food is delicious and the environment is relaxing.

wfomxDM0kFNyuMWMPj8nxw.text: This restaurant is tucked in Phillips Place,  next to the Whole Foods, and located on the corner of the building and looks small from the outside, but is spacious on the back.   We went for dinner,  around 8:00, and the place was busy but not packed. The prices are on the expensive side but not terribly expensive. It is a great place for a date or double date. It was supposed to be jazz night but I have not noticed live band, but heard jazz music pumping from the .   We started with cheese fondue which was great, not too sour and without aftertaste that grocery store bought fondue leaves.  The bread that accompanies the fondue was superb, wished we could take home some.    We ordered for our plat principal the shrimp risotto and the trout Amandine, both were flavorful and great. I was eyeing the crepes but decided for the trout,  and it didn't disappoint me; I will try the crepes next time.  As dessert we ordered the beignettes and came 6 BIG pieces,  enough for 3 to eat. With wine glasses and coffee our bill came out $78, which was worth it, but hoped it would be a little less than that.   Definitely returning in the near future for another meal!

oAO5zNS917iQn8ufP0KODA.text: We checked yelp reviews and picked this place, and it was well worth it.   Great food and atmosphere

-pKiL3pVVLk-OkStghz0gQ.text: Great atmosphere but food is not very flavorful. I had a salmon croissant with a side salad and fruit tart for dessert. The fruit tart was not sweet at all and the croissant was loaded with cucumbers, just didn't work on the sandwich. It is also very expensive for the lackluster quality of food. Two meals and a kids meal with two desserts were over $60 after tip and we drank water!  If I needed to grab a quick coffee and muffin I'd probably stop in but being the Whole Foods is right next door and offers better tasting food, I doubt I'll be back.

Q2dcFU0RCquQIsz5GWZYjg.text: As usual... the same great flair and comrade re.  Bravo n music starting now.  Even if u come in early or alone u will get the same attention as a party of 10.  Never had a bad meal or glass. U need to get with this.  Peace

pH7fK1_IHavYb2Hc-kHKNg.text: This is and will remain one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. The food, atmosphere, and service are almost always perfect. I just will not order the lump crabmeat salad again...it arrived, a beautiful mixed greens salad, with a tiny mold (about the size of an individual serving can of cat food) of bits of crabmeat...distinctly not "lump". It is a pricey salad, as you would expect, but I think they are making too much profit on this one. Definitely not worth the money.  Cafe Monte...you can do better!

YATTjEFX9sUMQH47XOLLkA.text: Hostess was rude. One of them anyway; the other was stunning. Atmosphere inviting and relaxing.  Wait staff phenomenal. Food was fantastic. Good wine selection. French beers even, if you can trust the French in a brewery. But alas, no Creme Brulee. How could a restaurant professing French in title run out of that?

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

OLUBXBVj6j6sTE-jBSgwdw.text: Very uneven service tonight. Menu has also gotten tired.  We will be looking for another go-to Southpark restaurant.

42E-MekD_DxXKqzyuUM7qg.text: I visited with a friend of mine for dinner. We had the Escargot, Risotto and Beef Short Rib Bourguignonne. The escargot were delicious, fragrant with garlic and butter. The risotto was filled with flavor. The short rib itself was a little underwhelming, It lacked seasoning, in contrast to the vegetables that accompanied it, which were sublime.   Regardless the best part of the night was our waiter, Jay. He was radiant and always available with suggestions and wit. I would definitely recommend that you give this restaurant a try.

Pq09k8SjZfwbVAp9RRU4Og.text: I came here for brunch and left feeling a little underwhelmed with the food.  The other people at my table seemed satisfied with their meals but mine came out unappealing.  I ordered the smoked ham crepes.  I guess maybe I was expecting real ham and not diced deli quality ham.    The second thing is with the sauce, it was splattered all over the plate with no real quality to the presentation.  A real chef would have cleaned up the splatterings so it looked presentable.    And the last thing is that the dish really had no flavor to it.  It was all sort of bland.    Frankly, I've had better breakfasts at a chain restaurant.  Additionally water glasses often went unfilled.  Here's a suggestion, if you notice that people are drinking a lot of water, leave a pitcher on the table so they can refill themselves instead of having to wait for a server.    Sorry Cafe Monte, I really thought you were better than this.

gK65SRQtdZj2gk9mM60YkA.text: Met my aunt on Saturday for breakfast. We arrived at 9AM when the restaurant opened so there was obviously no wait. The waiter was friendly and promptly took our drink orders, we also ordered our food with the drinks.   I saw steak and eggs so I went with that, medium rare/poached. I was amazed at how much food came out on the plate. The steak and eggs looked amazing but so did the freshly sliced tomatoes, fried potato round and the croissant. Not only did everything look good but it tasted amazing. The steak was tender, moist and perfectly seasoned. It seems like the best steaks I've had are for breakfast! The croissant was warm out of the oven and melted in my mouth, it was phenomenal.   I definitely look forward to coming back to Cafe Monte for breakfast or any other meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak and poached eggs, duh.

U9DDSAA8_SFtkPS2OolmpA.text: Whether it's their wine dinners or Sunday brunch, this restaurant brings creative classics and great service.  The price point is easy  and the food is yummy.  The atmosphere is a little crowded, but lively.  The wait staff is always knowledgeable and personable.  Always a treat!

6Ak0GkV_7Bb_UIYnmXJNaw.text: I wanted to love this restaurant from the moment I walked in.  A Sunday brunch with friends let me experience the ambiance, delicious food, great pastries (thanks Amelie's), and rocking bloody mary's.  From this description alone you'd expect a 5 star rating, but with this restaurant it's the service which destroys it.  It often times feels like you're playing Russian Roulette with a 4 bullets loaded.  I just don't understand it.  The first time we went it was magical.  The second time we went (also with another couple) the service began to show its wear and tear.  All the other times were a toss up between amazing and atrocious with no indicators to give you advance warning.  The last straw for me came after a very difficult day in which my wife and I were hoping Cafe Monet could turn it around.  From the first impression we could tell the waitress would rather be having a root canal than take our order.  This wasn't the first time we'd encountered that look in Cafe Monte, but with an almost empty restaurant (we went in early) you think she'd want to milk every ounce of tip she could  Attitude dripped from her monologue and our lack of alcoholic drink orders brought a sigh to her lips.  All I wanted, nay... craved, was a chocolate croissant and an almond croissant warmed up.  This was the text book definition of a SIMPLE order.  I'll give you a second to figure out what happened next.  She screwed it up.  She gave me a chocolate croissant and then an almond chocolate croissant.  She didn't care less about the screw up.  After tasting the incorrect almond croissant I asked for the correct one to be brought out.  She snagged the plate and then disappeared.  Actually, most of the time she was disappeared which is an amazing feat for an empty restaurant.  When the correct croissant finally came out it was cold.  C'mon.... seriously?  I asked for it heated up and received barely lukewarm.  Suffice it say, my tip reflected her total lack of caring.  I'm done with this place.  If I want French I'll go to Georges Brasserie and if I want pastries then I'll go to Amelie's.

WDo9vtuBNXgjqLwtrXRFrA.text: Love this place! It doesn't advertise much and it's not on the side of the road with huge signs. So it took us a while to notice the place, but now that we love the place, my wife and I think that it's actually nice that not 'everybody' knows this place.  It's a really wonderful, pretty looking place with an awesome team of people who knows what service is. They know what they have and they know how to make what they have sound delicious. Most importantly, they were patient with us asking if we could get pictures or what the menu was.  And the food... I had the Duck Confit. It was great! I usually like the taste but dislike the aftertaste or the flavor some duck dish have. In this case, it was a hit. Out of the ball park! And how about the salmon my wife ordered. It was also delicious. Our drinks were fabulous as well.  Lastly, we were lucky and got to hear the wonderful band play some jazz music too. I felt like I was back in Europe. So if you like that kind of atmosphere, and if you like duck and seafood, go check it out. I promise, it won't disappoint.

6rB03umiWEmuaArFvoe8Vg.text: My friends and I were looking to try something new this Sunday for brunch and this place seemed to have it all. The brunch menu was filled with tons of choices and seemed to have something for everyone. We started off with beignets that just melted in your mouth. Next we ordered escargot baked in butter garlic puff pastries that was excellent and had a beautiful presentation. The sandwich I decided on was the beef short rib baguette and it was to die for! Great job and we will be back for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Escargot
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Short rib baguette

hP62ogBRTotkpJb2NzdS4Q.text: We had a perfect Sunday brunch from start to finish!  I made the reservations via OpenTable on Saturday night for a 10am Sunday brunch, we woke up earlier than expected and hungry.  It was super easy to update my reservation to 9am using the app. We arrived just before 9am and were warmly welcomed by the hostess.  We were seated right away and our waiter brought us waters.  My husband ordered Benedict Monte and I got Crab Cake Benedict.  I don't like runny eggs so I asked for mine to poached medium-hard.  As surprising as is may be, it is rare for a restaurant to get my eggs right, but Cafe Monte poached them PERFECTLY.  I almost couldn't believe it.  My meal was absolutely divine.  And the small bite of my husband's was very good as well.  We completed the meal with a Nutella crepe and fresh strawberries. One word: YUM!   All the staff we encountered were pleasant, friendly, and helpful.  Our waiter was attentive without being annoying.  Our entire experience was fantastic.  We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nutella Crepe with Strawberries
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab Cake Benedict
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Monte Benedict

y-PcqoRrkLyiWkvp0_dNPg.text: Just tried Cafe Monte last Friday night and was pleasantly surprised! I usually "pass" on strip mall/shopping center restaurants (Yes, Philips Place, you are a shopping center), but you are truly in another place once you walk inside Cafe Monte. The ambiance is really intimate, but casual - live music in the front, dim lights (but not dark and creepy).   Our table was in the farrrrrr back corner, probably not my first choice - but they sat us for our reservation the second we walked in which is the way it should be! I love restaurants that are organized and know how to handle reservations!  Our waiter was sort of attentive and sort of nice - but everything else was so good, I can let that go. We had the Steak Frites and Salmon - both were really delish! Next time will probably skip the steak and go for the crepes and something from the appetizer menu. Maybe fondue?  The wine list had affordable options, their house white was a nice pinot grigio for 22 bucks. But, my favorite part of dinner was the chocolate mousse with fresh fruit for $6. Yum yum yum. My friend and I shared it and didn't even finish the whole thing (but we were also stuffed from dinner).   Cute place, would love to go back!

d5cLQkeXGhtgQSQztF89tQ.text: My wife and I celebrated our 5th anniversary this weekend. The ambience, staff and food made it a very memorable experience. It was extremely busy on Saturday, but we managed to find a place at the corner of the bar that was quiet and intimate.   We had several delicious small plates including a salad with strawberries, a cheese plate with a freshly baked baguette and the most amazing burger we've had. Our server even gave us complimentary glasses of champagne which accompanied our carrot cake. We would have tried the chocolate tart that  looked amazing but it had already sold out.   We would definitely return and highly recommend this restaurant.

IwzxSgeDDQu3mxUTnPj3Sg.text: Delightfully surprised as I am not a fan of French cuisine but my wife brought me here and I'll be returning!! Good was great, coffee superb and atmosphere is peaceful.  Delightful jewel in the crown of SouthPark!

A5wccbTAj6kvct5lGxBgtw.text: BE CAREFUL, you might want to pay with cash.  My wife went there two weeks ago for lunch, left a 20% tip and they added another $1.00 for good measure.  That is my review.  Enjoy!

-PLjE0JsvRRXGj9xVDpPng.text: Glad this wasn't our first time here.  On a busy new year's Eve day for brunch, the place was just not on the same page.  People who came in after us finished their meal before ours came out.  The sausage I ordered was ice cold.  Nothing more disgusting than cold meat.  I ordered no toast due to dietary issues, of course they pile toast on my plate.  I'm very sensitive to sugar.  My kid ordered fruit instead of fries... got fries of course.  When we complained, they bring over macaroons, which of course I cannot eat.  Nice thought with an equal amount of thoughtlessness.  Poor form today.  Gotta clean it up, or this might be the last time in.  Pay better attention to details.

eiBQmnmgK-Vn_sS_YWXDfg.text: We went for our first time this weekend and loved it! It was a rainy Saturday so the "french bistro" atmosphere seemed perfect. We got a table quick and had a very attentive server who gave us the full rundown of the best items on the menu.  Outside of the cute set up - the food was amazing! Zero exaggeration - the best French Onion soup I've tasted to date, and that's saying a lot. My bf had the french dip sandwich and it was perfectly cooked in every way. Hot with melted cheese and just the right amount of au jus. I had the banana flambe nutella crepes and they were excellent. They also had great looking pastries and every kind of coffee you could think of. Overall, great place with great service and great food. Will definitely be back!

1G_Zq9LtFckueRaXpa8bMQ.text: This is such a cute brunch spot! I was craving some french toast and Cafe Monte was the closest place with decent ratings. I of course got the brioche french toast with a side of bacon. The french toast itself had 4 very huge and fluffy slices of brioche bread. It was airy and buttery and toasted just enough to get the crust hard, but soft in the middle. Very good for a simple french toast. I also got their coffee and it was delicious. It was a bit strong black, but with a little bit of milk it was perfect. I've noticed most of the customers are older ladies and I think the ambiance caters to that. Would love to come back and try an actual french dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brioche French Toast w/side of Bacon (in the back)

m73jmgTjMKjWsL2pZFLglA.text: French stuff intimidates me--Chanel, Bastille Day, their food, wine, accents and the list goes on.   But once again I was introduced to a new place thanks to my bff, Groupon. I went here the other day for breakfast and it was decent. I split the eggs benedict (quite tasty) with another Yelper while sipping on coffee....when we could get refills that is . Even though there were only three other times in the place (so want to say joint but thought I would class it up a bit), our waiter seemed to be MIA most of the time.  You know what would make this place better? A little person who goes by the name of Monte walking around to each table in a striped shirt, beret and thick mustache while reading french poetry. Cmon, how can that not make you smile??

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

2aVBNb7Jwiq27FWdfO-f-w.text: I went to Cafe Monte during restaurant week. Surprisingly it wasn't very busy. However, I still didn't receive the best service. It was as if the server was just going through the motions because he knew he was going to get the 18% tip that was added to every bill during restaurant week.   The food was very good however the portions were extremely small. There was a couple next to us who seemed to not order off the Restaurant week menu and for what I could tell the portions seemed larger. So they might have reduced portions for the special menu that week.  The escargot was amazing. The Caesar salad and tomato bisque was just okay. For an entree I got the Fillet Oscar which was cooked to perfection. I will definitely stop back and try it again during a normal time and hope for better service.

HEx_fvQTZ_Mh6aQRNdFZyQ.text: When I walked in, I noticed how warm and inviting the atmosphere was. I checked out the fresh desserts, and my mouth salivated. The menu offered an array of fresh French dishes, including escargot, duck, and crepes. Brian and I split the lobster and crab cakes, along with the mussels and frites (french fries). Our meals were decadent, fresh, and flavorful. The service was superb. The price was extremely modest for the quality of food we received. The portions were generous, and our experience was wonderful. Would I recommend Cafe Monte? Absolutely. If you are in the area, check it out. Bon Appetit! Read more about my experience here: ginapacelli.com/2015/04/...

Tr8e2HGruJrHn7qHwiophg.text: All I can say is this restaurant is amazing and totally impressive every time I go! Hubby and I went for dinner last night. It was a lovely evening, so we got to sit outside on the patio. Our waiter, Shane, was very attentive and personable!  I got the Risotto special that had rich, perfectly seared scallops and lots of fresh vegetables! It was so creamy and savory, I loved every bite! And luckily I brought home leftovers for another enjoyable meal!  My husband had the monkfish special which was over potatoes and vegetables. He really liked it as well! Staff is wonderful and the menu is amazing! We are definitely going back and we don't eat out that much!

qihDyeYWR4KTDWMRtZgtcQ.text: This is one of our regular places. Always really good specials and french martini is yummy. Just go and love it.

0-LV-QP1CfzEWDvOPRi3hg.text: Went for brunch today with my wife, and we had an outstanding experience. The food was exceptional as was the service by Jennifer.   My wife had a Caesar salad and the mussels and frites entree. I went the breakfast route and had the florentine omelette which came with fruit, a potato hashbrown thing and toast with butter and jam. Everything was perfect Just to press our luck we ordered a tiramisu. Also perfect.   I don't leave reviews very often because it's so easy to rant when things go poorly. It's nice to have a compelling reason to leave a positive review. We highly recommend this place!

dMFPNgYzgkbWsBTZj_lFxg.text: Menu options we great - decent selection for vegetarians and gluten free individuals. Was very upset with the quality of the food itself. None of the food we received was seasoned (even the slightest), the waffle came out incredibly cold, etc.   I really wish the quality of the food was better. Maybe I'll come here again in the future... for the time being I'm disappointed.

GNo-69fBQtEhlTo8SFJ6hg.text: This review is just for brunch. I had a very bad dinner during restaurant week. I would only visit cafe monte for the brunch. Good selection and flavor doesn't dissapoint.  Crisp airy waffles and the hollandaise sauce for the Eggs Benedict was well made. It can get a bit loud and very crowded though.

sHKoOM9NQB7cbcwLzuypMQ.text: Had a great experience here for brunch. They don't advertise it but do have a gluten free menu (that has a lot of options) and it's clear their staff has been trained.  The food was delicious-only reason I'm rating 4 stars instead of 5 is because of the prices and a very slow server

DkVDBbkNlfAUx9uaHH7yag.text: My first check in getting ready for my first review tonight!   : )  My very first check in and my very first review! I have been to Cafe Monte many times, but never reviewed because I did not use Yelp. However, since I use Yelp often to find reviews, and I am moving to NYC in 3 weeks and will be using Yelp A LOT, I thought it only fair to start contributing. So I headed to Cafe Monte with my main man, Dudley.  I sat outside at the little 2 person tables on the side of the building. It was very hot outside, but I am a summer fanatic. My server was very sweet and was a great balance between taking care of my needs and letting me do some work on my laptop and relax with my dog (free WiFi yay!).   I got there right at 3:30 and they had switched over to the dinner menu, but they still let me use my lunchtime groupon anyway. No guilt trip whatsoever about it! I ordered the Chicken Mushroom crepes and a side of the Gruyere scalloped potatoes. I have included pictures.  The crepes were so, so, so good. Most enjoyable was the yummy cream sauce as well as the TONS of mushrooms. I will be ordering a lot of mushroom dishes as they are my favorite food in the entire world. The chicken seemed as if it were pulled from the bone- very tender and flavorful. There were about 3 or 4 well stuffed crepes with chicken, 3 different kinds of mushrooms (that I could tell), and that delicious sauce.  The potatoes were not as amazing as I had hoped. They were very thick slices of russet type potatoes with a ton of butter and Gruyere cheese only on top. It would have been great if they had more cheese through the dish. They were ok, but I only ate a couple of bites.  They were so canine friendly! My waitress offered and promptly brought out a bowl of water for Dudley, which after he was done drinking, became his plate. Duds loved the crepes and potatoes, and for a dog he is somewhat picky, so that says something!  I love this place. So much good stuff, and on my next trip back, I will make it much earlier so I can do breakfast!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. They gave Duds a bowl of water which later doubled as his dining dish. He&#39;s so excited to eat!
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Close up of my side of Gruyere scalloped potatoes. Could have used a bit more cheese.
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The crepes were stuffed full of yummy chicken and TONS of mushrooms!  : )

mHvvTAhJqId86hPZWS1B-w.text: This is one of those places that is "fancy does not equate to good food". One review on here said they have the best crepes in Charlotte, seriously? Have you tried Hazelnut Creperie? I personally thought their food is a bit dry, portion extremely small. Ok, I admit, most fancy places have small portions. However, I found nothing exciting or special about this place at all. The food was edible, the atmosphere is nice and upscale, and that is about it. I also ordered Wine, it is Ok, came chilled, but flavor wise it is just average.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

0_uejB9f3kcGppnIKUtVxg.text: First of all, this is not a gen-x-er restaurant for brunch.  It was a nice surprise though. We got here early and by 10 the place was full and the vibe was great. The Jazz music was not my favorite, it was not detracting.   Food: we were worried that we would have to stop at Wendy's because these pricey places tend to have small portions, especially when the menu is a-la-carte. I'm full so all is right with the world.   Coffee: French toast was not too sharp. Cafe au Lait and Cafe Americana were both good, not 3.85 and 3.25 good, but good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fruta del Mar omelet had a lot smoked salmon. But by Italian standards, it was spot on.
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken and wild mushroom in white wine cream sauce......rich and balanced flavor. Lots of chicken pieces too.

WE6PQ5N7_14nh-6FzSx6PQ.text: My wife and I go here a lot. Birthdays and anniversaries are almost always celebrated here. And we have taken almost every family member who has come to town to Cafe Monte.  The food is always great. We've never had anything we didn't like. And Shawn and Jenny are amazing waiters. If you can't get one, get the other.  Our family and friends are always impressed. And my mom recently said, "it's refreshing to go to a restaurant where you feel like you are being served by a friend and that you are the only people that matter."  We honestly rather spend our special occasions with Shawn or Jenny than go anywhere else.

kXqlCWY5pi-Wi8rlcd4S7w.text: Their food is always delicious!  Their pizza was excellent and their veggie crepe was delish!  Will be coming back for more!
