NbiB8mkJrJI9I-dHfMQdog.text: This place is incredible. Beef Wellington Saturday's are soo good. Their espresso martinis are superb. Our last waitress Jenny was the best so far, the staff is always good, but her recommendations and attention to us was exemplary. Love this place!

Z9Mysab3VcchdGlIneLOcA.text: Decided to try something new on a Friday morning for brunch. Coffee was tasty, but service was slow. The seafood omelette was a bit wet (in a puddle).  But the quiche was tasty. Not the best experience for the price.   Mixed reviews on whether we would go back.

2nPi7J5qSRE8PBW5A_rTEQ.text: Love it! Glad we finally made it here and perfect for my husband's bday weekend! We will be back.

6XH_4iaH2sFzyRg0wOOPsA.text: I've dined here several times.   Each occasion delivered stellar service, wonderful food, and exquisite attention to detail.  Today, I ordered the crab cake benedict:  eggs were divine, hollandaise sauce spot-on with its requisite tangy notes, and the cakes were more crab than filler.  And, it was served at the proper temperature, too.  My coffee was refilled routinely.   My server, Sean, is a top notch professional that added the punctuation point to my meal.  What's not to like?

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. CRAB CAKE BENEDICT.  Exquisite.  Simple.  Perfect.

zvYG0_5y_ZK29ZWFgqI3Xw.text: Very cute spot for brunch.  I had the quiche Lorraine and a Belgium waffle.  The quiche was bursting with flavor and waffle was buttery, crisp, light and oh so good.

9nW8k-m0K2zsNm_Xcqv8xQ.text: Great place for dinner.   Many delicious entrees on the dinner menu, and excellent service.   Prices are not insane.  We are regulars and always enjoy it.   Best to make a reservation.

bPcz1evu43S7EDlh-ca-Jg.text: Loved this place. Good quality food. Great service. The all you can eat mussels in a white wine sauce with butter and garlic is fabulous. Two thumbs up!

_BwgqH4TMM3bTsCxkC_Sng.text: Wow!!!  The short rib baguette---are you kidding me????  Sssooooo good!!!!  The atmosphere was fantastic for a quick escape from "America"....French music, waiters/waitresses in black vests, white shirts...good place!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

8npkHQHd_ME7dl2Lt0fLww.text: To poach eggs so perfectly when a restaurant is packed is an art form that has been masterfully achieved by Cafe Monte. I feared it was overhyped.  My skepticism was shattered and I can't wait to go back. New favorite brunch in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Benedict Monte with skillet potato post first bite. Perfect.

oLGROmlXQ94_RBchlp-tJw.text: Cafe Monte is the closest place in Charlotte to a French bistro experience. We have now visited several times and have never been disappointed. Always great service, the atmosphere is relaxed and the food is wonderful.

s6SaFGYXqr5VV9AicvpVGg.text: I've lived right next to the restaurant for 2 years and I've never had a bad experience. Their menu and wait staff are phenomenal and always take care of me.  If you are hesitant to go, find a Groupon for them and you won't be disappointed.

A_kg0x58IP93RUbxhIfJGg.text: We love coming here for brunch. You typically need a reservation for Sunday brunch or be prepared to wait for a while. The service is usually good and the food is great. We have our favorites and generally order the same thing- the chicken club and the short rib sandwich. I really like the short rib sandwich, it is so flavorful. The frites are good, thin and crisp.  - I do wish they had something like truffle Parmesan fries. I order an extra side of the garlic aioli to dip my fries in.

6Kb1diKLWlEBpcKE6pRHXg.text: nice spot for lunch or brunch on a rainy Saturday. Kid friendly!  Good food and attentive service.

XicJg9Pm636vfM9z8sWe9A.text: Food is average. The service is very slow!!! My waitress take care of ~9 tables ?!?!   - I made reservation and arrive 10 min earlier. They made us wait for 20 min and finally we got table when I move out and acting like I'm leaving.   - The food is ok. We got trout and crab cakes burger. That's one star. No one come to check on food, of course. Then we wait another 20 min just to get the check. I have to WALK AROUND to chase the waitress to get our bill !!!

xvz0C-X2IKzvNrG8hYoseQ.text: Food is good, great price, but it's a shame, because the service is not.   Ask the server to take a pistachio, French Macaron off the bill, as the Manager told me it tends to be harder than the others after I brought it to her attention. She went to confirm; Manager comes back and says "I offered to give you another one not to take it off the bill, but ok." BRAVO! Great response. Monte would be proud!  Same server gave me a coffee saucer with this random debri on it, I asked what it was, she looked at me puzzled & said, "Coffee grinds" (didn't look like coffee grinds to me) .... "Ma'am please give me another saucer, thank you."

PkyMgX9cM7qzonlOcNMz2w.text: Conrad was the best.  He accommodated is in our wine selections.  He took time to take interest us as customers

KCAo6KB9GNNPl-1NlUOehg.text: Absolutely come here for brunch! The food, service and drinks are all top notch. I've never had a bad experience here!

r9jUS6ZEEK5TbdFp-govbQ.text: Back when I ate things like steak, I used to order the steak and eggs (when someone else was paying) or some sort of quiche (when I was paying). Because let's be reasonable, when you're poor, $17 bucks for steak and eggs isn't exactly the most exciting thing to fork over your hard earned cash for. Delicious, but expensive.  In any case, I used to head over here for brunch on Sundays after a long morning at church or for a working lunch during the week and truly, there are some gems on the menu.  Their pommes frites are delightful, and an excellent complement to many of the sandwiches offered. I make sure they comprise some part of my meal every time. Salads, omelettes, etc. are all great options as well.  As for the dinner situation, I haven't been in the evening. It's just such a lovely little spot for breakfast or lunch.   There's a pastry case that looks fabulous and they have a full-service coffee bar. I usually just order regular, though.  Be warned, however, that there is generally always a wait around peak brunch times on the weekend.

ZivTtgQ5ySahvu6Zw3gG3w.text: Went to Cafe Monte after purchasing a groupon. Made a reservation for a Sat night and off we went for a little date.   Entered to a half full (at best) restaurant that gradually filled up over the time we were there. We were seated at a nice table that was up against a pillar so we didn't have to deal with being in the middle of the room (which I hate).   We were given a wine list and menus upon being seated. I am 5 months pregnant and it really shows at this point and the husband had given up drinking for Lent so we passed on the wines. This seemed to off-put the waiter a little but I let it slide b/c he was still nice enough. Felt like we were a little rushed to make decisions about what we wanted to order and when I asked for more time something about the demeanor of the waiter made me feel bad about it.   We ended up ordering a cheese plate and french onion soup to start. The cheese plate arrives at the table with no explanation as to what the various cheeses are. This really bothers me. There was a cheese that had, what I later asked about, mustard seeds inside of it that was very delicious, but even upon asking about what was in it, all I was given was the answer "mustard seed" and that it was the waiter's favorite cheese. Nothing else about it or the other 3 cheeses on the plate (which I equate to a brie, cheddar and goat). Frustrating.   My husband loved the french onion soup. I took a few bites and found it to be pretty tasty but am not much of a soup person and wasn't in the mood this night so that is all I can say about that.   For entrees I had the steak frites and husband had the flounder special. First let me say that the portion of steak I received was very large, which would have been fantastic, had it been fantastic, but at best I rate it as pretty good. The frites were nothing spectacular, but all seemed to disappear from my plate with no problem so I would def order those again.   Husband's meal came out looking like it was sitting in a stick of melted butter and had an overall greasy appearance. I don't eat fish, so I didn't try this but he later told me it was, in fact, greasy, but that after a few bites he was able to move it out of the drippings and then it actually had a good taste. Both entrees were served with green beans which I could take or leave. Nothing spectacular there.   Ended with an eclair and a coffee for the husband, both of which were enjoyed.   All in all it was a decent meal and I am happy that we went and gave it a try. Perhaps if we had been able to order drinks and wine it would have made the whole experience better, but that just wasn't in the cards right now.  I would like to give big props to the lady who kept my water glass filled until the minute we were getting up from the table! That truly made this thirsty pregnant lady happy.

IZWnWmAfur41OewlaARkuQ.text: Perfect for a quick nosh or a full meal. Top of the line service. Put this on your must visit list.

uhnSyzF9l1LGKKCfR53G_w.text: As always, had a great customer experience and a fabulous brunch...this time on Easter Sunday! It's our favorite brunch location in Charlotte!!!

x5VKb-23fTdklZPjhDaJLw.text: Great food and service, one of our favorites places to go for a celebration or to take company.

qPKShDdzwIzdbMzNxirXCw.text: Love this place. The crab cake sandwich and lobster and crab crepe are awesome. My husband loved the herb chicken.  It's a bit pricey but well worth it!

wgWxtz5Bw9qiLZYxLE4D5g.text: Wow! What a great experience. Sat outside for Sunday breakfast/brunch, Jennifer was our waitress and she was delightful:) Amazing food. Omellete, toast, quiche, crepes, lattes, americanos...all of it. Nice atmosphere too. We will be coming back!

ohqP3S4X_8OTOrxJYx-8ZA.text: After more than three visits, I have tasted a variety of dishes. Everything you would expect from a French restaurant and the service is wonderful. It is conveniently located near the mall and it has small dishes that are delicious and I'll be in budget. Great salads, French onion soup, quiche, and omlettes. My friend sat at the bar and ordered coffee and baguette stat. They delivered with a smile.

1Bd8kRJQz8YzP6LA3rifbQ.text: This place is awesome. I've always had good food there and the service is always friendly and attentive. I've gone for dinner and brunch and they've both been fabulous. One of my favorite entrees is the chicken and mushroom crepe. It's just delicious and creamy and full of flavor. I had a delicious cappuccino and eggs Benedict for brunch which was also delicious. The restaurant is a little unassuming from the outside, but the inside it adorable, with great big pictures of Europe and a cafe feel. Definitely would recommend to anyone!

oRJ7jb_5wmkTH3FPJbWLcA.text: I just experienced the ABSOLUTE WORST SERVICE of my life!!!! My date and I were REFUSED SERVICE at Cafe Monte. Management indicated they were closed at 9:45...despite the signage indicating the close time as 11:00. Not to mention we called ahead and the 11:00pm close time was indicated then as well. The manager was a complete JERK. He was condescending and rude. It was unbelievable!!! To add insult to injury after reluctantly and agitatedly giving us a gift card as we were walking out the manager stated "just remember we close when we feel like it" to which I responded "so how will we know when we can come back?" His response..."you'll figure it out". Unreal! Do not patron this business.

V7Uh3NPaP5Gty3f8Yf-GDA.text: Somehow we've missed this little gem in the heart of Southpark.  We enjoyed the escargot, but mainly went for the live music -- glad we did.  The talented trio not only performed songs in French, but a good many Sinatra hits.  Though the mixed drinks were well mixed, the personalities of the bar staff were flat.

01qJffWdlE7b9KWJDsBbiw.text: Paul was our wajtwe he was awesome.  You could see he had other tables but he never rushed us our food was amazing and we were super happy woth our mimosa.  Thank you Paul.

pr5C1Lj-sbKDe90kYtny-A.text: Mon Dieu! I can't believe I haven't reviewed Cafe Monte until now!  Cafe Monte is a cute little French cafe in South Park. I have been grabbing brunch, lunch and dinner here now for years. For brunch, I particularly love the Fruits de Mer omelette, which beautifully combines my two favorite foods, eggs and seafood (lobster, crab and smoked salmon, oh my!) For $15 dollars, you get a huge seafood packed omelette, fresh fruit, two pieces of delicious grainy bread, and a sand dollar sized hash brown.  I do order other things, but the Fruit de Mer omelette never ceases to delight.  The tomato bisque is another favorite of mine.  The French fries are also perfectly thin and crispy. They are almost too good to be True! And no meal is perfect without one of their exquisitely crafted cappuccinos. One of the best I have had!  It's been too long since I've had dinner there, so I leave you with my brunch recommendations until next time! The duck confit pizza is really calling my name.

-lNJE_U5Lu1d42DBAGM93w.text: This place is wonderful. Fantastic food, great atmosphere, friendly, attentive wait staff. This is one of Charlotte's unsung gems.

cGkc8_sO-_529SAJBQa-GQ.text: The best brunch I've ever had! The smoked salmon eggs Benedict and banana flambe Belgium waffle were delicious! I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great brunch!

5RvcTi-7Mdm4u8HfkJ8yeg.text: Dined a Cafe Monte today with a friend and had a great lunch.  The chicken salad is always great and the atmosphere is buzzing.  The place was packed and the staff were happy and helpful.

oEzDK06lKJdPQB7H-0xCZA.text: Admittedly what Cafe Monte is attempting is difficult.  It's hard to recreate the atmosphere of a French bistroo in an upscalish surburban outdoor mall with convenient parking.  To make it really authentic you'd have to make it just a bit shabbier, with the faint smell of 100 years tobacco use, the tables crowded closer together, the bathroom fixtures 70 years old.... and of course charge 3.00 for a water.  But there you have it..... they can only do so much.  Ambiance was as French as the aforementioned would allow.  Service was fine.  Beers were great.  I had a burger (quelle horreur) but only because I had only two weeks in the States and was on a massive burger run.  It was OKish.   I should have ordered a French menu item.  I have to say the pizzas looked interesting.... if not very Franch.  I'll give them 3.5 stars and stop by again when I'm back in town and maybe order the herbed chicken crepes which sounded good.

uV_QD2MTc4F0NUiLKNOzUA.text: Nice ambiance, friendly and attentive service.  Had Pizza Margarite for lunch.  Nice crust, good amount of cheese...a little salty.  I'm new to town, so I drove around a bit trying to find the location (GPS kept telling me I had arrived, but I hadn't).

JktlmC2d4O4k95Sw1lQM4g.text: Best place in Southpark to get brunch! I recommend the french toast. The staff is always friendly, and you can make a reservation because it does get crowded on Sunday! Love this place.

OzJ-7vPg5P8IrOsJKoCr9Q.text: Wonderful evening!  The atmosphere,  service, food - all were outstanding.  I had salmon. My date had veal shank.  Everything was superb!  The veggies, mashed potatoes -   wonderful. And, the bread is amazing.  Frankie was our server. Job well done!  I am looking forward to returning for breakfast!

2vrKHafJCO8Dl-xA9EKJAg.text: Yummy yummy yummy!! All of it! Had the crab cake sandwhich- but ended up not eating the bun because it was too much- anyways it was so tasty!! The Creole sauce made it better than most other crab cakes. Then split the coconut creme cake with my friend and we could not believe how amazing it was. So moist and every bite was heavenly. I wish I could have seconds! I loved their side salad that came with my meal and it was a very generous amount too which was suprising! Get it with the vinaigrette :)

_1OkM4THwUQlrWkDXBLNnA.text: Ate here for Queens Feast 2017. Lovely French inspired restaurant with a huge menu. Excellent service as well.

1hxQSIvloK5L5bYw3rEMLw.text: My niece and I came here for our Sunday Brunch.  We missed our reservation time and they quoted us 35 minute wait to seat 2,  Our table was ready in 15 minutes.  I was torn between the quiche Lorraine, lobster and shrimp crepes and crab cakes Benedict,  I went with the quiche Lorraine which was served with a side salad. I also ordered french onion soup. My niece went with the steak and eggs.My quiche was cooked perfectly and the soup was great as well. The steak that my niece ordered was very, very small looked like maybe under 3 oz.  Its a good thing that she is a small thing or else she would have certainly not been satisfied.  The service and atmosphere was nice. My only gripe is that the restaurant is relatively large and popular and they only have one restroom. There was a constant line. Other than that I really enjoyed our Sunday brunch and I will definitely return for those crepes.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak n eggs
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. French onion
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quiche Lorraine

uwVjCLDCRXumAOWqsd_UdA.text: Enter this bustling corner restaurant decorated in the theme of a French bistro and you will immediately be greeted by the lively music and friendly staff. If you are dining on a weekend you will most likely also be greeted a rather noisy establishment. The ambiance is usually mellow during the week if you are looking for a casual atmosphere.   If you are ordering wine I strongly recommend the La Posta Malbec. Why strongly? I don't like Malbec and my boyfriend doesn't like Malbec but one sip of my sister's glass was enough for us both to order our own glass.   Ever since the first time we ordered the four cheese fondue we decided to keep it as a staple item for our visits. The cheese has a delicious sharp undertone and the fondue is full of more cheese than will be absorbed by the bread they bring with it. They never seem to bring enough bread with it but we save the tableside bread they bring with dinner service to gluttonously leave no bite of cheese behind.  My previous favorite was the seared scallops over mushroom risotto but has since been replaced by the Beef Short Rib Bourguignonne which was phenomenal with a hearty cut of beef so tender no knife was needed. I will definitely be ordering this again!  This restaurant was close to a 5 star review but unfortunately on our last visit the beignets that I had absolutely raved over during a brunch visit came out as a burnt dessert. Hopefully on our next visit I will be able to update my review after a perfect dinner service.

FwWG7LUDliXlHE09CnhmkA.text: This is my favorite restaurant  in Charlotte. Everything is delicious... Everything! The taste is authentic French cuisine, but the portions are definitely southern.  You will not leave hungry.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate raspberry mousse cake
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

Va7l8VCXV2tompjp1oDwNw.text: Great food. Had the duck and the beef bourguignon. Service was fast and friendly. Try the tuxedo cake.

6M7fPA0ipkrSsAuxokh0uw.text: Pretty disappointed. Came by myself and had breakfast at the bar. I asked for mushrooms in lieu fruit and potatoes. Bar tender said there would be an up charge of $2.00+. Mushrooms are one of the sides listed as well as fruit and potatoes. Why on earth would you charge additional money for this change? Bar tender had an attitude about it and was very rude. Bummer...my family liked coming here.

V6DPP5urJ_6b6cdZEWiBnQ.text: Just stopped in to hang with a friend and grab a couple of drinks. So I cannot discuss the food (which smelled delicious) but I CAN discuss the decor, bar, staff, and bathrooms: all of which exceeded expectations. The staff was very nice, good conversationalists, and knew their stuff. The bathroom was, frankly, very nice and reminded me less of a bathroom than a nice lounge. I loved the entire decor of the bar area and place in general. Not a sports bar, but plenty of TVs. So, NOT the cheapest place in the world - but what do you expect for a place next to Southpark/Philip's Place/Whole Foods? Just a wonderful experience overall.

yhGg7ZfjWvCMZRbc3BEXmw.text: This was one of the best food I had in a while. We came here for lunch and everyone's food was great, specially the French onion soup.

Ob9CHs4cZUPgbSIft-Do3Q.text: Came here yesterday for brunch with some friends and had a really good time. We were seated immediately with no wait. Staff was nice and the food came on time.   I had the crab cake Benedict. The crab cake Benedict was really good. The potato it came with didn't have much flavor but they quickly replaced it with fries after I asked them to with no issues.   Nice place to eat brunch in South Park.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brunching like there&#39;s no tomorrow. Crab Cake Benedict #urbanbrunchchannel.

W-DKFHzjOMfiyRLgelEhxA.text: Perfection! On a very sad morning for me two of my kids took me here for some breakfast before my mom's funeral. What a wonderful delight! Great service and terrific food. I loved the ambiance of the place. They have made fans of us! Reminded us all of our times in Paris. Coffee and espresso were best in town so far. We will frequent here when in town from now on.

eCc_2bs7sPb8bJPfI2mt_Q.text: Definitely going back! Good food, good service, fun atmosphere. Lunch with friends a delight. Ate outside on the sidewalk on the side, not on Fairview.

vN9qTRLljo3QXrFzNcaPDA.text: Food was really good. I had the Benedict Monte, really tasty. The hash brown patty they serve was just warm, would be better hotter. Had some beignets too, too hard to pass up. Also split the banana crepes which were phenomenal. Will come back again but make a reservation next time.

V2HdBhP4yfAuC783vbOjSg.text: I just dined at Cafe Monte for an early dinner. The food was superb. The service was excellent. I must say I've been here at least 6 times and will return. I highly recommend Cafe Monte. They never disappoint.

sKSj943euk6Lo8f2elU-yA.text: Truth be known, the food was and is always great. My complaint is with the manger . We brought 2 friends with us to celebrate their birthday. When we arrived, I told both the hostess and the 'Manager", that we are celebrating and I wanted a surprise chocolate desert for their birthday. Both agreed to take care of it Of course, at the end of the meal, the check came and no birthday surprise. Needless to say, I was pissed. I asked for the manger. I told her that she let me down and all she could say is "sorry, what can I do". I told her that she went from hero to zero in 30 seconds. I wonder what you have to do to become a manger? Well, we will be back for the food, with no confidence in making any special requests to the "Manager".

u3bF7D6ujv8YFKceRk8OoQ.text: We returned to Cafe Monte last night with a $18 for $30 Groupon deal. Of note, Wednesdays are half off bottles of wine at Cafe Monte. Also of note, other promotions are not valid when using a Groupon, limit one promotion per table. We still purchased a bottle of wine, a French Merlot, Nicholas for $34 at full price on top of the food covered by the groupon. We were seated right away, they had a good crowd going in the back of the restaurant. I guess it makes it easy on the servers. There were about 10-13 other tables dining at the same time. Our server, was ok, she should have mentioned the limit one deal per table much earlier than she did. We ordered the seasonal risotto with shrimp, $18, and the bf got the basil penne with chicken, $16.   I love the complimentary bread that's brought out at the beginning, it makes me want to buy a whole baguette before I leave. Very fresh and soft on the inside, yet perfectly crunchy on the outside, just the way a French baguette should be. I prefer Cafe Monte's baguettes over Amelie's . The food was brought out surprisingly fast, it was not the case last time we were here. My risotto was generously dressed with tender shrimp, loved it, and a copious amount of veggies. The zucchini and mushrooms came out perfectly. It had a balanced, creamy yet flavorful taste. It was a good sized portion, I only left a little risotto standing on the plate when I was done. The penne was also good, need a little more seasoning but it had a generous amount of chicken and pesto cream sauce. Bill came to $37 after the Groupon was applied due to the full priced wine bottle, eh, will keep the 1 promotion per table in mind for next time.   Remember to look for a Groupon/Living Social deal, it really helps considering the average price of a meal here. Oh, lunch/brunch menu all day on Sundays! Cheers!

-0imhgu4UUnEv1V_b7rfJQ.text: My hubby and I arrived 3 minutes before our reservation time and were seated at a table back in the restaurant. Cozy, Parisian atmosphere and our waiter was prompt to our table. We ordered a Hendricks Martini and a glass of merlot which were quickly delivered. Once we got our drinks we ordered the rest of our meal. Escargot in puff pastry and Brie en croutes arrived, but only five minutes later our entrees arrived. We told the server we needed more time. About ten minutes later our entrees came back but my beef Wellington was medium well instead of medium rare when I cut it through. We sent it back and I had lobster and crab crepes which were delicious. We ate creme brulee which was yummy and brought home chocolate raspberry mousse cake. I'm looking forward to trying Cafe Monte again!

aDZH3gv3qnK_EoSrewB2Vg.text: I've been 3 times for lunch. BEST chicken salad I've had that wasn't homemade. The service is consistently amazing too! I haven't had a bad experience and will continue to visit!

EjGApfDBY59JWGwMQ8YvmA.text: Came back with 97 yr old dad for lunch.  It was a risk as his tastes run to macaroni & cheese, pancakes and diner food.  How would he react to French cafe atmosphere and food?  He liked it.  Especially all the ladies that come in from shopping.  Yes, somethings never die!    Ordered crepes, which he liked.  Generous portion and we both like the rich, fresh coffee.  A real treat and rare find in local restaurants.  Service is excellent and just enough checking to refill coffee and to see if all is well without hovering.  Atmosphere is relaxing and comfortable.    Menu offers a nice mix of European/French fare along with fairly well-known meals.  A very nice place to have a relaxing meal.  This could be and excellent and safe first date place.  Ummmm.  Will be a regular over time.

nyrY4Cs6RdQQe0HErT76zw.text: Cafe Monte has impeccable service and makes me feel like I am right back in Paris when I walk through the doors! From the traditional Parisian bistro chairs to the paintings/decor I feel like I am home again! Highly recommend for the single dinning or great date night location!!

--vML2aMWB-1uetRlGoCHQ.text: Despite my terrible experience, I really did appreciate the response I received from the owner of the restaurant, Mr. Smith. He approached me with class and professionalism.  I do feel that it was my responsibility to report that incident to the proper authorities who conducted a thorough inspection of the restaurant. It is clear to me that this was an isolated incident that will probably never happen again. The roach or moth (whatever it was) did create quite a situation but I am ready to move on.  I wish Mr. Smith, his staff and his establishment all the best.

jPoxJj0yRtsNNj8dnyGR8A.text: My husband and I went to Cafe Monte for breakfast this morning. He had classic eggs Benedict and I had Florentine omelette. They were delicious.  We really like the ambience. It looked like a French bistro inside. We will definitely go back.

8SUgdg7YkGU8WwL6YJkFhw.text: Cafe Monte is an excellent brunch spot for those with discriminating taste buds and small appetites.  I arrived with excitement and left hungry.  I know they are going for a "French" feel...but it just isn't my place of choice.  I will say our waiter was  GORGEOUS  and the piano man kept me entertained...a no go in the future.

v6jWFuMiOQ3PthSRTOjlXg.text: My husband I ate here for the first time over the weekend and we loved it.  We sat outside on the patio and enjoyed the "French" music they were playing.  The sword fish was amazing!  Fyi-it is kind of expensive...

ZwO_7Ib3PVR_7RdXesBavg.text: Went to Cafe Monte last Sunday for a brunch. It is a very nice kinda upscale bakery/restaurant. For the brunch I ordered a Charculerie Plat as a appetizer for all of us to share and with its assortment of cured meats, olives and patte it really hit the spot to start off with. For a main course I had the Parisian Omelette which came with a fruit cup for a side. The "Parisian Omelete" may sound kinda fancy but it's really just a ham and cheese omelete but since they prepared it with brie instead of american cheese I guess that made it a little more classy than usual. Either way, the omelete itself was well prepared and tasted as good as any omelete I've ever had. The fruit in the fruit cup was actually pretty fresh which is a big bonus for me since a lot of places seem to kinda fall short in that department.   Our group had a lot of people (I think 20 spread out between two tables) and the servers did a very good job of keeping up as well as the kitchen. My water was always topped off and I never felt either neglected or overly annoyed. The only thing I would say was a little bit of a minor turnoff was the prices on the plates. Could have probably shaved a dollar here or there but otherwise it was a good dining experience.

uXNsPxf0D0qaA7ZrTn_how.text: I just finished breakfast at Cafe Monte.  I ordered the French Country Breakfast.  The meal came out in a timely manner, but with no skillet potatoes.  I didn't realize this until after my server delivered the food.  I finished my meal before anyone came to see how things were.  I informed them that I did not receive the skillet potatoes, and was assured they would account for that on the bill.  They deducted $1.10.  A side of skillet potatoes sells for $3.50.  I understand there may be a portion difference, but I don't feel $1.10 was a sufficient discount for not receiving (fully) what I ordered, and having to let them know at the very end of my meal.  I like Cafe Monte and will come back, but this was not my best experience.

t_MLgFolGybVc1eGy31Bow.text: Although I can only speak for the crepes, we've always enjoyed our meals when we've been there. The flavors in the chicken and mushroom crepe are absolutely outstanding! We did not enjoy the flavors in the seafood crepe nearly as much. The food is extremely rich and leaves you very full by the end of the meal.

ISw1Li1XSyqwi-YZ3HHD-Q.text: UPDATE: The owner reached out to me to please come back and give them a second chance. I'm glad that we did. We decided to go for dinner this time and had a great experience. I made a reservation (even though we were going on a Wednesday night) just in case. Turns out we didn't need one, but the restaurant was pretty full by the time we left. Our food was magnificent. My husband and I both ordered the spinach, arugula, goat cheese salads and they were great. The dressing on them was the best part. The complimentary bread they bring to to table was also so good! For our entrees I ordered the salmon and my husband ordered the trout and we both agreed that it was the best trout and salmon we've had in Charlotte. It was all so good! Our server was great and she was knowledgeable about the menu. For dessert I got the lemon tart to go. I wasn't super impressed with it, but it was sweet which is what I wanted. Overall I would recommend this restaurant, just maybe not on Sunday for brunch without a reservation.   I can't actually describe the food seeing as how we never received service. The husband and I were just wanting to go to get a couple cups of coffee and some beignets as a nice Sunday treat. We got there and the wait was 40 minutes which made sense because it was Sunday at brunch. We asked if we could sit on the patio sooner and the hostess said that was an option. She sat us at a nice little patio table in the sun. We had menus and immediately were served a couple of waters. Perfect I thought to myself this is going to be a lovely morning. Well we waited about 15 minutes and no one had come to take our order. My husband went inside to make sure we had a server and the hostess said oh yes just one minute. Another 15 minutes and we were tired of waiting so we left. Get it together. The food that was coming out to everyone else on the patio looked awesome. So maybe try a weekday.

YswLXxG0o26ZsuIiNhWRbg.text: My wife and I stopped in for a little breakfast. Split some beignets and had some mimosas. Wonderful experience! Attentive waitstaff, reasonable prices, food was hot and fresh. Coffee and espresso were rich and delicious. Can't stop thinking about the beignets!

cyb8pMjs1uoPw68Y678kVw.text: I love this place! Prime rib sandwich is SO good. It's a little pricey but I think it's worth it :) Great lunch spot while at work.

I--xECApGze74bWeGOrRjg.text: I stopped in for a glass of wine after a unsatisfactory dinner some where else.  I had a glass of Pinot Noir and a great chat with the bartender.  He was nice enough with no hesitation to plug in and charge my phone for me.  I glanced over the menu and it looks great.  I hope to come back soon and try the wonderful food.  Watching from the bar, the staff was very professional and the atmosphere was very bistro like and relaxing.

zXAxqwW-egIT6KrCKwY5sw.text: Went to Cafe Monte for the first time Thursday night for dinner to use a Livingsocial deal that was about to expire.  We made a reservation and when we arrived the restaurant was about 3/4 full. We were immediately seated at a small 2-top with bench seating on one side. I found this table to be too small and the server had to keep awkwardly moving items on the table in order to fit everything.  The bread they bring out to start is warmed and very delicious. My husband started with the soup du jour which was a carrot bisque and it was great.  For our entrees I had the vegetarian crepes which were flavorful and substantial, covered in a rich, creamy sauce. My husband had the crab cake sandwich and that was good but not the best. The fries were skinny, crispy, and plentiful. The portions seem to be quite large for a nicer restaurant. Would love to try dessert there but we were too full this time.  The service was good and prompt.  Bottles of wine are half price on Thursdays but if you use any other promotion (such as a Livingsocial deal) they will not give you the drink special. I thought that was strange considering we spent over the LS amount on our food alone, but that is their policy.

wiG_qwMsjY444PAk96Nvgg.text: Cafe Monte is the best restaurant in Charlotte! Everything is delicious, very authentic and comes out quick. Our waiter Sean was fabulous too! Try the fish, crepes, salads...well, everything really!! Feels like I'm back in France.

QuJiBL0ZRkpwSpszmnpVig.text: Months ago, when me and Bryan were "newly dating" and still trying to do sickly romantic things I suggested we try this place for brunch.  It was a Sunday morning and pretty busy.  We had to wait about twenty minutes but enjoyed a mimosa and a chocolate croissant at the bar prior to our table being ready.  It was heavenly! (The croissant was flaky and had just the right amount of chunky dark chocolate).  We were seated and the menu was fantastic.  I ordered a spinach and Brie omelette.... Bryan got a breakfast crepe.  Service was good and we were eating within 10 minutes of ordering.  I keep meaning to go back again for another brunch, as it was memorable..... Perfect for a sappy third date :)

zLUXmUFS40wt0l5IvCC6uQ.text: One of my favorites in Charlotte!  This is my go-to place when I want a guaranteed delicious meal.  I love sharing the cheese and fruit plate or yummy hummus as an appetizer, or having any of their delicious salads to myself.  My favorite main course is the basil pesto penne with chicken--never disappoints!  Other favorites are the seafood crepes and pizzas.  This is also a great place for brunch.  Think french toast, delicious omelets, and eggs benedict.  I've also enjoyed (way too) many desserts.  You could easily come for the coffee and bakery treat alone.    They often have live jazz music which makes the atmosphere even more fun.  This is a perfect date night spot and also great to get a group of friends together.  I'd recommend Cafe Monte to everyone!

YFVR0GqMbw67ZXrp7OxWZA.text: Always the perfect place for lunch or dinner.  The food is always delicious and the service is just right.  Love to go there and share a bottle of wine and a few hours of conversation.  I am never disappointed!

zOqXohUz-e8OqN-7pxC0bA.text: Food here is very good.  Brunch was amazing, and they also offer vegetarian options as well.  I ordered the open face veggie sandwich with a potato cake,  super good. Love this place

ZqYdDtNIAzYaXewbDFmrfA.text: We ate at Cafe Monte for brunch prior to a matinee show in uptown Charlotte. It was only a few minutes from uptown and well worth the drive. We both throughly enjoyed our meal. The restaurant is chic and lovely. We would definitely return...

E1J4ZviKzY-gIDDspihFDA.text: Cafe Monte is a favorite among several friends, and I have had some exceptional experiences here, and some experiences i wish I could get in a time machine and avoid, hence the mediocre stars which regresses to the mean. The ambiance tries to evoke a Parisian bistro atmosphere which is mostly succeeds at.  It benefits from a great location in SouthPark. Typical entree prices are about $12-14.  Here's my advice to have a 5 star experience:  1) Get the crepes. I don't care if you want a sandwich, or a plain old eggs breakfast. Forget it. Get the crepes. Best savory crepes in Charlotte, hands down. I have had the chicken coq-au-vin special crepes and they were OMG.  I also had the shrimp and artichoke crepes with lemon creme and they were similarly amazing. As in "I don't care if I gain 10 pounds from this one meal, I'm finishing every last bite".  2) Go on a weekday or a late weekend lunch. Forget going on a nice sunny brunch. We went once and literally were there for 2+ hours and our food (regular eggs) took 1.75 hours to prepare after we finally got our order in. It just is jammed, and the kitchen apparently doesn't know how to deal with it.   Their quiche is pretty good, and their dessert is OK, but crepes are the standout. I wish Crepe Cellar had savory crepes as good as Cafe Monte. Maybe I might come back when they have jazz?

dMCUYFyFu06RNA3c-tqglQ.text: Excellent French fare in Charlotte. I have been to a few French restaurants and cafe monte is definitely one of the best I've ever visited. The food is quite good. I've had both steak and chicken here, both were excellent. The escargot was also done well. Pricing is on par for an upscale restaurant but well worth it. Service is good not excellent. Fit and finish is decent for it being a part of a shopping plaza. They often have groupons which I have used on the occasions I've been there. Not many French restaurants around, this one is definitely worth a look. Highly recommend.

pL7IJ84JNW5Eqa127Ud85w.text: Excellent lunch that included tomato roasted red pepper soup w goat cheese, side salad w apricot vinaigrette dressing, and special croissant chicken salad.  Service was fast and excellent with the waitress splitting things for us without being asked.  Not crowded  at 2:30 when we entered and very pleasant atmosphere on a Friday afternoon.

ziZ4pToAgR96dYk5j7NyFw.text: I've eaten at Cafe Monte more than any restaurant in Charlotte. I'd guess fifty times over the years. Maybe more. I eat there with family on the weekends and work colleagues during the week. Now that George's (happily) and Lumiere (sadly) are gone, this is close to the only French food option in town. I've never had a truly bad experience here, and almost always it's good.   The best thing here is the wait staff, who are always attentive and friendly. Breakfast/ brunch options are strongest choice. Lobster salad is good. The various crepe dishes are great, except for the lobster and crab crepe, which swims in cream sauce and has gone downhill over the years. There's a nice cheese fondue. Even basics like the chicken salad are good.   The quiche is highly recommend. The only better quiche in CLT is at Napa on Providence.   Sometimes, but not often enough, they've had good live jazz. When there's a little band there, the atmosphere can be near perfect.   Worst thing about it is that the food is solid but rarely amazing. But the only thing I would definitely stay clear of is the steak frites. The frites are great but the steak, the times I've had it, is tough and full of gristle. Bummer because when done even just ok, that's one of my French restaurant favorites. Also the French onion soup is, as my brother in law put it once, "sub-par." Also, the cocktails seem a little weak recently, so I would avoid liquor here and stick with wine. They have a half price bottle night - I think Thursday.   One thing that has always mystified me about this place is that it seems to really appeal to older people. Like really older. And that's cool. It's just a curiosity to me.   But... love it and will probably eat there another 50 times.

NBycY30ImDRAPBH_1qvYNg.text: This is one of my favorite breakfast spots in the area. For the amount of times I have been here, I have only tried one thing on the menu (it is so good that I just keep ordering it time and time again) - the quiche!  The food is great, and the ambiance is adorable. The only reason that I am not giving it 5 stars is the service. Every time that I have been, the service has been sub-par, which is so unfortunate considering that this place is so wonderful in every other way. If you are in the area, stop by and have a quiche for me!

deE5RmrcGI40RnTcDhb2Yw.text: Amazing cappuccinos and best almond croissant in town!   The food is great, love the apricot salad dressing and lobster omelette. Steak frites varies from outstanding  to OK but I'm sure that's due to cuts of meat received.

YtTOFme_rh_O8FbW0etgKw.text: Best French Cuisine in Charlotte! Cafe Monte offers a great brunch menu that's affordable and delicious! The service is great, and the atmosphere is warm and welcoming. I've been a few times for Brunch/ Lunch. There's always a crowd, I would recommend making reservations.  Personally, I love the French Onion Soup and Escargot. There's a Groupon available, be sure to download it! Cafe Monte also has a great wine selection, and the bottles prices are reasonable.

REhLrmfFiOEV4AnBRC2peg.text: Loved the atmosphere. It has a real french feel. The food was good as well. We got he beignets for the table and they were amazing. I would highly recommend them. I'm not a coffee drinker so I got the hot coco and it was fancy like any other coffee which was a nice touch. I got the Smoked Salmon Benedict. It was good but I was not a fan of the potatoes that came with it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

_a8qZLkUqfAOsR9VeVBzbQ.text: This place is amazing. I came in on a Saturday night and they had a band playing relaxing music. I had a reservation, but had to wait around 20 minutes for our table. There is plenty of parking in a shared lot where the restaurant is located. Upon entering I was greeted. I saw several tables with smiling faces. Never been to a place where everyone seemed to enjoy themselves. At the bar Conrad made some delusions drinks. If you go to the bar see him. I had a French martini and my friend had a margarita. These drinks were made fresh. Our table was ready and we headed to our next destination. I carried my French martini and our waiter saw me carrying this and took it from me. He was like I have it this is my job. He was friendly and attentive. He brought fresh baked bread to our table which was so delicious. I ordered a small salad as an appetizer and my friend had the carrot bisque. I quite enjoyed my salad and the carrot bisque was light and not too thick. It tasted pretty good. For my main course I had the lobster crab crepes. My friend had the swordfish. The blackened swordfish cut like butter. It was quite tasty. The crepe was full of crab and lobster in a cream sauce. Our dessert was in the house. We had a delicious coconut cake. It is a new item on the menu and I recommend this mouth watering dessert.  What a lovely way to end our meal. I will be back and quite loved my first experience. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. French martini
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Margarita
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Small Salad starter

1S1uwAGsK04jicSWNkEJpQ.text: Stopped by this place brunch while in Charlotte, NC visiting parents on Labor Day weekend. Seems a few of my friends from Miami have visited this place before and given it good reviews on Yelp.  Gotta say that brunch was fantastic and did live up to expectation. Located fairly close to were my parents live, we got lucky that it wasn't full as I read that a few of my friends had to wait to be seated. Hostess was sweet as well as rest of the staff, but reason I gave it 5 stars was for the food.  Come casual and have fun, definitely recommend this spot for brunch..

1j8YH4phS35SioQT4OH1yQ.text: This is a nice restaurant.  They have great service and the food delicious.  My husband and I went to eat there for a date night.  The parking is also convenient because you can valet or park in an area close by.

mPa26lZsG2_5YvBOct-_Mg.text: Based off other reviews it seems most have a pleasant experience here. This was not the case for us. My boyfriend and I came here for a quick bite before catching a move....which we had to miss and was non refundable. We sat at the side bar to avoid waiting on a table. We waited about ten minutes before the manager came by and asked if we had been taken care of. She dropped off menus and waited for a few more minutes. Finally, I went to the main bar and asked if I could order and pay immediately, since we had a movie to catch and been waiting for a long time. We ordered a quiche and chicken salad sandwich. My quiche is dropped off and after waiting for five more minutes we had to stop the manager to state we have not received our full order and that my food was cold. The manager NEVER CAME BACK. Our bartender came by and noticed we did not have our full order, apologized and said he would talk to the manager to comp something. (I had already paid the bill). His food took ten more minutes. We finished our food and left. Nobody came back by to make us feel welcomed or apologetic for the terrible experience. Working in the service industry for five years and my boyfriend for over ten, we are very empathetic when service is not perfect. Today, however, is the first time I felt compelled to share a bad review.

qm37-wJ2djJnu0SXCYbQSw.text: This place has always been great but who decided to take away the ice for your ice water? We had room temperature water, which is less than appealing when it's 100 outside. The food was great. Service was good and price was reasonable.

D8OD6xuWQZuJqJOw5VX7ww.text: Cafe Monte is a great brunch spot.  Our server yesterday was amazing.  The best service I had in a very long time.  She was always around right when we needed her.  She was polite, and able to explain the menu very well.  I really appreciated her as a server.  The food was delicious.  They have awesome savory crepes but for sweet crepes, this is not your place.  The sandwiches are also good if you are more of a lunch person.  The do offer pastries from Amelie's and their coffee is also good.

4hhjlkV-k90mTpEZnfKqxg.text: After viewing the pics on Yelp I wasn't sure what to expect... came in for Sunday brunch.  Food and service was fantastic; although I've never had a crepe before and their version of a crepe is quite different (toppings not stuffed inside but on top of) but still very delish! Not the best picture but we had Chicken and Wild Mushroom crepe and French Onion soup.   No tables were left unattended after the guest left, matter of fact when the tables were cleared right away!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

OCwIbAsEU4rs5axk54_YxQ.text: This ranks as the absolute best dinner we have had in decades. Two of us has the short ribs, one had the crepes with shrimp, and the forth an unlimited mussels(Monday only?). The ribs were the best I have ever eaten and the pearl onions and mushrooms absorbed the incredible gravy. I can not recommend this place too highly. Oh, and for the quality and amount of food, the prices were beyond reasonable. Yep, I enjoyed our visit.

VW2t5kDT-ANynxlZ9jk9-Q.text: Great beignets. I had the chicken salad in a croissant-excellent. My daughter got the seafood omelette- also excellent. Took home croissants and macaroons- delicious.

ulAdyW8AbuX-WxGo533NyQ.text: Brunch at Cafe Monte never fails.  Make sure to make a reservation for brunch on the weekends!  Today we tried the smoked salmon crossiant with house salad, and the classic eggs benedict with a side of sausage. Everything was delicious and fresh. Thanks for never letting us down!

I50JHft51JBlgRmHYQJd0Q.text: I went to Cafe Monte last week, this time for dinner. I had previously gone for a brunch weeks ago. Now that was perfect, really. Both visits I got a glass of rose. Each time I got a huge glass and at $8 it's a steal.  We started with the frites and grilled artichoke hearts which were pretty good. I'd eat just those two things for dinner next time.  I got a Groupon since this restaurant usually has one available. My husband got the trout which he enjoyed but there were a few bones in it. I got the shrimp and artichoke crepe. I was expecting a lighter dish so when I got a plate loaded with what I think was two crepes and a bechamel sauce it was a bit much. It did taste ok but wasn't what I was expecting. Our server was a bit rushed.  We had a fine time and it was worth it having the Groupon but I prefer brunch there.

62yfkRT09jPwf1m5d8hZ5Q.text: We read the reviews and got really excited about this place. We really love brunch places and Charlotte is pretty weak in this category. Cafe Monte was good, not great. We got the beignets, coffee, latte, salmon omelette, and eggs Benedict. The coffee is a Sumatra. The latte was weak and had little flavor. The eggs Benedict and salmon omelette were good, but had little spices in them to make them different than any other place. They aren't very flavorful. The server and atmosphere were nice. But the food was not worth the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Benedict  Latte  Salmon omelette
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

axZIojobVDStiO3TgdNmAg.text: We went for dinner on a Friday night. First of all, make sure you have a reservation, because this place gets packed. This was our first time here, so we weren't sure what to expect outside of viewing the menu online. While many items are certainly French cuisine, we were surprised to find that there is no sommelier there (though there was someone tonight who "knows a bit about wines, who can make some recommendations" which turned out well) and the "chaude chocolate" is just regular hot chocolate and not European sipping/drinking chocolate. That aside, our server (Shane) was very friendly and courteous. As for the food, I have to start by saying the little baguette they serve at the beginning is amazing!! For main course, I had the pork chop (which was alright, but not something I would order again, though the accompanying brussel sprouts and mashed potatoes were very good) and my S.O. had the Trout which he very much enjoyed and said he would order again. We opted for the chocolate and Gran Marnier "fondue" for dessert which was good but very rich.   I would give atmosphere 2 stars, but the live jazz in the bar bumps atmosphere to a 3 or 4 I think.  Staff gets 5 stars. They were all very friendly and attentive and they truly care that you are completely satisfied with every part of your meal.  Food gets 4 stars. It's above average, but not anything to go out of my way for.   We have heard rave reviews about this place for brunch though, so we will be back to try more!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork chop, mashed potatoes, and brussel sprouts.

E5iBcdx0mYgY9s0wpwp51w.text: Enjoyed every meal I've had here. Crepes are so authentic and the Berry Compote is amazing. I grew up in Europe and, surprisingly enough, this place feels very close to home for me. The macarons are delicious and perfectly priced; the service is amazing and genuinely a great experience each time. Wish there was more than one location!

O-u7pR-SYvazMw7ctPQWfA.text: A very good choice for Queens Feast they had an excellent restaurant week menu. Small and quaint they pack them in a bit more for CRW it seems but the giant pics of France will take you away. The CRW menu includes a cheese plate course. I had the beef short ribs which were perfectly braised tender and juicy. The bread pudding dessert was great as well. You can't go wrong here if you are in the mood for a little French cooking.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef short ribs, delish

LEkEvFny87xnSwUxsIwDuA.text: The food is tasty, the presentation is excellent however my only negative is the food and portion size does not justify the cost.  The cost is 35% higher than other comparable restaurants in the area.  Once you put the price aside everything else is great.

6CiW_W1W2xh24eLWFJs0ug.text: I LOVE Cafe Monte. My wife and I discovered Cafe Monte soon after we first moved to Charlotte. We purchased a living social and gave it a try. She got hooked on the Charcuterie and I on their steak and eggs. We both love their macarons too. I would also recommend their various crepes. The shrimp and artichoke and the lobster/crab crepes. Oh yeah and the short rib baguette delicious, too! LOL  When my parents come and visit or friends from out of town, we always always take them to Cafe Monte for breakfast or a late lunch. And occasionally we'll walk by and order some macarons or a fruit tart to go.  The dining area and bar area are great. If you want to hang out somewhere fun and have a nice conversation with a friend you'll like the ambiance. The service is top notch as well.   The prices might be high for some, but you can taste the quality in the food. In my opinion it's totally worth it. I'm really high on Cafe Monte and suggest that you give it a try. You won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

_Yo2dtblOsaXDhttLs4Nzw.text: My husband and I eat regularly at Cafe Monte because it is one of our favorite restaurants.  Yesterday I ordered an omelette with egg whites.  Half way through my meal, our server, Jennifer G came very apologetically to our table and said that she had discovered that the kitchen had made the omelette with whole eggs.  She had the kitchen re-make the entire meal, which I took home and had for dinner.  Both Jennifer and the manager were so very apologetic and took the meal off of our bill.  The service is always like this at our fave restaurant.

xDCpLdtgFWx85T3daXN59Q.text: This used to be a reliable spot for pretty good food at moderate prices.  But, a few months ago the place lost their long time chef, and its general manager.  Even the once great croissants are no longer consistently good.  Last time I was in, I got food poisoning: I called later in the day to tell them-and the person answering the phone didn't seem to care.  I left my phone number and name-and no one called me back.  After recovering (three days later!) I finally called.  The manager was "sorry" but I had to demand that my charge be credited back to my card.  She wasn't offering!  I'd have to say, sadly, skip this joint.  My sausages, which I believe were the cause of my illness, were the size of silver dollars, and just about as thick, overcooked, cold, and tasteless.  Really, how do you mess up sausage?

eS7SdaAEzXpsiUeO7wS2XA.text: We love this place!  We have been many times and our food has always been great.  Our waiters have always been prompt, our meals up without a long wait, and everything is fresh and hot.  I love their half chicken, steak, mushroom Crepes, and omelets.  Vegetables are always served with the correct crispness (not soggy, soft like you get in some places)!    We love the atmosphere.  While many reviewers say it just isn't like being in Paris... I beg to differ!  Right down to the authentic bistro chairs... this place IS French!  The music, the decor, the window boxes, etc.  all French!  Yes, the shabbiness is missing but the rest is all there.  I can sit and feel like I am back in Paris for just one meal and step right back out into reality when I am through.  :)  Our family really enjoys the decor, AND the food at Cafe Monte.  We will be visiting many more times in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Half Baked Chicken, Asparagus, and Wild Mushrooms... half eaten. :)  Cafe Monte, Charlotte, NC
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. New York Strip Steak Au Poivre, Frites, Green Beans. Cafe Monte, Charlotte, NC

ElZK60GIkFb8oykEZPTTfA.text: Trout Almandine was delicious!  Beautiful presentation.  Great place for girl's night out.  Diverse wine list.  Dessert menu looked amazing.

1ZLkGS5OvqdJLomVqsXeZg.text: Amazing coffee, lovely staff. Great place to spend a rainy afternoon inside, or sunny day outside on the beautiful patio surrounded by palm trees. Like a mini getaway in the city.

0NlUpc9T-QBXI6rVld4LYQ.text: There used to be a shortage of French restaurants in town about 10 years ago and I was one sad panda because I couldn't get my fix on a whim.  That has changed and with the opening of Cafe Monte, the availability of tasty and accessible French cuisine became a reality.  First time for brunch?  Get the steak and eggs.   For dinner, get the Escargot Traditionnel.  It's not as garlicy or intense as the escargot I had in Paris.  It's light but flavorful and served with a puff pastry.  The pate is delicious as well (this coming from someone who hates pate).  You really can't go wrong with any of the entree's.  Everything is delicious.  The service is good and the ambiance makes you forget for a moment that you're in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate Mousse
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak Frites served with au poivre, French green beans, and frites.
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cafe Monte Caesar Salade

QjruDW5-UA1A8PJ5-b5Mvw.text: Stopped by for lunch while combing every inch of Charlotte for car dealerships who will meet my price.  It was a Saturday, noonish and the place was pretty full with the seats on the patio all taken on a sunny day.  I took a seat at the bar, was greeted promptly and offered a menu and a drink.  I wound up ordering French Onion soup and a Croque Monsieur (one can never have enough melted cheese in a meal).  One nice touch is that I was asked if I wanted the soup to be my side with the sandwich, an offer that I accepted.  The soup itself was hot, as in really, really hot, to the point I melted some skin off the roof of my mouth in my haste to shove the first spoonful in.  The broth was in need of salt in a pretty big way and also benefited from some pepper.  The sandwich was very nice with tons of melty, turned crispy on the edges, cheese.  While it also benefited from the salt and pepper shakers, I would certainly order it again.  I truly enjoy French bistro style food so will likely try Cafe Monte again when back in SouthPark.

F7hZRYIt5vp9vho50k-eyw.text: Cafe Monte was a good French lunch spot. The prices are a little inflated for the product, but we had a really nice lunch. The Monte Cristo's were not exactly what I had in Paris, but just as good. We may be back here in the next year, but will not seek it out for a lunch spot. Perhaps we will return to try the desserts :)

tFPWo27vlwc_V6SffuNgmg.text: We first went here with friends, by accident.  Our original spot was closed and we happened to drive by and said let's try it.  No dissapointment at all!  Service was impeccable and they went out of their way to accommodate my food allergies, making it a delightful and very delicious meal.  Five star for them and looking forward to eating there again!

7T5eUbrLNLXOpQbNtaVJqA.text: Let me start by saying that I love Cafe Monte! Their food is so delicious! The service is generally great as well, but the most recent visit was mostly unpleasant. We attempted to redeem a dinner groupon (30 dollar value) for lunch (I completely overlooked that!) and even after speaking with the manager he still wouldn't budge to make an exception (our ticket was $30 before tax and gratuity). While I understand that there are policies in place etc, I was mostly displeased that they would haggle over a few dollars. And while this situation was mostly my oversight, the entire ordeal left me with a poor impression of their customer service. I always highly recommend Cafe Monte to my friends and it is my favorite place in southpark, but this incident definitely dampened my enthusiasm about eating there or recommending it to others.  PS. I received a personal message from the owner with an apology after I posted the above review! I was blown away and gladly changed my stars from 2 to 5! Thank you Monte!! We will be back =)

HHVPsNP6GyXlYDA_Dbc3-A.text: I hate to be writing this review after reading many of the other reviews on here and having high expectations for a delicious brunch. Cafe Monte has been on my list of brunch spots for a while and I was really looking forward to a nice meal.  My fiance arrived a little after 10 am on a Sunday. We were fully prepared to have to wait for a table so we put our name in and were told it would be about 20 to 25 minutes. We were offered a spot at the smaller bar/ railing where we could order but it was so tight it didn't seem like a comfortable place to eat so we agreed to just have coffee there. About 15 minutes later we had yet to be served or even approached by a server. Spots opened up at the main bar so we moved there with the hope of finally getting some coffee. Service was still quite slow and many others were served before us. We were holding out for our table so we only ordered coffee and refills were few and far between.  After about 45 minutes of waiting for a table we were too hungry to wait anymore and decided to put in our order at the bar. Over an hour after we arrived we were told our table was finally ready but elected to stay at the bar. We ordered the monte Benedict and the fruit de Mar omelet. We were both very disappointed with the lack of flavor and seemingly poor quality of the ingredients. My fiance stated that his omelet could have come from Denny's. The potato cakes on the side of each dish lacked flavor and the hollandaise sauce on the Benedict was flavorless and arrived to me already congealed.   Overall the service and quality of food were both extremely poor. The food was also quite expensive for brunch and there are too many great brunch spots in Charlotte to waste money on bad food.

VGbHfc0gjXWPP2paBH9Dew.text: Lovely cafe to visit while shopping in Charlotte. French onion soup to die for and a wonderfully diverse menu for every palate.

_mvNifvO2wymoq7ek4v3-Q.text: Lobster served just right ...steak delicious ... felt comfortable from the second we walked in..Dine in Charlotte often love this place

s19H7NqilRx4Jt-2_vcwlQ.text: Eggs Benedict and Beef Short Rib Baguette are recommended. They have the skinny fries which were cooked perfectly. Everything was delicious. The kids were a fan of the Nutella crepe with a side of fruit. The staff was also very friendly and accommodating with our children. We will come back again.

g_pct9OWaoQBpxwchwx1uw.text: Good food and service. Better gluten free selections than most restaurants. Great service.  Coffee and drinks are also worth a look.

FmJ0hbJs1GCt7Mqsj7IYRQ.text: I absolutely love this restaurant. Provides an authentic French cuisine and dining ambience. Food is always superior, and service is usually fabulous. I have always had great experience with my server at Cafe Monte. Jennifer S is a fabulous waitress by the way, I believe she's up for some sort of competition with other servers here and I vouch for her excellence in service! 10/10 recommend to anyone considering

Ayfw7xUAaC7IC__1axAs5g.text: Last night i went with a party of nine to Cafe Monte.  The service seemed off.  Granted the server was busy, but it took about 20 minutes for him to get back for our orders after bringing our wine.  The entree also came out well after we were finished with our soups and salads.  They also seemed to be out of several things like mussels,  wines and one of the specials. Service aside, the food was pretty great.  I started with an endive salad with blue cheese and pecans.  It was perfectly balanced with a sweet Dijon dressing.  For my entree I enjoyed a crab and lobster crepe in an herbed cream sauce.  It was delicious.   Next time i am in Charlotte, i would love to try this little bistro again.

36804zaGlQxVThxQ5_Ma_A.text: Solid, affordable brassiere fair served in a comfy, airy space trying its hardest to look vintage Paris. I'm about as comfortable at Phillips Place as Billy Graham is at a "bama rally, but the staff did a perfect job of chilling me out and filling my tummy.  Noteworthy: The ratio of women-to-men the entire time we were eating hovered at about 20-to-1. Which I found extremely amusing. Another fun moment: when the staff and tables surrounding a 10-member elderly ladies meet-up all hushed and waited for them to finish saying grace. Tehehe.  We chose what we assumed would be lighter entrees - his was the open faced veg sammich, mine the quiche florentine (10 and 9, respectively). I've never had a slice of quiche like the slice I had today - they somehow managed to make fondue into a pie. It was amazing, but not in any way a healthy choice, although the side salad helped to balance it out a little. His was equally surprising - although it appeared light on the butter fats, it had a hidden decadence that we both found interesting and irresistible. The frites were insanely thin and perfectly fried. Awesome. I'm going to have to try the pizza and benedicts, but maybe on a saturday when I can take a long nap afterwards. Ya.  I think I'd be tempted to give Monte's a fifth star but for one thing; the coffee. Anyone that's been to France knows how seriously the baristorial arts are taken there - and if you're going to go French Bistro as intensely as Monte is trying to, your coffee had better be up to snuff. My au lait  was not satisfactory - tasted cheap, stale, and like it had been made with skim milk. Not a problem with construction but ingredients. And $3.

fEWes3iHFrt9h7j18RewYw.text: It was my first time for lunch here today, and the interior decor is nice, they have some beautiful artwork. The bar area is nicely decorated with a big wine shelf. It is also a spacious restaurant with lots of tables...and they have outdoor seating as well. There is a piano on the left as you walk in, so I'm wondering if they ever have someone play it in the evenings.  I got the most expensive thing on the menu just for the fun of it: crab & lobster crepes. It was just okay, I was sort of disappointed. Service is great though. Good hours, open pretty much all day every day except Sunday, I believe...  I don't recommend the crab & lobster crepes, the crepe and the stuffing came separately and didn't taste all that great.

MaYEH7NZ2axtcIRwDr7BtQ.text: Owner did reach out to correct the situation.

U7q2BdFAsGTGWKadA3GpGg.text: Good food, decent prices and great service. We went to Cafe Monte with a couple friends on a Tuesday night. They were having there special food and wine pairing that I guess they have once a month. Unfortunately, you do have to reserve a seat for the evening so we were not allowed to participate. I am not sure if it is worth the $55 they charge for it or not.   We started off with their cheese and aged meat appetizer ($16) which was delicious. Our food came a little to quickly as we were not even finished with the appetizer when the food arrived. My wife had their special. It was four seared scallops over a real meaty lobster risotto ($26). Her meal was absolutely phenomenal. My friends had the basil pasta with chicken and the crab and lobster crepe ($22). There honestly was not anything overly special with the pasta but it was good. I believe it is the cheapest thing on the menu for $16. The crepe was not visually appealing at all but made up with it with the taste. It had a good portion of crab that made it really good. I had the duck confit with fingerling potatoes and brocollini ($24). The dish was sub par. Duck should be crispy on the outside skin and moist inside. however it was the opposite. The skin was not crisp and the inside was dry. I tried to compensate the dryness with the sauce but it just didnt work well. The server was fantastic and asked what I wanted instead. I had the steak with frittes. It came with a NY cut steak and frittes. She did not charge me for the steak so I do not know the price. Although it was good it was nothing special and I would probably not order it again there. We did not have dessert but you can actually see all there desserts as they have a little pastry counter. Their tiramisu looks really good.   Ultimately, not all the food was stellar but I would go back and have that scallops with lobster risotto anytime.

qgJZ2Z-3wpRjcXw2HPc61Q.text: Went there as it was my mother's pick for her birthday dinner and she loves their salmon. The baby spinach salad was good but the french onion soup was bland.  Unfortunately, three of us ordered steak options and none of us were impressed. Meat was tough and not flavorful. One was the nightly special and the other two were regular Steak Frites. Total bill with tip for a salad, soup & 6 meals - no alcohol, was $180. Service was fine but with quality and cost, we won't be back. If you like salmon, give it a try, but I'd pass on ordering the red meat.

cBKVmJM6lOta8Y6aW2CGxA.text: This is a really good restaurant, don't go there often, but when I have it's been good. Their Quiche is delish! It's not too badly priced, considering.  I have not had any bad meals there.  It's worth a try if you are in the area and want a good meal.  The staff is wonderful!  Soups are fabulous too!

KUrr3hRPMuoVY9gbEHIwag.text: This is 1 of 2 of my favorite breakfast spots in Charlotte. I like it because while they have the usuals of eggs and waffles (both with a twist you won't find in diners), the French inspired menu gives Cafe Monte a uniqueness I haven't found elsewhere in town. Crepes, quiche, great espresso, even steak & frites are all good bets.

_SPhP9AYL9Ul_oEBfmSYfw.text: I was really hoping to like Cafe Monte, but I didn't because - the first impression was ruined by our interaction with the hostess, who just seemed so disinterested in her job. Not that she wasn't attending to us, but there was no pleasant greeting, or even a smile on her face. The food tasted good, but it was the absolute opposite of healthy. I had the shrimp and artichoke crepe w/ spinach and bechamel. I was expecting there to be a little bit of the cream sauce around the crepe, but the entire crepe, all the shrimps, spinach and artichokes was dunked in the bechamel sauce! I enjoyed the first bite, but after that I was just filled with guilt, and couldn't finish the entire dish. Same with the vegetarian crepe that my friend ordered. The club sandwich tasted great too, but only for the first two bites until your mouth and throat were coated with all the butter / oil from it. Now on to the good things: I had heard that they are usually pretty slow with their service, so we sat at the bar, and fortunately avoided the slow service :) The waitress was attentive and sweet. The owner was walking around, and was very sweet too. I really really wish they'll improve their food and make it a wee bit healthier, and when i read a review that says that, I'll be sure to go back there!

qZKDjvSn3_fLiLZnGGMtFg.text: GREAT place.  Unique foods,  very authentic.  super friendly wait staff.  And the decor was perfect.  Must try.

tfi_o2_8IoDiJHadkd4mCg.text: I like Cafe Monte a lot, I am not sure why there are so many mixed reviews. The waiters may seem indifferent at times (possibly this is part of their French ambiance) but I have never had bad service here. They have started being open for breakfast again. They serve European (read excellent) coffee. Their side salads at lunch are really good as are their sandwiches.  They have a frequent eater card but I am not sure what it does. If you or your friends are in the mood for a French experience then this is the place to go in Charlotte. They just started offering all you want moules on Mondays, they are very good.

aXzIoCC7G9Ym14GpJCiiDg.text: The restaurant, bistro and bakery opens pretty early in the day.  However, I made reservations for today at 4pm.  It was moderate for a weekday.  I ordered the crab cake sandwich with a side salad.  I really enjoyed it.  For dessert, I had the triple layer carrot cake with butter crunch icing.  I will definitely go back.

Hg9gSj29NoKkWA8XZWN54A.text: Excellent almond croissants!  Waiter was attentive and professional.

OSZeR7a8gaxhzZdt_ee9wg.text: I was very excited to try Cafe Monte I can't really give a full review since I didn't eat a real meal here so I'll be back soon.  The outdoor patio is very nice and the service was excellent.  The desserts when you walked in looked amazing (note to self for my next visit).  The menu had the traditional french dishes and they had a nice special on a Prosecco which was just what I was in the mood for.  I opted for the endive salad I would highly recommend it was delicious and shared a meat and cheese plate that was nothing spectacular and fairly pricey.  I'm coming back to try some mussels for sure and maybe brunch:)

aIq4sw11Vk9Ob3tcyXC6wg.text: Great food and service every time I go. One of my favorite regular dining spots.

GiLoO0shx2qQp3RcJi9unw.text: Came here for brunch and I wanted to like this place.  Nice decor and warm and inviting host.  Once seated, it took ten minutes to greet us. We had water on the table 15 minutes after being seated. We ordered mimosas which were pretty tame and they were $8. Not worth the price.   My lady ordered a smoked salmon croissant. It was a little bland given the description. I ordered the madam sandwich, which was a toasted ham and Swiss with Dijon and two fried eggs. It was more of a hangover sandwich than a culinary concoction, but i was hungover so it served its purpose.   Overall the place was ok for brunch. Atmosphere was great. Food not memorable. Service was memorably bad

rR7xOlra0Q301PSZCjlQYg.text: This place looks like your typical cheesy (no pun intended) American take on an Italian eatery, but Cafe Monte is actually pretty good. Super spacious and open, it's got a great atmosphere. A lot of families were there when went there recently, which makes sense: it's in Philips Place, literally right next to that gigantic movie there (and near Upstream). But it wasn't annoyingly family-oriented or anything, so don't worry.   Nothing too exciting on the wedding--just your basic Italian fare, but it gets the job done. I had penne a la vodka, my go-to, and it wasn't bad at all. Super affordable, too, which isn't always the case in Philips Place. Again, this place is really conveniently located. If you're headed for a flick, as we were, this is a great place to grab a quick but non-fast-foody meal. Equally good for a post-movie glass of wine or bite. We'll definitely be back.

seO2fNatv7-ra9sZ63uJGQ.text: Food is ok. I had risotto and that's hard to pull off. The flavors were off and it was bland. I feel like the food is well cooked but not flavorful everytime Ive been there. The deserts are perfect so just for coffee and tea it's fine. I felt like I was under dressed and I was wearing a skirt and cardigan...it was lots of stuffy old ladies who lunch and I defintely felt a little up turned nose my way by the wait staff. The menu is puzzling because of all the Italian food on a French menu. Wtf? I did enjoy it for my couponed price and might be back for carrot cake but maybe to go.

m1mvb2xwB440ksKUIXAq7g.text: Great spinach salad with rotisserie chicken.  We had a very friendly waiter who was so kind to baby and brought him fruit to munch on!  I really liked this place.  Very classy with an authentic french bistro feel.  Love the chairs....feels like Paris!

jp7ZZTiYGRLX1FOjke5-vg.text: Seven of us headed to Cafe Monte for a birthday celebration that was a disaster as a meal and the evening only salvaged by the duty manager doing right by us when it came time to receive the bill.  We ordered drinks that took some 15 minutes to arrive but it was still another 15 minutes before our food order was taken, with 4 of us ordering from the a la carte menu and the rest from the prix fixe. In time the a la carte entrees arrived but it was 20-30 minutes before the prix fixe entrees arrived. The excuse given was that the orders from the different menus were given to the kitchen at different times.  The food met with a mixed reception from rave reviews from some through to indifference from others. My caprese salad had no basil or olive oil but did have a rather gloopy balsamic dressing on the side. It tasted fine but was not what I expected. My steak, cooked rare as requested was pretty good. The trout was enjoyed, as was the lobster/crab crepes. Two people had the scallops with risotto ... both enjoyed the scallops but they differed greatly in their feelings for the risotto.  If the kitchen and wait staff could get their act together this would be a decent mid-range restaurant but it seems they have some way to go. In the end the duty manager seemed sincerely apologetic and ensured there was appropriate consideration when it came to the bill. That was appreciated but we would rather have had a better experience.

A_PPFManwSsIXJj8dM4LDg.text: Really cute decor on both the interior as well as the exterior. Great place for business meetings/lunches as well as casual or dressy lunches, brunches and/or dinner with family and friends. Food was moderately priced french-cuisine. Dessert display was impressive and wait staff was both friendly and attentive :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
