Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

hNKgxVDNm9xSWBhc9yy94A.text: Excellent brunch!!!  I have only been a few times to this place but the staff is very helpful and the food is of good quality.  I have only been for brunch and it was delicious!!  The atmosphere is really cool here too.  Definitely very cafe like :)

dhEU4lYYI7MfCeNyCc1GMA.text: Came here first on a Thursday morning around 11 am, and was surprised of nice interior. I was expecting a small little cafe that served sandwiches and coffee, and was surprised of how deep the restaurant is.  I ordered a cup of Earl Grey, the Parisienne Omelette, and my husband ordered the Eggs Benedict and a shared order of crepes with maple.  The Omelette was very good stuffed with brie cheese, and came with toast with jam and butter, a hashbrown souffle thing. My husbands meal looked very rich with hollandaise and running yolk- something I wouldn't enjoy. The crepes were nothing to write home about, I can make them better, and the maple wasn't maple, it was aunt jemima crap. Thank goodness we had a groupon, I didn't look at bill, but after my second visit when I paid the bill I realized what a rip off this place can be. Second Time, 11 am on Sunday, seated right away, I went with two clients and brought my toddler son with me. I had the Earl Grey, and Endive Salad with added chicken, blue cheese, and apple. They ordered Florentine Omelette which was similar to my Parisienne omelette I ordered before, and the pate which I tried and did not like (kinda dog food like) , granted I didn't know what to expect, bc it is nothing like foie gras! My son had a kids meal grilled cheese and ham on croissant with pomme frites, and for 6 bucks it was plentiful and delicious!! They ordered mimosas, tea and cafe au laite. The bill came to 71 for breakfast and it was my treat.. So of course I was a little salty that my tea was close to 4 dollars for steamed water and a tea bag! My salad was expensive as it was and since I added chicken I think it tacked on another 6 bucks(another kids meal) and there def wasn't enough chicken to equal 6 bucks! Her pate was pricy for what it is, dog food and bread. lol  Overall, Would not pay full price here, and only come with groupon! Never again order hot tea. But, I did like what I ordered and want to order more.

BRK8oBb0S3IS_POH6ZL2JQ.text: ate outside on their small sidewalk. Inside looked very nice, but the weather was too nice I was pleased with the food and the desserts were sinfully delicious.

zPVVYISMcM8v-z8hznMtAg.text: I absolutely love this place. It's not too pricey compared to other french restaurants in town and definitely not stuffy. The beef and asparagus crepes are the best. They often have live music and people singing on the weekends, which I love.

sYfag1Lk1rMLvwxkkhRs2Q.text: 4.5 stars -- Great service - so friendly - food was really good - crepes with nutella and strawberries (fresh) -yum! will be back...

puzq1N8oGCVdlIorCLFiSA.text: Am I in France? Am I in Charlotte? I'm so easily confused after entering the doors of Cafe Monte and I love it.   Talk about a restaurant that doesn't make you feel like you're sitting in SouthPark! Let me preface this review by saying that I work close to Cafe Monte and by close I mean a mere 3 floors in the up direction.   I've been to Cafe Monte many a time. On some occasions its for a quick cup 'o joe (skip this if you can because their regular coffee isn't the greatest), on others its for a to-go box of french fries (no judging) and last night it was to part-take in my first dinner experience.  For the sake of this review and your time I'm going to focus on din-din. For a Thursday night it was pretty packed so my thoughts are to make a reservation if you can. You're always greeted with a smile that makes you feel like you've come home after a long vacation. I love it.   The atmosphere plays a big part of love for this French inspired bistro. Oh oui, it does. My dinner experience was a part of Charlotte's restaurant week so again, I could sample a few different things which I love.  Decisions, decisions! There were too many good ones to choose from. Do I go Coq au Vin (they're specialty), the short ribs (a big fave of mine) or the scallops (mmmm scallops)!?!? In the end I went with the scallops as my mainer and started with the tomato bisque. The bowl of soup was a little on the large side but I apparently had no problems polishing that sucker off.   The scallops can on a bed of roasted zucchini and summer squash risotto. Can you say YUM?!? I didn't manage to get through it all but I noticed my fellow dining companions managed just fine with someone looking pained as to whether or not they could lick the plate.  We had a d-lish vino (from the headache I'm feeling today, it was a bit too d-lish).  My thoughts: GO. GO NOW. It's a great hidden gem off the beaten track.

-lBPX-DaeFGqzSTuPXtUbA.text: Absolutely perfect. The service was excellent . Javier was on point. The French onion soup was fantastic. The chicken and mushroom crepes were superb. All around excellent experience. Highly recommend

9RA7bH7GsGrXlo3_vSgLTA.text: We went here to have brunch with a friend that was driving back to Nashville, TN following our meal.  We had reservations for 8 and while the food was decent, the customer service was horrendous.  Our checks were brought to us before our whole group finished our meals. Beyond that, the hostess came over and stood right by our table...paused long enough for us to look up...and said (rather loud and rudely), "I need this table set up for 12."  We had been there an hour at this point. While I realize brunch is a busy time, I found this behavior unacceptable and will not be dining at this restaurant for this very reason.

_Tb8OJQ4m8p_xlxnXlgVIQ.text: Friendly staff and great management. I go mostly for the desserts. BEST eclairs I have EVER had. Food can be a bit pricey but as some of the other reviews indicate, the quality is top notch. Macaroons are yummy also!!

E53scr6_8PQ8xLS-317X1w.text: Great food. The quiche Lorraine was exceptional!

7CqpSwpvmCcSf7-NgRQD7A.text: I honestly do not see how this place is rated as high as it is.  Went there on a Sunday and it was packed.  Waited 30 minutes to get seated.  Saw several people complaining about their meals and service.  Hostest was nice. Waiter was slow.  Soup came out 2 minutes before the main meal.   Tomato soup was bitter.  My girl got the seafood omlet.   meh.....100% unseasoned.  Got the croque monsieur.....again plain....no seasoning and way too much cheese and not enough ham...I could make a way better one at home.  Side salad had maybe a teaspoon of dressing on it.  Total waste of 50 bucks.

mXKbYdJ5BH9ZVlUa4WoeeA.text: Have been coming here for about 3 years,  and I am beginning to wonder why.   Was in for dinner recently, service was good, wine was good but at $14 a glass for  Sauv Blanc over priced. I had the "herb roasted" chicken.... dry, and flavorless. She ordered the crab cakes which were a style I have Never seen before ... 3 round disks that were flattened beyond recognition maybe 1/4" thick, total weight Maybe 2 oz! Half the plate was filled with red pepper aioli ... ( mayo and canned red peppers) seriously the mayo was twice the weight and surface area of the crab pancakes ?? I guess the "crab" was the accompaniment ?? the remainder of the plate was filled with spinach that was barely warmed and wilted mixed with very obviously canned peppers and nothing was done to hide that fact. We rarely complain, but did this time, the server ( Caroline I think) was very good about it. The replacement pasta was better but not by much.   Great location, but with the new competition the kitchen needs to get its act together. I am giving 2 stars for the service only.

efAi-y9iE04PXqrxELUehg.text: We enjoyed discovering your restaurant for the first time. We truly enjoyed the food and the ambience.

aq73-UfWe0Rwl4c5wi0OWA.text: The food and ambience were spot on for brunch. We found the service to be lacking but it would not keep us from coming back.

Al2pdwwbldARlbelxdudug.text: I've been to Cafe Monte quite a few times for brunch- so I can't review any other meals.  It is a great place to meet your girlfriends to have brunch and then head next door to Polished Nail Salon for pedicures. ;) I love their french toast, and have heard my friends rave about the eggs benedict.  I definitely recommend this restaurant for a nice, relaxed brunch.  The weekends can get very busy, but I've never had to wait very long to be seated.  Good service, nice ambiance.

puwPWVs9QmVLzwPJRU2DGw.text: Fantastic food!! If you want breakfast they have an amazing breakfast menu! The staff are delightful. I would definitely recommend it.

4XZW6Cl2oPuXS8COSfnwaA.text: This place is pretty much neck and neck with Georges. Great food and service, nice atmosphere. The beef wellington and duck pizza are great.

Qt4UWbWlhtAR5SKIL1dXWA.text: EExcellent shrimp with scallops and risitto. Rich and cooked to perfection. A++ in my book.

OnNYidZward-lM819AXm6g.text: Last Saturday, my husband and I stopped here for brunch and we really enjoyed it.  The ambiance in this place transports you to a cute Parisian cafe and gives you a full French experience.  On top of that, their service was great.  I really enjoyed my cafe au lait but wasn't too thrilled with my florentine omellette.  The omelette wasn't all that flavorful and it definitely needed more gruyere.  On the other hand, my husband's fruit de mer omelette was amazing!  The flavors of the crab, smoked salmon and lobster complemented each other quite nicely.  We will definitely be coming back to see how their dinner menu holds up!

W27PF8CFKsfZ4g5_jAat1A.text: I have to say that I love this restaurant! It has been a stand-by for me over the last several months. I can (almost) always rely on great service and great food. I've been multiple times for brunch and it is certainly one of the best brunches in Charlotte. I've also been many times for dinner and they never disappoint. The mussels and frites and the endive salad are some of my favorites!  The reason for only giving it 4 stars and not 5 is that I went there this past Friday night with 3 other friends. Their advertised closing time is 11pm on Friday nights. I arrived at 9:40pm and was told that the kitchen was closed but that we could have coffee and desserts. Now, I totally get it if I was arriving after 10pm, but I told the manager that we were very hungry and were looking for a full meal.   It won't stop me from going there again, but keep in mind that even if you arrive well before they're closing hour, you may get turned away.

fKVt9pqiAM30FPaUOW70LA.text: This was my first time at Cafe Monte, and it was delicious. I had the brioche French toast with berry compote and maple syrup. My boyfriend bad the beef short rip sandwich. His fries were to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. French Toast

_QQuhKAMWy_Og4DFQ8ZGaQ.text: It's a traditional french bistro and the ambiance takes me back to Paris - right down to the woven chairs.   The menu is again traditional french and it has a good variety of things to try. The salads are very good... they have roasted chicken as opposed to grilled chicken in most places so that's a plus (I think it adds flavor to the chicken being roasted and not grilled). I had their brisket baguette sandwich (a little disappointing that it was greasy as all hell, but it was good). Their french fries are very good (sprinkled with Parmesan and parsley).   For lunch, come early (before noon) or this place gets busy, busy...

1iBI4MpezKTJTODYGC5S4Q.text: We've only been here for breakfast. The restaurant is pretty small, and it gets busy. Don't be surprised if you have to wait.   The crepes and quiche are delicious. The coffee is not great.

eMSRn0WsktxCCAk4g41osA.text: Great service, great atmosphere and good food. We kept it relatively simple but enjoyed our meals. My husband got the French country breakfast, which gives you a taste of everything, and as the waiter told us, is the most popular order. The wheat bread was nice and thick, whole grain and different than your typical store bought bread. I had the eggs Benedict. The hollandaise sauce was tasty and the poached eggs were perfectly delicious. I think the Canadian bacon could have been a tad crispier but still tasty. The English muffin could have been toasted more as well. The potato cake was unique and their spin on home fries; it was nice and crispy on the outside and softer on the inside. I didn't even need any ketchup or sauce with it. I ordered the Americano and the waiter came back to fill it with regular coffee when I was done (complimentary), which I thought was a nice touch. Next time, have to try the beignets!

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs, toast, potatoes, sausage
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Eggs Benedict

0kb4rVVPyRdLBvgeiH7f3Q.text: Love love love this place!  Not only great food and great service but wonderful ambiance! Their Brioche French toast are to die for!!

u135Ht8AtZlQBxasErQ5HQ.text: Cafe Monte did not disappoint!!!!  I bought a couple of $15 Groupons for breakfast and decided to give them a try.  This is a gem of a restaurant on Fairview.  Forget the Groupons - I will be back monthly for this delectable treat.   The music in the background adds the right ambience.  The patio seating is the best.  The French bakery meals remind me of home - New Orleans.  I highly recommend them.  The customer service is by far the best in Charlotte. I had the fruit de mer omelette with smoked salmon, crab, lobster, scallions and tomato.  It also comes with seasonal fruit, Toast with butter and jam, and a potato cake.  I was so excited I even ordered the wild mushroom, goat cheese and arugula pizza to have for lunch later.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cafe at lait!!!! Need I say more.

qLs5ujP0cFh3nCsjY5hmMw.text: Cute place, nice atmosphere for all occasions, solo at the bar or with friends- date in the dinning room.  Excellent service & attention to details.  Creating menu at times but still yummy

RRszkqLTWRR-RmPwFPcdNQ.text: Enjoyed lunch today. The steak and eggs were phenomenal, and the croissants (made in house) were wonderful! But even more so our waiter Zachary was absolutely amazing! Very kind and generous gentleman who did everything in his power to make our wedding anniversary special. Can not say enough how much we loved the food, the staff, and Zachary.

GEAGJBT3SlhCn-E661nNOQ.text: Just walked in to grab a coffee and pastry. Stood at the counter for 2 minutes waiting for service. I was completely ignored by 6 different people who made eye contact so I walked right back out. Not pleased.

bP6YDeOsnhuFef19mjuZxQ.text: I enjoy the brunch here.  Spent last Sunday and had their spinach quiche with fruit.  Service was great, conversation was great and the coffee kept coming. Perfect

LzHDvtuUMf9cvL_IudWQFg.text: I've had breakfast and dinner here, and loved it all!  Friendly, professional service.  Upscale environment, romantic ambiance. The star is the food, though.  Delicious! Everything I tried was delightful.  Go here!  It's a wonderful date night or a nice place to meet your bestie for breakfast or lunch.  You can't go wrong!

L7DMQxpqA-1mEap_5Mu5Uw.text: I knew I came to the right place with the crowd flowing in on a rainy Saturday afternoon. We were lucky enough to beat most of the crowd and immediately started off with the beignets. Light, flaky, warm - perfect snack as I debate the many options on the menu.   I ended up going with the short rib sandwich - the nasty weather left me wanting something warm and rich. This sandwich delivered; tender short rib bathing in provolone alongside sauted mushrooms and onions with a garlic aioli, topped with arugula to cut through some of that richness.   Others at my table ordered the tuna melt, chicken salad, and BLT. All received top compliments.    Service exceeded my expectations, especially for the lunch hours. Our server knew the menu down to each ingredient and made great recommendations.   I am looking forward to trying the rest of the menu.

xukCQyGRxaZpvUG2Xcn0wQ.text: Very nice place and great service. Food and pastries very tasty... we had the Benedict monte and a french onion soup... both very good! Will return

43LdKlsGTpR8joCVwfmw4g.text: Love the food at cafe monte. We stop by for lunch or brunch over the weekend. Lovely atmosphere and delicious food. Highly recommend the egg benedict and the trout.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp &amp; Artichoke Crepes
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Egg Benedict with SMOKED SALMON BENEDICT

UBl4Zg_eZTU3m-xSMXa3Uw.text: We went here for Sunday brunch.  I would recommend a reservation.  We had a party of 6 and were seated immediately at 1230pm.  Excellent service.  Everyone enjoyed their food.  We had HOT BEIGNETS that were great to share for a starter. Entrees for our table were Croque Monsieur, Lobster & Crab Crepes, Fruit De Mer Omelette,  Benedict Monte and Herb Basted Salmon.  They were all fantastic.  We will be back!!!!

eU8LvEVm2m3l4M7VW8vjDA.text: Food was ok. The prices were very reasonable and service was very good! I would go back for apps and drinks. The inside was cute and of course French inspired.

_wxxLLnw3TxefRIwc9mG6w.text: I really enjoy this place.  I like the atmosphere and the gluten free options.  Belgian waffles? Yes please.  It is a little pricy.  It does remind me of the little cafes in Paris.  I would go back again and again.

rj1Ma0obkgsgNsQCJvlSeg.text: We were gifted a groupon to Cafe Monte.   Ambiance was ideal, no strident music or harsh lighting. Bakery case promised future delights.  Grateful for a concise menu, hate to read a book to choose my meal.  The warm baguette with butter was so delicious it did not last on the table. Waiter graciously offered another one.  Chose beef bourguinon, meat was seasoned well and so tender, only needed a fork to enjoy. Au jus was beefy and could have used some extra bread to 'sop up'. Baby onions were sweet and mushrooms were finely sliced.  Winning dish!!!!  My dining companion  chose the roast chicken. Sadly, the herb seasoning did not infuse the meat. Without a sauce, there was nothing to say.  Macarons were nuggets of artistry. Enjoyed tremendously.   Minus one star since service was polite but we felt 'tolerated',  there was no attempt at engaging in conversation or inquiry about special ocassion. Another table merited a long and involved conversation.   A lovely place to enjoy when you tire of the chain restaurant scene.

VLScLG83QaYrOx9H5-2_PQ.text: It is always wonderful to have a brunch at Cafe Monte!! Benedict Florentine on hot croissant, chocolate chaude.. I can't think of a better way to start my Sunday morning ;)

BJs4txD5OkY0kl8DrInk2Q.text: Server: Javier B Food: Beef Short Rib Baguette  Well so much for a good experience that everyone has raved that I would have here. Every year I receive a birthday coupon from Cafe Monte but unfortunately I'm always out of town. This year I just so happen to be in town long enough to enjoy the coupon. However my experience today wasn't nearly as great as my friends have shared it would be.   Walking up I noticed two tables that were very dirty. But I said to myself, maybe the people just left. I walked inside and was asked if I needed help, instead of, " hello table for how many?". I responded that I would like to have lunch. The person {who wasn't the host} grabbed a menu and proceed to escort me to the dining area, but I asked if I could sit outside instead.  Menu The menu offered lunch, dinner and even breakfast items. I liked that for those that can eat breakfast anytime of the day, it's available and at a great price. I was undecided on what to order so I asked the server what he recommended. After sharing my thoughts on what I was thinking and hearing his suggestions I choose the Beef Rib Baguette with a side salad.   Waiting in food to arrive So as I waited for my food to arrive I could not help but stare at the two tables that went untouched and I cleaned for 20 minutes now. What really bothered me was my server noticed the tables were this messy every time he approached me. He even went so far as to look at the time while standing at my table. He also came out to gather the sugar packets off both tables and still didn't bother to remove anything. It wasn't until after I finished eating another man came out to bust the tables. It took him all of 3 minutes to clear the tables. Now why wasn't this done thirty minutes ago, I'm unsure. But for this to sit outside, in front of the restaurant attracting bugs is nasty.   Server I was not impressed with my server at all. He did not refill my water once my food arrived, nor did ask if I need anything additional once my food came out. After I finished my meal I had to wait another 20 minutes as no one came to check and see how I was doing. Still not drink refill at all and it was 85 outside. I had to get up, walk inside and ask the host if she could have my server come out to assist me. He then comes out and says, oh you've finished do you need anything. I was not happy and said yes my check thank you.   The service here was NOT what I expected at all. Especially not for the South Park Area.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Finally! Someone cleans the tables
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. First photo of dirty table

shroTEXkgKL5ggmFe0Zk_w.text: Disclaimer: review is for brunch only.  This is a GREAT brunch spot, if you can remember to get a reservation. If you don't get a rez, be prepared to wait 30-60 minutes for a table on the weekends (they're on OpenTable).  Their menu has a bit of everything...soups, salads, sandwiches, entrees, and breakfast dishes. I LOVE their Benedicts (traditional, smoked salmon, du jour, crab cake) and my husband usually orders the steak frites with the filet mignon.  One downside: their service can be pretty slow due to the number of tables each server is assigned. However, the staff is very friendly.

_FVF6B1UbZ-4_WV4mn4l-w.text: Tried this place for Sunday brunch. I would recommend making reservations way in advance. When we got there they said it would be about 45 minutes but it was less than that. Probably because there were just two of us. I had the crab Benedict, which was one of the best I've had! The crabcake's are perfectly spiced and the hollandaise sauce was delicious! Hubby had the chicken and mushroom crepe that was sublime! Loved the white sauce and the chicken was actually moist and tender not the dry, grilled chicken you'd expect! Was perfectly spiced!!  I had been looking forward to having their chocolate croissants but after ordering them the server came back and said they didn't have them :( so we had the beignets instead. They were delicious! Better than cafe du monde in New Orleans! Yummy! They have a Groupon for $30 for 15 and $15 for 9, I bought mine already! Get yours!

30ru0ytVmW13R-vrgGqCxw.text: This place is okay... This restaurant is tucked in the richer part of Charlotte, catering to the upper class. This place looks glamorous, but the food is subpar. Presentation of the plate looks good, but when you eat into the food, it lacks the 4 stars given. I had the Benedict monte that was good at first bite, but when eating some more, there were elements that didn't make sense. The tomatoes and asparagus tasted out of place and later made me want to throw up. The eggs were cooked perfectly and passed the Gordon Ramsey test. My boyfriend had the short rib with baguette and said it was too oily. The service was great though. I honestly am disappointed and rather go to a small hole-in-the-wall restaurant than this cause I know they'll serve better food.

4DHGEuoV1seGlc5wN39TPA.text: My hubby and I brought parents and a cousin here for an early Sunday breakfast. We did not make a reservation but were seated within 5 minutes around 9:10am. We had a seat in the back which was nice for people watching and it was away from the door on a chilly day.   I ordered a latte with almond milk and was disappointed to learn there were no dairy-free milk options. I opted to stick with water. My husband had a hot chocolate and OJ and seemed to enjoy both but I took a sip and personally felt his hot chocolate tasted like Hershey's syrup that was melted and mixed with water and milk.   I ordered two golden crepes but after reading reviews online added in the regular vanilla yogurt, berry and granola parfait without yogurt. I really just wanted a small cup of Greek yogurt but that was not an option. The berry vanilla option was fine and supplemented the very small portioned crepes. I personally think both were over-priced at $8 each and wouldn't rush back for breakfast. The crepes were served cold which didn't help.   Everyone else really enjoyed their meals and the breakfast platters were huge. My MIL ordered the GF Belgian waffle and said it was good but was cold and not crispy.   Our server was nice and efficient. It wasn't my favorite and I won't be rushing back for breakfast but I would try them for dinner.

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Two Golden Crepes with Nutella $8 - overpriced or underportioned

3ABXgn-yV4QD3lHR-cNgzw.text: We love Cafe Monte! My go to is the Thai Chicken Salad and my husband loves the short rib sandwich. Both are excellent. Great local spot with an inviting atmosphere and consistently good food.

9IoP3pzyQEV8nL0IyGdd7g.text: Came here for a fantastic Sat brunch.  Pros: - delicious and fresh food - large portions - yummy mimosas - friendly service - reservations on opentable - cozy but classy atmosphere - outside seating available  Cons: - expensive (spent almost $30) - parking can be difficult during peak times  I got the croissant with smoked salmon and cucumbers with a salad as a side. The salad was really light and refreshing. The croissant was buttery and flakey. And I was happy with the generous portion of smoked salmon. Mimosas weren't on the menu for some reason but they have them! I would come back but only for a special occasion. It's pretty pricey otherwise (though it's southpark so to be expected I guess)

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. smoked salmon croissant sandwich with side salad

Bj0-POVSm48TS4G1hsMuUA.text: We stopped by here for brunch and the experience was great. They do reservations which is a plus so I was excited to try it. I could see parking being a bit difficult during peak hours but this time I had no trouble. There is also a parking deck close by.   The decor of the places was great. It has a real "homey" feel to it. The staff was great and seemed very pleasant. I went with the Fruit De Mer omelette(salmon, crab, lobster) which was great. I'd definitely recommend it. They also serve you fruit and bread with this. I'll be going back to try out some of the dinner options

J9YgKi-GPYPTXDmcVkVq4Q.text: The food was very good but the service was awful. We were there for 3 hours (40 mins max waiting on a table which was okay) and the rest we waited on food. Several of us had to go to the bar to even get drinks bc our waiter took so long to get us anything. To compensate for our extended time they did give us 10% off and a free plate of dessert. But even that took forever to bring back to the table. I would have given them 1 star had they not given us a discount so in my opinion they deserved 2 star.

UniXdj4djESRBnjUoQKHUQ.text: I went here for brunch with a few friends and we all loved our meals!  The extensive brunch menu has enough options sure to please everyone. It was actually hard to chose between all of the great omelette's, pizzas's, quiche et I can't wait to go back to try more.  Update* I went back for dinner and was so disappointed, I orderrr a veggie crepe and it was doused in a heavy cream sauce, even though there was no indication of a cream sauce at all, I couldn't even eat it.   I would still go back for brunch but I think their dinner needs help.

4ihuNI_hRifZprkoGbanCA.text: I came here on a whim when I was in the area after catching a movie at a nearby theatre. I was in the parking lot next door when I did a search using my Entertainment coupon app and found that they had a buy one get one coupon here! I generally don't spend $30 on a meal, but I couldn't say no with such a good coupon. The place was crowded, no surprise as the restaurant was in a great part of town and had quality, authentic food. They gave us the option to sit at the bar in order to skip the 25 minute wait which was no problem at all for my girlfriend and I. We decided on the lobster and crab cakes which was one of the best decisions I have ever made. The meal was fabulous and had my tastebuds going crazy with excitement. I hadn't had lobster before this time either and when pairing it with a savory crepe you have mastered the art of cooking. Not only was the food good, but I was also full after eating here. I finished my meal with a small macaroon which I haven't particularly liked in the past and that was quite delicious too. I would most definitely recommend this eatery to anyone looking for good food, even if you aren't particularly fond of French food I am sure you can find something you like here!

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster &amp; Crab Crepes

5IT6fEYcpBzq2Mdl3vbTMg.text: Had a wonderful anniversary dinner. Steak was tender and cooked just right. The risotto was very creamy and delicious. Fast service. The fruit tarte was the best we've ever had. Would come back.

x_2UJXeLBvS3GU_M91A-Qg.text: This restaurant has been on my "to try" list for quite some time. I was in the vicinity and decided to stop in. I thought it was a quick-stop-in-for-lunch type of place. It is not. It is a full-service restaurant. I didn't have time to sit, order, and eat. So I ordered to go from the bar. My sandwich of choice was tuna salad on Brioche, toasted. After about a 10-minute wait, my to-go lunch arrived packaged neatly in a box. Surprisingly, It was better than I expected. This gave me pause to visit again for a proper sit-down, hot meal when I am not in such a rush.

DuTn5cX3pXqU3i2lTmhRQQ.text: This is a great restaurant. You absolutely need reservations, but if you get there and there is no seating available eat at the bar.  I absolutely love eggs Benedict but for some reason I did not order them. Instead I ordered a farmers omelette and while it was good I wish I ordered the eggs Benedict.  I went back and ordered one of the signature pizzas and I probably won't do that again. My friend like her pizza but my pizza benchmark is high..  I would come back and try the eggs Benedict like I originally wanted to. Oh the savory and the sweet crapes are great.

75-z_-kvQBcXLTZd1yGWCA.text: Went here for dinner. Delicious food and the service was great and fast!  I recommend making a reservation. Can't wait to go back!

bX4wQUBlW5ENb8a6bK3KYA.text: Wonderful atmosphere and attentive staff. Love this place!!! Went here for a bridal shower the set up was beautiful, the waiters were attentive and the food was delicious.I recommend most definitely.

dIHQIbiXvb3FTY40-KWsAw.text: This is my second time for brunch. When I first came to this place, the waiting was around 40 minutes as I came without reservation on Saturday. This is a pretty popular place for brunch. This time, I came on Friday after lunch time and there was no problem to get the table.  I ordered lobster and crab crepes last time and I liked the creamy sauce on it but it was a bit salty for me. The portion is good though. This time I ordered croque madam and it was great. I really liked the pommes fries it came with, thin and crispy. The food is good here and I like the atmosphere. It will be good to avoid busy time for waiting,also the noise level will be a bit high.

P9Xp8qqq67aB999PUC3bZA.text: Excellent service and best Florentine omelette in town Amber, my waitress, provided an outstanding service.

9YXP08aLem4Zw9YungVnvA.text: In addition to their French food, they also have the arrogant and haughty manners of authentic French restaurants. I went in by myself and the counter was full except for one lady who had her purse next to her. She was saving the seat for someone that had not shown up yet.   At the other end of the counter, a married woman was sitting down with her husband standing behind her. They were not eating. They were waiting for a table.   I very politely asked them if they would mind please sitting at the counter behind the bar so that I could eat. The husband simply stared me down as if to say "how dare you ask my wife to leave!" The management was no help at all. If they are that busy, they should politely ask people who are waiting to sit at the counter behind the bar and not occupy a bar seat. I wouldn't waste your money at this place either. I feel that it is overpriced for what you get.

d4LvrsithcWBes5NeaCccQ.text: I really can't believe this place hasn't been recommended to me! Very cute atmosphere, beautiful display of French pastries, espresso, and a large bar. We opted for the quiche Lorraine, beignets, mimosas, and the Benedict Monte. Everything was so delicious. The quiche steals the show though, it's the most buttery delicious thing! Service was prompt and friendly, we can't wait to go back!

ztW94V8i43oyhFMnaO633w.text: We love this place for brunch.  I would have given 5 stars except the wait for food and service was unusually long this past Saturday and the food didn't come out very hot.  Service is excellent and food is worth the price.  We love the ham & cheese crepes, salmon Benedict, traditional breakfast, bananas foster crepes.

uYt6ZIZc1cKV0ek71Diolg.text: Been here a dozen times. We first started coming because my wife studied French in college and we've been fortunate enough to travel to France numerous times so Cafe Monte seemed like a great place to visit (and it is close). Tonight was the first time with a groupon. We tried to use it last week. When we arrived on a Tuesday we were told no additional discounts with their wine special only to find out groupon is considered a discount when the check arrived; even though our food far out priced the groupon. Tonight we arrived at 7, all "specials" were gone. Ok, but this is the 3rd time this has happened in recent visits (2018). Yes, the specials are that good (especially the coq au vin) and it sucks that you need to be a "seasoned" guest who arrives at 5 to enjoy the specials. So we order off the menu. My wife gets  the steak. Again for the third out of four recent times the steak came cooked not to order (she wanted medium, not well). This seems to be a trend as the time I tried their beef wellington I was underwhelmed that the pastry part was dry and filet was medium well (no good for BW). My wife is GF and Cafe Monte offers GF bread as an option. We asked 3 times this evening and still nothing. I feel that the last 6 months the service and now the food have both gone from a 5/5 to a 3/5. Again, this is review is off of a dozen visits in the last 2 years, not just one. I really hate writing reviews that aren'5 5/5, but I feel that after 12 visits and multiples visits in 2018, this is needed.

vDKroTosLGHuaMc89LECWw.text: Tasty variety of appetizers. Among my favorites are the pate, artichokes and Bre. Delicious short rib. Good wine selection. Romantic atmosphere. Has live music on Fridays. Great table service. I need to come back here more often!

vE8rAYgxP4AZSBYtqq8Y3Q.text: So good! Went with a large group, and then went back with a party of four. The mussels in white wine sauce were very good. The risotto with jumbo scallops was very rich, and amazing. Best meal I've had in years.  Great wine selection. A must try.

L3zV4lRjncHZAdHSPID7iw.text: Good place for dessert, excellent customer service, live music on Friday night. A safe bet in an upscale neighborhood.

RWljW30kH4ABN7wtYUXrMQ.text: Great food. Loved the salmon croissant sandwich as well as the Florentine omelet. Service was top notch, great location and atmosphere. Cant wait to go back.

Tvt1XO043EVdLrCZ9j6O8A.text: Cafe Monte  Beautiful indoors and out, also beautiful food! I've been here twice before, and I have never been disappointed.  Hospitality is not abundant here though. The hostess had no smile and seemed very bored or in a funk (coming from a hostess, you are the very first impression to a guest, so make a good one). Service was also a little slow, but he apologized and did his job. There was no extra conversation, or small talk. He just brought us drinks, food, and the check! I can't really complain about that, it's all servers really need to do, but a little talking and personality would be nice!  Overall, great food and atmosphere! I got the open face vegetarian, and it was delicious, as were the fries that came along with it. My dad got the baby spinach salad, very light and tasty! We had the vanilla and pistachio macaroons and those are just so cute and sweet! Love it!

Ie2f2kkk_McmXYszFQ427w.text: Service is divine. Food is mediocre I hate to say. And it's expensive. We had dinner (my mate and me: a romance night out) and got tables in the corner sitting side by side which we loved. But the trout almondine is loaded with salt, and our $17 house special appetizer last Sat. might was cold in the middle. Wine service is exemplary: glasses are filled full for that $9. glass. I am torn about this place because they are so nice. Maybe I will try a simple salad next. Ha. Or just wine and dessert!

6avx4Ly0y7rCROpSZm7Img.text: The food is good, but the front of the house staff is rude and the manager doesn't seek to find resolution with issues. I'm not sure how they train their waitstaff, but our waitress had no idea how anything was prepared and made us wait a long time to find out. The manager wasn't helpful with a coupon we had. Additionally, the front of the house staff wasn't welcoming, or courteous. I was completely unimpressed with their staff, especially in the competitive southpark market. Fortunately, their food is very good.

fs61a1T58L3J_woHC-dHoQ.text: My new go-to brunch spot in Charlotte. I will be back to work my way through the menu. I'm not sure there is much I can leave in this review because I'll be back. I tried the eggs benedict, and it was delicious! The atmosphere is chic. Make sure to make a reservation since it gets busy. The bread they bring to the table is warm, soft, and delicious. Make sure to come hungry!

tT_BSo5eDJJ5Nt_34y5MeQ.text: My daughter and I love this place for lunch.  It is so cute.  She loves the nutella crepe and I, the tuna melt.  We both order the pomme frites.  They are the shoestring style that are thing and crispy.  We have also been here for dinner on several occasions and Cafe Monte excels in that are also.  I haven't had anything yet that I didn't like.  Service is always excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuna melt and pomme frites

UF7ILcb8f68IdobrswVQdQ.text: Ooo la la  My two favorite places in Charlotte are French inspired..  Cafe Monte and George's Brasserie.   Cafe Monte is great for coffee, pastries, breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Quiche Lorraine is awesome. I love that it comes with a small side salad. The perfect low carb meal.  The coffee is strong enough for me and that is saying something.  I do adore the pastries, but I can't always have them. Booo on calories and sugar.  Recently a friend and I popped in for coffee and breakfast while we sat and used the free WiFi to shop for vacation packages...  we still have no found the right vacation, but we did enjoy the meal.  You have to try:  The quiche The charcuterie The crepes The Macaroons  They outdoor patio is very cute on sunny days.. very peaceful on weekends because the parking lot is less active.

wnbm8w7iPrQYkR76Ax5Vew.text: I absolutely love this little restaurant! The food is delicious every single time and I have tried nearly everything on the menu!! My husband and I both say this is our favorite restaurant in Charlotte. It never lets us down - if you're looking for a delicious place to grab some food, look no further! The staff is great as well!

FnujAulJD4Qer_B0zB4-AA.text: The food was done well and very tasty! I had 1 complaint, everyone's eggs Benedict was cold, Not lukewarm but cold. I think it's important for restaurants to serve food when it is ready and always hot. Other than that this place was really good.

ng3D_kjEXej-8Lyw3_GwxA.text: Stopped in for dessert and coffee with a friend, as it was recommended to me by yet another friend. Cafe Monte did not disappoint. Their dessert menu left me with a very hard decision as to what to choose!! My friend and I split a raspberry chocolate mousse torte (I hope I got the name close to being correct) and a fruit tart. They were both amazing.  Wonderful, friendly service. This place is GREAT!!!

FnK-eq_84cy6mq_DEXaYdg.text: Our waiter Richard was awesome! He was knowledgeable and helpful. The food was great. We had the scallops and lobster specials as well as the charcuterie entree. I asked for brussel sprouts instead of fries and they accommodated my request easily.

jenGhJST_LIPde6K4l8Yfw.text: My husband and I went here for our anniversary dinner and this is my new favorite restaurant! We loved the atmosphere, & great service from our waitress, Lisa, who was so pleasant and attentive to us. Great food. We especially loved the Cherry Tomato Salade with Whipped Mozzarella Cheese & Balsamic Glace. The Beef Short Rib Bourguinon with mashed potatoes Pearl onions, Mushrooms & Carrots melted in our mouth. Grandma's Cheesecake was a delicious dessert. Plan to go back to this place. Would love to try more of their bakery goods.

lnskQ4vcSj_d6vISrakitQ.text: I try to do a monthly girl's brunch with a group of friends from the Charlotte area. We rotate between restaurants. The only rules are that the restaurant must serve brunch, they must have booze (sadly, only after noon on Sundays - so much for separation of church & state...), and they must offer some kind of eggs Benedict.   After all, I believe the Latin translation for brunch is mimosas & eggs Benedict for all. Right!?!? I read that on the internet somewhere, it must be True.   We always make reservations so we don't have to wait. We checked in but had to wait to be seated until our whole party was there. That's fair, but I sometimes scowl because I want to 'get started' with a drink.   On this occasion, I opted for coffee instead of booze. The coffee was good & strong. I ran out and had to wait 5 minutes for a refill once, which frustrates me. Also, on this occasion they really weren't that busy. There were a handful of open tables before 1PM. I found the service to be subar. Not terrible, but not on point. We frequently found ourselves looking around for the waiter when we needed refills or wanted to order.   My friends got different dishes, which I don't recall... But I surely remember my order. I ordered the eggs Benedict. It's a brunch staple, and really hard to mess up. It's not something I make at home, so when I have the chance to order it, I do.   Oh man - it was AWFUL. Absolutely awful. I've had different 'takes' on Bennies before, and I've had them where the sauce was maybe runny, or too buttery... and I've also had them when the egg was grossly over or under-cooked. I would have graciously taken any (or all) of those flubs over what I got.  The egg was cooked fine. The ham was fine. The bread wasn't toasted fully, so it was mush. The sauce - OH MY, THAT SAUCE - was repulsive. It was thicker than most, but that wasn't the biggest issue. It was SOUR. It was not only sour, but had God knows what in it. It arrived doused in the Bearnaise sauce, and even before tasting it I tried to scrape some off to no avail. Then I tasted it and it was disgusting. It was bitter, sour, and just plain nasty. I know some Bearnaise sauces (depending on recipes & taste) can be a little tart, but this was inexcusable. I tried to wipe off the egg & ham and eat them plain, just to get some protein and value out of the dish. I only succeeded at eating maybe one egg and some ham.   Normally, I wouldn't hesitate to tell the waiter this was terrible and request a different dish. But, the waiter never came back until long after everyone else was done. Someone else cleared our plates, and our bill was dropped off.   So after driving a good hour into the area to do brunch, and paying

wZ9dh5bfpEy0x6wkI0OEyQ.text: This review is for Jacob/Jake. It was my first time in today and I literally can't say enough good things. Jake was warm, friendly, made great recommendations and ultimately lead to my friend and I having such a wonderful experience/lunch/day.   Jake went above and beyond, far exceeded any expectation I had, and is the reason I would go back.  Well done!  Oh, the food was great too

jWmUrR4PAhzGkdQihuoKNQ.text: I am surprised to write this as I had two experiences here in one week. One was pretty good although some issues, on a weekday for lunch and the other was horrific and on the weekend for brunch. In general though this inconsistency leads me to believe that this will not be a worthwhile experience for the future especially if what you want is brunch/breakfast food.   Weekday lunch experience: Got a latte that was served in a big lovely mug, delicious! And then a Caesar salad with chicken. Pretty good. My colleague got a salad with Dressing on the side but they messed that up so she got a new salad. Total cost around 25. Good lunch but nothing to write home about.  Weekend brunch experience: So of course more crowded but even so, not a good experience at all. First, the time to get our food was pretty long. The waitress stopped by 1-2 times and did not offer black pepper like they did at lunch the prior time. But mostly the food was just bad. Many people around us had the same experience too. I got the waffle and a side of poached eggs. Waffle over cooked, eggs way over cooked. My husband got the eggs Benedict which was cold and the eggs were over cooked. A big surprise to see this for both dishes since they pride themselves on egg dishes. The table next to us had the same issue as did the one across from us. Big problem! But even worse the great latte I had the last time was far worse. No big mug, much smaller portion and weak overall.  After these two experiences I am sad to say i don't know how we can come back. Big warning to anyone else that wants good breakfast dishes too. Don't expect as much on a weekend for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The better latte during the week

UjjrcEO4a5zwPugPG5Sxgw.text: Ironically we had brunch here a bit before we went to Paris. It was a great experience, we sat at the bar and had terrific service.  Lots of gluten free options and the portions were excellent for brunch. We did wait a little bit, but it went by fast!

jXUFdJBTXvnachC_HDZyVg.text: Came here for a delicious Saturday brunch. The restaurant had a decent crowd. I'll break down the review  Ambiance- was great very authentic like Paris.  Service- the server was prompt and friendly  Food- I ordered the beignets they were hot and delicious. Next I ordered the short rib baguette. The short rib was tender and seasoned perfectly.   Parking- I didn't like the parking thought it was cramped.

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. HOT BEIGNETS

tJGgnt-DoXlO-Tz39WI2Qg.text: *This review was originally posted on my personal blog*  My girlfriend and I decided to give this place a try because we found a Living Social deal that was too good to pass up.  So glad we did!  The interior is fun yet elegant.  When we were there, they had live music playing in a corner and a pastry case on the opposite side.  It made the wait for our table a bit more bearable!  We were seated in the busy restaurant at a small patio (looking) table and were immediately served our drinks.  Our server was attentive and friendly.  We started with some pretty standard appetizers.  My friend ordered a salad, and it was dressed sparsely and was pretty basic.  I tried the French Onion Soup.  The cheese was delicious, but the broth itself was lacking in body and flavor.  We both agreed we'd try something a little more adventurous next time.  We sampled the Chicken and Mushroom Crepes for our entree.  This was really my friend's dish, but she let me have a taste.  They were rich and creamy and I kicked myself all night for not getting them.   I know it looks a mess, and the picture isn't that clear, but it was the best thing we had all night.  For my dish, I chose the special for Friday night:  Broiled Lobster with fries and asparagus.  It was fine, but the waiter really hyped it up and you know...you've had Lobster once, you've had it a million times.  It was delicious, but nothing special.  Plus, kinda messy and hard to handle with grace.  Next time, crepes for me.  After staring at the pastry case while waiting on our reservation, we decided we had to have dessert.  My friend chose the chocolate eclair.  The photo is blurry, but I'm sure you can see the cracks in the chocolate on top.  That was an indicator we should have heeded.  It was dry and uneventful.  Very disappointing for a French bakery.  Vanilla fruit tart was good, but it still had that "made ahead and sat around" flavor to me.  I was not impressed, but maybe my expectations were too high for a French restaurant.  Next time I visit, I will try the crepes to see if I have a better experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

pDbi4odWGJWasDZE8bWVlw.text: Cafe Monte has been on my list to visit, finally I made it! It is a very cute location, lots of parking!! I decided to sit outside but beware the bugs get worse at night! I had to go inside . They where eating my food more than I was lol  You get a freshly baked bread roll, still warm  I order the herb basted salmon. It was all you can eat mussels and fries on Monday night , but fish sounded lighter . No regrets! The fish was amazing !!! Cook to perfection, and a little crispy on the top. Served w mashed potatoes, and freshly cooked vegetables.  Prices, food very fair and good serving size  Wine  I feel it was a little overpriced for certain wines .  Service: good and friendly ( my server was Sean)  I definitely recommend Cafe Monte if you are in the area .

PHLTz2pPSmNEcb9042YF0Q.text: I have been here so many times for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  However, on this visit I was disappointed in my meal.  I ordered the house salad with Ahi Tuna.  The tuna was seared perfectly, sliced thin but less than adequate for $8.  The salad had a ton of greens 4 thin sliced tomatoes and  diced cucumbers.  It was hard to taste the cucumber as there were so small.  That's it.  It was tasteless.  Perhaps I should have inquired about the salad as it didn't meet my expectations.  Next time I will order one of the specialty salads on the menu. Service was great as usual from from of the house with the hostess to our server.  But I wish the server had recommended I stay with one of the other salads.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

xDsM78fDAIpRUpXQsIBBUQ.text: Kind of between 3 and 4 stars for me, service was ok, my food was great, BF's not so much. Cafe Monte is a great brunch spot when down in South Park. It works great when one of us wants breakfast (he always does) and the other is ready for lunch at 2:00. The atmosphere is cute and French of course but not the point where it feels uncomfortable or snoody. Entering the restaurant I was greeted by two hosts and promptly seated.   It was a mimosa kind of day so my bf and I both ordered one. Mimosas at Monte are not like they are everywhere else, here you'll enjoy a glass of sparkly with a splash of OJ. We thought this was a fluke on our first visit, nope, second visit confirmed that they do a boozy mimosa (not complaining about it). Now for the food. I ordered the short rib sandwich with caramelized onions. Loved everything about it and would order again and again. BF ordered the quiche Lorraine. Over cooked, the top of the quiche actually gave off the burnt taste and was unpleasant which kind of ruined his meal. Looking at the picture now, I'm kind of surprised they actually sent it out. We also shared a waffle, yes tons of food that's how we get down at brunch. Waffle was good but that's a pretty easy one. Next time we stop in I hope we both leave happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Belgium waffle
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quiche Lorraine
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

3o7AEGMlU00U7VxZ65q_0g.text: First time visit so I'll simply rate it on my experience, ordered the crepe and quiche Lorraine both amazing!!! The quiche was one of the best I've ever had. I'm only rating 4 starts just simply because the portions are so small. $14 for a quiche with one small slice it's just not enough. I've had the same quiche for less just as delicious and way more filling. I don't live in the area so I don't know their clientele and if this is what works for them that's totally fine but paying $40 for two small crepes and a quiche is a little much. You have to be reasonable. Either make a bigger portion or drop the price but that's just my two cents. I'd come back again but if I was a regular in the area I wouldn't be there on a weekly.  Also based on the crowd it looks like a lot of older people go here, a simple remodel might bring in the younger crowd and keep this place hip, again just a thought. I love French cafes so I'm all about improving and making it better. But if you don't care about little nit nacks like this it shouldn't bother you the food was excellent alone.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

VJuS9E-YZk_SluoU0LqE9w.text: Was told a 45 minute wait and I have been here for an hour and 30 minutes and still have not been seated even though people who were behind us have gotten seated and already have their food. After being seated we waited 45 minutes for our food which came out missing a meal, my grandmas was missing her steak, my moms quiche did not have egg in it, and when my grandma finally got her steak it was the wrong temperature. In the past when we came it was excellent so they must have had a off day.

H-FisHfX2Y8sG4QehBukHg.text: Their French Onion Soup is the best in town; a must have! Great date night place with amazing service. There was live music playing when we went but hard to hear from our table towards the back, which was a little upsetting. Overall, love the place and we will continue coming!

VEmrJz16I298cpiELiRZpA.text: If I could give this half stars I'd give this 3.5 stars. The food was good while the service was mediocre. We stood at the front for a bit waiting to see a hostess then got seated in a nice half booth half chair table toward the back. We got a glass of wine and a beer to drink and our server was not overly friendly. The French onion soup we got to start was wonderful. For dinner I got the mussels which came with these delicious shoe string style fries. My husband got the duck confit pizza and we enjoyed it both that night and the next day for lunch. I wouldn't rush back but I would return (especially for the desserts!)

icxh7HjmubHLzrz1-d0E5w.text: Came years ago, forgot about it, and recently went back after receiving a gifted Groupon.   The French atmosphere and density of tables reminds of casual Parisian cafes where people dine, socialize and have a good time.   The menu has quite a bit to choose from, with an obvious French flair. The food is tasty and while maybe a but Americanized, enjoyable.   The prices are appropriate, the service was excellent, and overall I look forward to returning.

C9U8k23KTcHIp0yHMAr-5g.text: Consistently good food and good service. A little pricier than some other places, but definitely worth it- especially for an occasion!  Scrumptious!

G0ACt58EwTHslHJF6MGBSA.text: Croissant...I feel like that's all I need to say. Best on I've ever had including croissants in France. The steak and eggs was lovely and the steak potato was a great surprise. My waiter, Javier, was superb. Being able to dine outside with my pup was also really nice. The decaf espresso is a fantastic ending to brunch.

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steak and eggs with a side of multi grain toast

aXAiXnjWbQ2lMl3oR7SVog.text: Simply put - the food here is Amazing!  Chef John and his staff definitely know what they are doing.   My friend suggested we attend their wine pairing dinner that they have the last Tuesday of every month. The wine dinner is about $60 a person. They pair a glass of wine with each course of the meal. When we arrived and I scanned the crowd, I honestly wasn't sure what I had agreed to. It was an older crowd and I honestly was prepared for bland and boring food.   But I was blown away from the very first bite. The food is made with love and passion. You taste it in every mouthful. I can't even begin to tell you what my favorite course was because everything was delicious. They had these potatoes that were individually sliced and then stacked back together. It created so much texture within that potato - I was mind blown. We had oysters that were sweet, fresh and the epitome of what seafood should be. The duck was tender and paired so well.   The wine they paired each course - amazing. I'm not a big wine drinker but there wasn't a wine I didn't enjoy.   We conversed with a few other couple and found out that this was a fan fave among them all. Many couples attested this was their favorite wine dinner in town. So much cheaper than other places and the food was the best. I can't confirm how much cheaper than others but you guys, the food is nothing short of amazing.   The night they have the wine pairing dinner - they are still open to public patrons so it's just the back part of the restaurant that is designated for the wine dinner. The wine is available to purchase by the bottle after dinner - at a great discount!   And the courses featured on their wine pairing dinner are items not on their menu. It allows Chef John the ability to showcase his talent.   So yeah - make your reservation now for their next wine dinner. It's always the last Tuesday of the month. You will not be disappointed. Just heed my advice when I tell you to take an Uber or Lyft. The wine will be flowing.   It's very intimate even the restaurant is still open. Chef John came out after dinner and spoke to everyone that came out. He's got a cult following apparently. People had gifts for him!   So enough of that - it was just so good that I went back for restaurant week last night. Again, delicious. The food here is definitely some of the best eats you'll get in Charlotte. I'm a fan. I had the jerk pork tenderloin with coconut rice. It was so much food. I should have taken some home.  But gluttony took over because I couldn't stop eating this meal. It had the perfect balance of all flavors - sweet, spicy, salty, bitterness (from the side of broccolini). I mean I'm writing this and now I want to go back. Like today.   My only regret is that I've lived in Charlotte for four years before ever coming here.

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Close up of taco
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Asian ribeye taco

hwzmrcYIA5FkwLs9iPPfXQ.text: Gracious Sunday Brunch  Time for another Sunday Brunch after Church.  Has become a bit of a concern with the new puppy because my wife does not want to leave him alone. You always hear about separation anxiety with pets but I always though they were talking about the animal and not the owner.  In any case, it worked out perfectly.  Could not get a reservation till 12:30 but since we get out of Church in Davidson at10:30am, it gave us a chance to split up the morning. Drove home and took him for a nice long walk, played with him a bit and back into his crate for a nice nap.  Left Cornelius at 11:45 am to allow time for construction traffic on I-77 and got to the restaurant with a couple of minutes to spare.  Walked in and with our reservations, we were immediately seated at a small table near the back. Cozy and intimate atmosphere that carries the feel of a French Cafe or Bistro well. Love the pictures throughout the building.  Our server was there momentarily with menus and gave us time to review but the beverages and the regular offering as well.  I ordered a cup of the Dark French Roast which was perfect. Good and bold yet still smooth.  My wife ordered an Espresso Martini which she enjoyed as well. Sounded a bit unusual but then again I used to enjoy Irish Coffee so in the same ballpark.  We had reviewed the menu on line before we drove down and my wife had spied a Beef and Asparagus Crepe she wanted to try. Unfortunately it was not on the menu but when she inquired about it, she was told that it was on the dinner menu and they could offer that as well for Brunch.  Score one for the restaurant on the Customer Service side.  I ordered the Fruit de Mer (Sea) Omelet and it turned out to be one of the best omelets I have ever had.  Great variety with smoked salmon, crab and lobster and I think a little shrimp in there as well.  Perfectly done. The Toast was good and the side of fruit, while a bit heavy on melon was also good.  Easy to see why this place was voted one of the top 100 places in the US for Brunch.  Great menu and execution, great customer service and an elegant dining atmosphere.  Easily going to be a favorite.

QrcyIvZPckSvpvQaFdGL_g.text: Visited here for the second time and had drinks at the bar, pre-dinner. Loved my mojito! We've had excellent service on both of our visits, with very personable and helpful waiters. Most importantly, the food also did not disappoint! Beef bourguignonne for me and duck confit for my boyfriend. We loved our dishes! Best recommendation from the waiter: sub a side for the risotto with veggies. It is so delish! We'll definitely be back, and we're excited to try brunch too!

tEuGdNbjfzCExyWcNYFqhQ.text: Definitely get the beignets. They come covered with powered sugar and delicious jelly on the side.   The menu was difficult to read, but everything we got was great. We both got breakfast, and omelet and the French country breakfast.
