S1GxhbJkDGLGMfJ_QNE9yg.text: this place seems very popular with the south park milfs ( moms id like forget) lots of 3 and 4 tops of moms sinking bottles of wine and sharing plates .   Ok now the rest , as mentioned  in most reviews the service is awkwarkdly slow at times  between drink and ordering . I suppose thats manger wants patrons to drink before meal , who knows but can the majority of reviewers be wrong?     -   ok now dinner ,   endive salad great no complaints , entrees   beef bourguignon & confit duck .  The beef was very good and reduction was ta ta tasty  served over a big bowl of  yummy mashed potatoes with mushrooms (ok)  carrot (meh)  and  pearl onions (yay)   the portion was BIG -    the duck confit  was tasty but the plate was small compared to the beef . It was very tasty and served with fingerling potatoes , potatoes were avg compared to the mash  . All in all postive if you want straight forward french inspired food you should be ok here . Besides that it should be supported for fact its not a bs chain restaurant ps charlottesucks

8pRhNjorkiV8Zpp-X8W2ww.text: The atmosphere was great during Sunday brunch, good mix of people(After church crowd, older, younger, those recovering from Saturday night, etc..) decor was very much French bistro, outdoor seating and forced to walk by the pastries and goodies as your seated inside. The service was lacking.. I will echo the not refilling cups of coffee trend the other reviewers mentioned. The classic eggs Benedict were great and the hollandaise was perfect. The ham and egg croissant was very uninspiring and was served alone on a plate, some fruit or salad would have been nice. Will return to try their fries and onion soup.... to see if that influences my rating.... until then...

_jmzOCONxCYMHfOGli9cWw.text: i'm kinda obsessed with they're soups!!!! dislike the servers and they're arrogance but the soup I love!!

XV7Sm7l-qR472qEbK-0PZg.text: ate here once when they first opened and during restaurant week (should have known better) and it was just decent....really glad I went back. The Trout Almondine was 1st rate. My wife's veggie crepes were stellar as well.....cant wait to return. Great coffee as well....

JxAj1RL0ATapJiTJjkWrUQ.text: Quickly becoming one of my favorite places in Charlotte. I love the atmosphere and the food is DELICIOUS. I love to sit at the beautiful white marble counter on Saturday morning and have brunch with my husband.

vnpn3IPybly1OTVbMAQ_OA.text: Great brunch.  Excellent cafe au lait and espresso.  Very good burger and delicious fries.  My wife had the steak and eggs.  Casual, comfortable and satisfying.

Vu-IiQDstDwxJA7z4e-9Bw.text: This place is amazing. A work colleague took me here for dinner, and I was really impressed. The entire host and waitstaff are highly professional and look after the customers' individual wishes and concerns throughout the meal experience. Of course the most important part of going to any food establishment is the quality of the food itself, which I can confirm is excellent at Cafe Monte. I had a pizza that was just the right size and was topped with fresh ingredients. When I found out that the establishment also serves breakfast and brunch, I went there several times for that, too. I usually get the parisian omelette with brie, which is the perfect breakfast if you are really hungry! Since I have been to Paris several times and studied francophone culture, I appreciate as well the attention to detail with respect to the furniture and overall decor. I guess it feels like being in an authentic French brasserie but without the actual Parisian, unpleasant side order of waitstaff attitude!

Xy3L_YqCeMurTHkn34T2Yg.text: I went there as treat for my birthday with two of my closest friends..The prices..well is a bit pricey, but the food there is asboslutly mouth-watering! The service there was slow... it took about 25 mins. for the waiter to come and ask us for our order.

ifbks2xu4eMLdaAFT6YQrw.text: I really wanted to like Cafe Monte...some of my friends just rave about it.  On a recent trip for Saturday brunch, however, my omelet my was nothing short of tasteless.  My friend wasn't impressed with her meal either.  I may try it again, but only not for brunch.

cSzlHzKm6wN9naaPDSL8qQ.text: Me and the wife tried went for brunch and and a great experience. I ordered the Quiche Lorraine with salad and the portion was plentiful and tasty. My wife had the French Breakfast and upgraded her toast to a croissant which she raved about. We had to wait about 20 mins for a table but it was worth it! The service was real good as well. Would definitely go back and recommend to friends. We were seated at a small 2-person table which was crammed next to another table and which was our only discomfort.

H1pDCpZVWf3wM6cBCgk9gg.text: I get it- but I don't get it.  Let me explain..We went on a busy Sunday morning and asked if we could sit outside. We were told to pick any table but the problem is that all of them had not been cleaned since the last customer.  We sat at a table with someone's leftovers for about 10 minutes and no one came out to bus the table.  When I went back in to speak with the hostess, I told her we had moved to a less dirty table.  Once we sat down at our new table, I knew it would be an interesting meal.  I swear we were sitting right next to the Real Housewives of Charlotte.  Each woman had downed a bottle of wine and their conversation was very loud and obnoxious.  Then, my mimosa came out with what looked like a pubic hair hanging off of the side - yum.  The food was fine but it was nothing to write home about.  Like I said before - I get it, but I don't get.  This place has a lot of potential but I could not deal with the type of people that choose to dine here.

2Le9PMryw5sS7Ci3H-WdFA.text: How does this place stay in business? After having an acceptable lunch, we decided to try it for dinner. My beef dish was inedible, the red wine served warm, the hummus refrigerator cold, and everything else at best mediocre. It's a very nice looking restaurant, but after this experience, and after talking with several other people who have also made the major mistake of trying to eat there, we will not be back.

l3i_ay2zDk8z5-fOuKD4Qw.text: I lowered my expectations ahead of time since I'd read the other yelp reviews, but Cafe Monte managed to outdo themselves with bad service AND bad food.  Our server passed by us several times, and when after 10 minutes I asked pleasantly if my companion and I could please order some water and coffee, he literally rolled his eyes and walked away. Then he served the beverages with no utensils or napkins.   I won't quibble with the uninspired menu -- it's Cafe Monte's choice to offer what they wish, and mine to patronize the place or not, based on looking over the menu in advance.   But the simple strawberry crepes were stone cold -- not room temp, not chilly, but obviously just plated straight from the fridge and served! (OK, in fairness, they may have been run from the freezer through the microwave on "defrost.")  The filling was the same pasty, tan substance as the topping. I thought it might have been a flavored cream cheese but I discovered at first bite that it was neither flavored, cream, nor cheese.   Should I have sent it back? If I had seen our server, or any server, I might have. Rather than ask my companion to wait while I attempted a reorder, I nibbled the few slices of strawberries, picked at the crepe itself, and chalked it up to another mediocre suburban restaurant outing.   Au revoir, Cafe Monte.

EGGgEELOT7EZ_2EZa_Kzsg.text: I really liked Cafe Monte - you can tell even when you walk in that this bakery means business. The pastries are awesome! The people behind the counter are really nice and accomodating. You need to try this place if you are in town and have a sweet tooth - you won't be disappointed!

pXOhET2PrN-5C0Zz_VtkDw.text: My whole family went here for Christmas Eve dinner.  Hoping to experience a nice evening, we were disappointed.  The duck and salmon were was too oily.  And the steak was tough.  The flavor was nice, but definitely left something to be desired.  But we were very disgusted when they pretty much kicked us out.  At 9:35 pm!!  They started clearing our whole table before some of us were even through with dinner.  As we started to get ready to leave, they even turned the music off!  They just couldn't wait for us to get out!  The last time I am taking my business there.

tCSO93wNU8VgIWEc3Hvi3w.text: They do some things well but a few problems drag down the overall rating for me. On our most recent visit there was no one to greet us and we had to wait for a little while for someone to seat us in a nearly empty restaurant at 11:20 AM. Once seated everything was fine, the waiter was good and the service fast and not "overbearing" My biggest problem with Cafe Monte is the inconsistency of the food. We have been 3 or 4 times, it has ranged from fantastic to meh...our most recent visit was ok. my quiche was good but nothing special, mushroom soup was good, frites could have been better. My wife's pulled pork french dip was not bad but a little soggy and too much bread which was a little greasy. we were offered a couple of uninspired dessert choices but as we left, noticed some lovely pastries in the case. We would have ordered some of those had they been offered.  All in all, it's OK but I long for a great French Restaurant in Charlotte.

g-B8K3mLH9KL1AY-vxZEtQ.text: Cafe Monte is absolutely my favorite restaurant in Charlotte!  I must enjoy this restaurant about three or four times a month!  The host and hostess work to get you your preferred seating and the service staff is outstanding. I've never ordered anything that was not delicious, not to mention the wonderful atmosphere!  Warning; you must make a reservation for the week-end nights two or three days in advance!  Enjoy

5qo4ouQpOikUB9SYjXzNtg.text: A great new addition to Charlotte- casual dining. The portions are just right, at a good price and there's something for everyone.  Service is very slow though.

RjwaSMgXEEBK1u2scfPfQg.text: FYI.  This is a French bistro, not a Italian place like some one has suggested.   Beautiful decor complimented with great classic french food.    I've had the Steak ou Pouvire and Duck Confit, which are both fantastic.   My wife have several different version of the crepes.   It reminds me of the bistro in Paris or Vienna.  It's a truly refreshing addition to the South Park restaurant scene.

jhl0Yw8gezQg3hHwwfyPRQ.text: Every time we visit Charlotte, we inevitably end up back at this old time fave for a French bistro meal before or after shopping in this tony area.  Cafe Monte has the look and the feel right with the woven back chairs, the dessert case resplendent with French pastries, and waiters dashing about with long black aprons.  Our hosts over Thanksgiving love to come here for a monthly tasting of French wines, which sounds like a fun evening the last Tuesday of every month.  We just love to come for brunch, lunch, or dinner!  Expect everything to come in a cream sauce and just go with it, even if it is the day after Thanksgiving!  Their salads, pomme frites, savory crepes and even their pizzas are very good.  Since we had homemade apple pie at home to finish, we somehow managed to depart without trying any of the pastries.  I've saved those to try on our next visit along with the duck confit pizza I should have ordered instead of the very tasty pizza margherita.

_-oGbLiYDhYntwzvxNQExw.text: Ok well maybe I was a little harsh because the service is usually good maybe a little snooty one time but I've waited tables before and maybe he had an off day. Food is good and that's what it's about in the end.

nw_-xjomGWfCHe936XZrpA.text: Gosh I really want to like this place more.  I want it to either taste better or cost less.  As it stands, the food is decent, not outstanding, and the price is certainly high.  This past Sunday we took all four of the cherubs out to breakfast.  We arrived promptly at nine am and were quickly seated.  Kiddos were presented with a menu - white paper - no crayons, of course.  They only pretend to want children to eat here.  We ordered two kids meals (nutella crepe with fruit on the side) and one of my children ordered off of the adult menu.  I ordered an omelette - the waiter suggested brie cheese - I agreed and it was an excellent choice.  My husband did not like his egg benedict breakfast - he said it was really bland.  The potato cake they served with the breakfasts was also bland. however my daughter loved it.  I have had the nutella crepes before and I loved them but they were only so-so this morning.  My kids were well behaved, everyone ate well, and all was good ... until we got the bill. Over $70.  Really?  My husband asked that I please, please, never let us eat here for breakfast again.  Agreed.

eavsgSfdKMrzSvIEZZIriQ.text: I've been to Cafe Monte's many times over the years, as it is one of if not my favorite restaurant in town.  The food is always excellent and the service has also been uniformly good.  I love the Benedict Monte, but have had other dishes that are also wonderful.  A great place really for all occasions.  One of my neighbors goes there for the coffee.  I've used it for dates with my wife as well as extended family meals.

DHuGAfItxK5gvWtpAiPoJA.text: Went to brunch Sunday with my sister and 2 friends. Not only was the food amazing, the service was even better. Shout out to Lisa for making it an incredible experience for us. You can't go wrong with her as your server or anything on the menu for that matter! Can't wait to go back!

MgBWUISqkVZ6-HbRbHtmGA.text: One of my greatest joys in life is eating and trying new restaurants. I'm not sure why it took me so long to get to Cafe Monte, but I finally did and stopped here twice in one week.   It's a great atmosphere for Sunday brunch (off the menu) or to meet a colleague over coffee in South Park. The environment is nice, the service is attentive and friendly, and the coffee and food is great! The decor is very French and adorable. Although many people are dressed well because of the neighborhood it's in, I also saw couples that were out for their morning walk or stroll around the neighborhood stop in wearing more casual wear; a place to stop in no matter what you are wearing.  They have a cute, casual bar area to grab coffee and a croissant, little cafe tables outside, or a large dining area with booth seating lining the walls or full tables. Great for small and large parties alike.   I ordered the Benedict Monte and it was very good. I could only eat half due to its richness in flavor, but that is French food for you. Unless you like that much rich taste, I would recommend ordering a couple items and sharing with your partner to give your taste buds a bit of variety.

iZEOQ_FuTTtvM6eA0Dzw_w.text: Our third time here for either brunch or dinner. Each time the quality of the experience has declined. This time the hostess quoted a 15-20 minute wait. After waiting for a half hour asked how much longer the wait would be and was told "I told you it would be 30 to 45 minutes". Had that been the case I would have walked out.   Ordered eggs Benedict which were very good served with a greasy cold disk of potatoes that tasted like they had been fried with fish. I should have substituted salad. The other three at the table said the meal was ok and all remarked that it was not warm enough.   I still can't believe a French restaurant does not have Salade Nicoise on the menu. Ah well!

jsWj_JGadXvCT4xwGRAuXg.text: What a great spot for Brunch on a Sunday! The menu has something for everyone and the food is quite tasty! They get pretty busy so make sure you have a reservation. I will definitely go back.

FxEHfl6NS_Ymy3XE9XN-Dw.text: We came back to Cafe Monte after having had a bad experience in July. The owner contacted me and gave me a gift certificate to make it right which I appreciated very much. I waited until now to be able to go with my dad again as he lives out of my state. The certificate didn't sway our opinion at all because we don't need those to eat places lol. It was an altogether different experience this time around though. The waiter was extremely attentive and sweet, especially considering we brought my 8 year old and some places in Charlotte seem to frown upon children diners. My dad and I had cram of mushroom soup and coffee to begin and wow, that coffee was fantastic. The soup tasted so fresh and earthy. He went on to have the seafood omelette which he devoured by the time I had a chance to ask if he liked it lol. The filet and eggs I had were perfect, I didn't need a steak knife, it cut like butter. My daughter finished her burger and fries and went on to have some madeleines which she fell in love with. Me and my dad finished with a lemon and pistachio macaron and they were the perfect way to end a perfect meal and experience. Thank you cafe monte, we will most definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids burger plain
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Filet and eggs
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Madeleines

yVwWwOHKVVV2nyU8iSt9zw.text: Great for locals, do not try if you are from out of town. Waited for 25 minutes after making a reservation. Given the worst table in the cafe right next to the band. The online menu did not reflect the same food being served. Got up and left after another ten minutes when we didn't receive any service. The food may be good but I'll never be back to find out.

_zkUumdK8DygQlf0MuUjJA.text: Went for Sunday brunch.  One word: spectacular.  I want to come back for dinner because they seem to have all the delicious French delicacies that you can't get at very many places in Charlotte (duck confit, escargot etc.).  The food was delicious and the service was excellent but the most surprising thing of all was how beautiful this restaurant is.  I felt like I was in a Paris at a cafe when I walked in but yet it did not feel like a wax statue, it felt authentic.  I cannot wait to go back.  One of the best restaurants in Charlotte.

jB0Xr7hzC7cv_TR1qpRGow.text: No one every wants "French Food", but this place will change your mind. Great atmosphere, and our server was fantastic. My wife had the chicken and mushroom creeps and it was great.   I had the short rib baguette and it was in the top 10 sandwiches I've ever had. Everything blended together perfectly.  We look forward to our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. View from the bar

6bxw31xYMEtNnv701mykMA.text: Were seated immediately on a Saturday morning - completely forgot how busy it could've been and was surprised a table was available.  Started off with beignets after seeing everyone else had ordered them - I immediately understood why. Light, puffy, and not too sweet. Amazing with the berry preserve.  Also ordered berry crepes - very small and probably not an amount worth what we paid for, but they were good.  My new go-to for a nice breakfast.

o1t9ZXubmjTcvBBnuPE9TA.text: I have stalked this menu for months, thinking that once I actually had time, I would be able to indulge. Sadly disappointed. My highlight was the Escargot.. placed on small buttery, flakiness... I was in heaven for 2 secs. I ordered the Parisian Omelet, requested NO ONIONS, and received ONIONS.  Ordered scrambled eggs with cheese, received NO CHEESE. The potato cake was fried alittle too hard to enjoy. The staff was courteous however, I didn't receive what I wanted. Since the order was takeout, this made the experience even more distasteful and disappointing. A waste of $30!

dE29oV9HQQ5SI8T1mvmMXA.text: The sword fish tonight was one of the best things I have ever eaten. The service from Lisa was OUTSTANDING.

cjGPdDUo_JDYiQwyZdhbfQ.text: I've written reviews for Cafe Monte before. My husband and I started dining there shortly after arriving in Uptown, Charlotte almost eight years ago. Lovely, charming French Bistro, wonderful staff and excellent food. When we left uptown we moved to SouthPark where we could just walk to Cafe Monte, and we did. (Mostly) same, wonderful staff, same fantastic food, beautiful presentation. We live in Ballantyne now and make a point of dining at Cafe Monte when visiting SouthPark. Just ate there this past week and had a chat with Monte who came to our table to say "hello". We marveled at how he managed to maintain his standards, consistency in the kitchen, well trained staff. We told him that Ballantyne NEEDS a Cafe Monte (specifically, BALLANTYNE VILLAGE!!!). So here I am on Yelp shouting it out: "Monte, PLEASE open a Cafe Monte in Ballantyne Village, pretty please?!?". There now, got that off my chest. :-)

azLKqBuX0k93LudJOEVbKw.text: Came here for brunch twice and both times everything was great! It does get very packed for brunch so I would suggest making reservations ahead of time! The bread they give you before your meal is so soft and yummy! The first time I came here, we tried the escargot and beignets for appetizer and they were both really good! I had the chicken and mushroom crepe which was delicious and huge portion!   The second time I came here we had the french onion soup -which was a bit bland and sweet ( not our favorite)  For my entree, I had the lobster and crab crepe- SO yummy! they give you tons of crab meat! My husband had the steak and egg which he was satisfied with.   I also got an order of the almond chocolate croissant to go which was to die for!!!  This place has quickly become one of my favorite brunch place!! yum!

JZP27DhdiJA9eAtSiMacgQ.text: We ate dinner there the other night and while the food was good the customer service was below standard. The hostesses didn't give eye contact when we approached. They didn't even crack a smile. We waited 15 mins for our reservation and stood there awkwardly in the foyer as the bar was full of diners. Don't offer reservations if you don't take them seriously. When we were sat the hostess just walked off. No "enjoy", "enjoy your dinner", nothing. I thanked her and received no response. Sadly our server wasn't much better. I asked her how the artichoke app was prepared and her response was "um, artichokes cooked at high heat." I looked at her blankly until she actually described the dish. She did the chef a huge disservice as the dish would best be described as marinated artichoke hearts  roasted at a high temperature and topped with roasted red peppers and served with a side of spicy aioli (she called it mayo, couldn't tell you the spice). my husband ordered an old fashioned from the bar. It was crap. I ordered wine. The wine prices are actually extremely decent. But she never asked if we wanted another drink. The food was great and people put hard work in preparing it. I feel bad that it is overshadowed but crap front of the house staff. My first and last dining experience. I had such high hopes!

J1_lqj-SOisxKdxxGQ-QbQ.text: Good food if your not celiac. Their "gluten free" menu is available upon request. I requested a gluten free meal off this menu and unfortunately was not served a gluten free meal. Very sad because it was yummy but completely not worth being so sick after. Will not return and I hope they take cross contamination and gluten free allergies more seriously. If you can't comply just do not offer the options.

UK3uCxQQIh9zJBsLJduTKw.text: One of my favorites with great service. There is not a single item on the menu that is not perfect!

7MjmZZgBEM-LuHG7U_FjiA.text: The excellent service was my favorite part of the dining experience.  We had a slight issue with extra charges not being explained when we swapped side dishes, but it was only a matter of a few bucks.  The steak fritte was very tasty but the french fries were insane!

Ahei-eUt_rq-3UZzwb_sYA.text: Food and service are consistently stellar.   My most recent visit included a family member with pretty major food allergies and he inquired about a dish's ingredients. The waiter seemed a little nervous and sent out who I believe to be the owner, who was extremely gracious.  Everything was delicious and we plan to return soon. Some of our favorites are the Trout Amandine, Beef Bourginon short ribs, Mussels with frites, and any of the crepes. Their desserts are also to die for.  Fabulous place overall, check it out, you won't regret it.

LLdY0ArZxhm4i8WdLGjQ8w.text: I've been wanting to try Cafe Monte for some time now. I found myself close by around lunch time the other day, so I decided to stop in.  I was seated immediately and my server promptly came by to bring a menu and take my drink order.    Honestly, I was a bit under-whelmed by the menu. I was really hoping for some really nice French dishes beyond just crepes and quiche.  The menu options were ok but not outstanding.  So, I decided to go with the Chicken And Wild Mushroom Crepes in madeira creme ($14).    I really wanted to try the pommes frites to see if they are as good as I have heard, but I wasn't really that hungry and my server told me the dish I ordered was pretty large.  So, when she brought my plate out, I was glad I skipped the fries on this visit.  The crepes were cooked perfectly and smothered with delicious creamy chicken & mushrooms.  I would order this dish again.   When I first walked into the restaurant, I had noticed a counter with all sorts of yummy looking pastries, so I decided to order a coconut macaroon to go.   It was tres yummy!   I agree with Nicole's assessment - this may not be the best French cuisine in town, but it is solid.  On my visit, the service was good very good and I would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken &amp; Mushroom crepes

cO1Sts9svDMPqyW37_S47w.text: Having had Cafe Monte for breakfast a good while back I was expecting the food at dinner time to be on the same quality. We had the fondue as an appetizer which was good. Ordered the duck confit as my main. Presentation was lacking seems like they just threw the food on there. The duck was really dry and basically the only part I enjoyed was the skin. And for $20 meh I ended up eating everything because I was really hungry. Probably won't be going back with there being so many French restaurants around.

pd0mi8CEsPQ6j25imN-7qw.text: Food was wonderful.  I've had better seating at a McDonald's as they crammed 7 people at a small table for 6 in a crammed corner. We would've enjoyed the food more had we been able to sit comfortably as I had to get the food to my mouth while resting my arm across my husband's chest.  It was also not pleasant being rushed by the wait staff to finish my food so  they could clear the table.  Enjoyed the food but I don't expect we will be back.

9XNOqzeP9caUmmhCXXztTQ.text: Last night was my second visit and the love affair continues.  Everything was delicious with one exception, the Escargots starter.  It did not have much flavor.  That being said, my husband's Trout Almondine was the best he's ever had and my Chicken and Mushroom crepe was delicious enough for two meals. The bread was divine and the service on point. Once again, a terrific experience at this restaurant.

yn2EolCghIuuFYY-pGLtNA.text: My wife and I have been eating here since the place opened. Like a good French wine, the place improves with age! The service is always great and rarely is the food anything but great!

ZGxUAbdwMLHhcskxy0xDOQ.text: I went here for a weekday lunch yesterday with coworkers.  The atmosphere is cute and quaint.  I felt like I was in a little French Bistro.  The menu had many options and I had a hard time choosing.  I went with the hamburger.  I think it would have been good had it not been so undercooked.  I usually prefer my steaks on the rare side, but this hamburger was a little too pink even for me.  The french bread while I was waiting, the side of fries that came with my burger, and a chocolate macaroon for dessert was delicious though!  I will give this place another try sometime.

Zsq9776vWaZ8M9dyUrCSHA.text: This was my first time at Cafe Monte. The ambiance, customer service, and food was great. The beneits were super delicious!!! I also customized my omelette which was zesty and savory.

7k7UHXnrqjmN-kCZmQp-EA.text: We found the place on Yelp and decided to stop in for lunch before running some errands in the neighborhood. The atmosphere was delightful, and the food was excellent. My wive ordered the Parisian omelette with Gruyere rather the the Brie and cheddar offered on the menu. Unfortunately, it came with the Brie. They offered a replacement which we declined, but they comped a second glass of wine. My chicken and mushroom crepe was huge and delicious. We will return the next time we are in the neighborhood.

umH5OmHcIW75hyl9p0NQYg.text: Went for brunch with my girlfriend and got the shrimp and artichoke crepe which was wonderful. She got the smoked salmon croissant, seemed like a very popular item and was very fresh. Will be back soon!

cghp8EwJ_GwRxZe2qanO_g.text: I love this place, food is great, service is awesome and the food to die for. My favorite spot to go to. Just went for restaurant week and there menu was the best

XfnSgmuZGmwOKv61CpphZg.text: Found this place today and glad we did. Food was delicious and lots of different things to choose from. Service was great and parking was easy. We"ll be back.

CwowowuHrjhFpQq0a41Fjw.text: Went for brunch this past Sunday.  Food was good, but not anything special.  Service was just okay from the seating to the actual meal service, which was a bit slow.  I had the Benedict Monte, wife had the crabcake Benedict.  Again, nothing particularly wrong, just not so great.  I don't think we will be back for breakfast.  Terrace cafe is a better choice, pancake house maybe too depending on what you like.

uDeQZ1WTe-Zdx1bWzFXefw.text: A girlfriend and I grabbed lunch at Cafe Monte a while back and I'm happy to say it was solid. The best French cuisine in Charlotte? No. But a nice lunch choice if you're in SouthPark? Oui!  With French cafe cute insides, Cafe Monte hosts really great, attentive service and a nice array of items. I haven't been yet for an a.m. or p.m. meal, so I'll just focus on my lunch. I went with the B.L.T. with a side salad - damn good bacon, soft yet crunchy bread and a light touch of mayo, exactly the way I asked for it. The side salad was fresh albeit a bit heavily dressed. But I have to note that my friend's french fries were outstanding. I couldn't keep my paws off of those hot little frites. Good thing she shared!   I definitely want to head back to Cafe Monte and try some more deliciousness.

8FlInVY41Ja_Ygdv8HCg4Q.text: Best steak in Charlotte, NC - especially for the price ($22!) Better get the bearnaise with it as well

N6hcKYgMYw70XLETkWIgPg.text: Went for breakfast early one morning. Sat at the bar and had excellent service and who doesn't love an omelette with bacon and brie? The breakfast was amazing and I'm already looking forward to my next meal there.

Ed4G8lFUB4CZF_JOU0L67w.text: My partner works at 11 a.m. on Sundays, so it's difficult to find a brunch place that opens earlier than 10:00 a.m. so we can enjoy a nice, leisurely brunch.  For that reason alone, we normally just go to the Original Pancake House.  On the drive there, we were reminded of Cafe Monte, a place we had always driven by but never stopped.  We turned into the parking lot and discovered -- what's this? -- they open at some crazy-early hour on Sundays.  We walked in and I was immediately excited, as I was reminded of the French cafe at Epcot, as well as an awesome coffee shop in Chicago.  The restaurant was immaculate and decorated so perfectly, giving it that French feel.  The accompanying, relaxing French music only added to the mood.  We were seated right away.  We walked past the display case of pastries, past the grand counter/bar, and into the dining room full of dark wood accents, large mirrors, and vintage images of Paris.  Already I was glad we had picked Cafe Monte over OPH.    We were greeted promptly by our server and ordered coffee.  The coffee was brought out in small stylish cups and I was worried -- being the big coffee drinker I am -- that it would be a challenge to get refills.  I'm happy to report that not once did our server (or other servers or manager) allow me to see the bottom of my smallish cup.    I went with the Parisian omelette on the menu, which was ham and bacon with your choice of cheese.  Naturally, I chose brie.  We were in a French restaurant, right?  It was full of ingredients and very flavorful.  The brie really accented it.  Served with it was a thick round hashbrown patty, a small bowl of fresh fruit, two slices of -- ta da! -- toasted French bread, and whipped butter and freshly made (?) jam.  Everything was absolutely perfect about our experience that I can't say enough about it.  The pricing was slightly more than you might normally pay for brunch, but it was totally worth it.  The atmosphere, the service, and the food were everything that I needed for an awesome brunch experience, so I'd gladly pay the couple extra dollars.  Thanks, Cafe Monte!  We'll be back!!

S6Z9Z4P-W3u1h6Pjx4X4Jg.text: Came here for dinner with a gifted groupon. Definitely make a reservation if you plan on coming on a Friday or Saturday night, as you may be waiting a while. Luckily, I preemptively took my own advice and came with reservations.  We ordered the duck confit and the chicken and mushroom crepe. While waiting, we were served a freshly baked loaf of bread, which was fantastically gooey on the inside. Good bread is hard to come by, an this one impressed me (5 stars!).  While waiting for the food, we had the chance to check out the ambiance. Two things stuck out in my mind: noise and clientele.  Most notable was the noisy buzz of music and talking. Whereas many movies may romanticize French restaurants as quiet establishments with perhaps a soft piano, Cafe Monte was buzzing with life jazzy music and rather loud conversations and unruly drunken laughter from a neighboring table. This made talking with my companion difficult to the point of leaving with a raspy throat. I would have preferred a more relaxing and quiet environment.  Secondly, we both noticed the rather stuffy clientele. Many (boarding of most) men were dressed in 3 piece business suits and ladies in fancy evening gowns. Don't get me wrong, there is nothing wrong with having a fancy night out, but there was an air of pretension that seemed out of place. Cafe Monte is a nice restaurant, but it ain't the Ritz. It made for some fun people watching, particularly when we added our own voice over, but overall contributed to making us feel under-dressed (despite wearing a nice button-down shirt and slacks).   The food came out in generous portions, laded in butter and cream. The chicken and mushroom crepes were pretty good (4 stars), but the guilt of all that creamy sauce comes fast. I defy you to finish all of it. The duck confit was a little above (3.5 stars), but broccoli over-salted (coming from a lover of salt).  We both left with a feeling of 'meh': by no means bad, but not exactly memorable. We also agreed that a much needed run was needed the following day and that we didn't feel the need to return. I will say that I may have since had some impure thoughts regarding that bread of theirs.

NlA3FPjMGRezklcLctLNmw.text: Very tasty and good food options.  I have lunched there 3-4 times and it has become a favorite. The chicken salad croissant is to die for.

bPXRceZ80YvLpME53n7yGQ.text: You know those restaurants you go to, eat at, aren't particularly thrilled or disappointed, and the restaurant kind of just disappears from memory?    This is how I felt about Cafe Monte the first time I dined about one year ago. Service was on the slowish side, and the croque madame was like something I could make at home.  It was good, but not memorable enough to go back for another one.    I recently went back for take-out,  after a French onion soup craving.  To my surprise, the menu had expanded and now included some items like a lobster Louie salad, which I was so looking forward to, paying an $16 for.  A good crab Louie on the West Coast is well worth $16.   Unfortunately, it wasn't worth it here.  The soup was pretty standard to be honest.  Granted it was takeout, so the soup wasn't steaming, but even if it were served fresh from the kitchen, the cheese would at least have a nice golden brown coloring to it.  The cheese on this thing was white as white/pale yellow as can be. I would pay $4 for a cup of this stuff...not $7.   Moving on to the salad.  I was more than bummed.  The Louie usually has avocado, hard boiled eggs and sometimes asparagus and some other variations, depending on where you get it.   Here at CM, there was just leaves...and chopped lobster meat.  The lobster was plentiful, don't get me wrong, but it was as tough and bland as rubber pencil erasers. I felt ripped off.  I could envision the chef taking salad leaves out of a bag, and sprinkling pre-boiled lobster on top.   Hmm, so far not so good. At the time I was HON-gree, so I ate both. On to dessert.   The dessert case here is beautiful.  There was french macaroons and coconut macaroons, various croissants and fruit tarts, and a bottom row of cakes. I chose a slice of carrot cake, and a blueberry muffin to take home to my husband who likes a good blueberry muffin.   I'll tell you.  The cake could very well have been from COSTCO.  No, wait, the COSTCO carrot cake is better.  I'm not kidding.  This one was dry and the only saving grace was the frosting, which moistened things up. The blueberry muffin too was dry as if it weren't fresh. (It was $5 badly spent, and I was mad at myself.)  TIP: I should have asked if they made their pastries in-house, or bought them from someone else.  Also ask when they were made.   The saving grace?  My kind server who prepped my to-go order, gave me two free French macaroons. Were they light and tender on the inside? Yes.  The shells, nice and crisp? Indeed.  The flavor?  Very off. I think a good macaroon should have a distinct flavor, and if you don't know what flavor it is, could recognize it. I couldn't tell if it was apricot or honey...heck, it could have been ground beef flavored, and I wouldn't have known.   The reason I give CM 3 stars versus 2, is the good service I got the second time around from the server and man at the host stand.  The order was about 7 minutes late.  (I called and was told it would be 20 minutes, it ended up taking 27 minutes. Hey, my car has a timer in it so I took note!) The ambiance is quite nice, very Parisian. I've heard nice things about their brunch and perhaps it's True.  For dinner, these two items which are pretty difficult to get wrong, fell short.    The star count could go up if perhaps CM thought of itself like a bistro, and lowered their prices.  Focusing on a few really great items and making things more consistent.   Go if you have a BOGO coupon from one of those coupon books or group-buying sites.  I would spend my $ on LuLu if you really wanted some French.

qmUzWNlE1be0yqROjI4-lA.text: This was our first time here. I got the crepe with berry compote and my husband got the quiche lorraine. We both ordered the cappuccinos as well. The food was nothing spectacular, just average good food. I wished the crepes would have been filled with some sort of filling. The berry compote on top of the plain crepes was good. Everything was good, just got exceptional.

Wh2KRMZWB0DdM7pvfBl6pA.text: I didn't eat there but I bought a pastry to go.......three words  CHOCOLATE ALMOND CROISSANT!!!!!! You'll hate yourself if you miss it.

G2nvVAhy0ryCvzp-46t2Ow.text: Very nice French-style Bistro. Went for dinner. I had the Steak Frites, and they were more than happy to substitute the green beans (now known somewhat pretentiously in the French vernacular as "haricot vert" - duh, green beans in French!), which are not my favorite, with very yummy wild mushrooms! Steak was a NY Strip, again not my favorite (I'm a ribeye guy) but it was good and cooked medium per my order. However, they gave you a choice of Bernaise or Au Poivre sauce, and I chose the Bernaise. MOST EXCELLENT! Very buttery (Hollandaise base) so good choice! My wife had the Beef Shortrib, and that was yummy too. The taste reminded me of a really good potroast (but up a few notches). The wine special was a Chilean Cab for only $22! In a nice restaurant like this, $22 for a good cab IS a find by anyone's standard (wine snobs excluded).   For desert we had their house-made Mousse, which was really good! Very chocolat-ey (is that a word? I'm using it anyway).  Our service was excellent, with a very attentive but not overbearing waitress. Food was served hot and was delicious AND very affordable! French Bistros in the bigger cities (NY, Chicago, LA) are MUCH more expensive. Our dinners were just over $20!!! Coming from Las Vegas, THE MOST EXPENSIVE food town in the US (YES, it IS!), our meal would have been more than DOUBLE in LV.  So overall, a VERY good meal and affordable! Definitely a must return!

D7HpS-WPQc9IBeasXW_H9Q.text: Love this place for a quick trip to New Orleans without the flight. The Cafe Au Lait is superb. Fruit is sweet and seasonal. The Smoked Benedict was just okay. Eggs were overlooked and Spinach a bit gritty. The restaurant was very gracious. Will come back.

vQnyzdHj1D0nWV0N3WnmBg.text: BRUNCH! Such an incredible meal that I can't understand why everyone doesn't like it! Anyway, I adore this spot  it is located in a moderately busy shopping center and I have never had an issue with parking. Let's move on to the menu...  Coffee: I love coffee, while I may be no expert I drink it in all forms: black, sugar/cream, flavored. I understand that traditionally they do not offer flavored coffee but somehow I was able to get vanilla added once and it was very tasty. Was not disappointed.   I am in love with the eggs Benedict on a croissant. While I only divulge in meals like this every once in awhile it is amazing. I don't really care for English muffins but a croissant.....mmm mmm mmm! The croque Monsieur and croque Madame are also very appetizing.   The service is always on par and I have never had a bad experience In that aspect. Never too long of a wait and a speedy checkout. I hope you get a chance to check this place out bc it does not disappoint!

yrc0IP--bEHtZN-v5HZGTw.text: I have eaten at Cafe Monte before and have enjoyed it thoroughly so I was surprised at what happened when I stopped in for lunch today. I was seated at the little bistro table next to the window and ignored. While waiting for up to 15 minutes without so much as a glass of water, I noticed that others that were seated after me had been given water menus and conversation by their waiter. I went up to the hostess to ask her why I was being ignored by the waitstaff. I had my jacket on and was ready to leave as there are numerous other restaurants in the area. The manager came over as I was leaving the restaurant and asked for a minute of my time. I explained why I was upset and why I was leaving. He said he wanted to make things right and offered to comp my lunch if I stayed. I went back to my table. The waitress came over and apologized for ignoring me. Apparently during the table assignments to the waitstaff my table was missed and no one was assigned to it. The manager brought my lunch over and apologized again and the hostess came over to the table and apologized as well. They made things right and  turned a bad situation around. I left Jennifer a nice tip. I will return to Cafe Monte. PS-The chicken salad plate is fantastic, and their coffee, although not French press, is excellent.

QpUCGUJRZW3b8gXbi-9LIQ.text: The professional attitude of the staff and the food quality and presentation satisfies any perfectionist!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

t-KReU6nwrbUrq5HWzo8Hw.text: First timer at Cafe Monte for Sunday Brunch and it was amazing. We made a reservation for 12:30, restaurant was very busy. Very bright and light atmosphere, nice French decor. Nice outdoor seating area. Wait staff is awesome, our waiter Frankie was wonderful!   Okay on to the food. We started with the beignets, if you don't know what those are they are fried dough balls with powdered sugar and Cafe Monte's beignets were the best I've ever had! Lightly friend and soft on the inside, you can either get three or five to an order. For the entree my mother got the quiche florentine and a side salad, the quiche was very cheesy but not overly so, and was delicious. My father ordered the quiche lorraine with a side of French fries, both were delicious! I ordered the beef short rib sandwich, which comes on a warm baguette with beef, provolone cheese, and arugula. It was hands down the best sandwich I have ever had!   Portions were very generous, prices are very fair, service was very attentive and kind, five stars!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef short rib sandwich! Best sandwich I&#39;ve ever had!
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Quiche Florentine, delicious!
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The last beignet! Hard not to eat all five!

MhCImdOVnuaVyqSB8YXyrw.text: I'm going to do a pro & con list to make it as easy as possible to lay out my thoughts about the restaurant. Consider my review more like a 3.5.  Background/Facts: - I've eaten at Monte more times than I can count.  - I visit mostly for breakfast and brunch.  - I've been to Cafe Monte several times for dinner. - My husband has celiac disease and cannot have any gluten.  I'll do the con first so as to end on a positive note.  Con: - Biggest problem is food quality consistency. I tend to find a favorite dish and order it over and over again. Doing things this way makes me aware of any changes made to the dishes (also, simply the poor execution of said dishes). So, for example, I can't help but notice when the English muffins served as part of Monte's Classic Eggs Benedict suddenly become smaller and very hard. I wonder each time I order Eggs Benedict if the poached eggs will be runny as one would expect or hard boiled. I detect when a chef uses way too much onion in the quiche Florentine, and I lament when the quiche is hopelessly soggy. Knowing that the food can be fantastic on the next visit keeps me coming to Monte. I just wish they could tighten things up when it comes to the consistency of ingredients and food/cooking quality.  Pros: - Beautiful atmosphere. Sun streams in during the mornings, and the restaurant feels romantic at night. The music from French artists adds to the delightful feeling at Monte. I like the furnishing and decor choices whoever designed the space made. It hits on a lot of what Americans expect French cafe dining to feel like, but it does it without being overly Disney-fied. Also, there's usually plenty of parking close by.  - Servers are always friendly, knowledgeable and helpful, which is especially important when dealing with the gluten-free thing. We eat there so much, the employees know us by name or at least face.  - Coffee is always great!  - Great place to take out-of-town guests.  So there you have it. Cafe Monte will remain on my restaurant list in maximum rotation, but I am watching the consistency issue. I hope I am not let down.

FI3y94f4e5Z8Rdu6uMmrQw.text: Half price bottle of wine for $15 - how could you go wrong?  Authentic French food in a bistro style settings. Had their macaroons and they were delicious.  Tough place to come to if you are dieting.

FRM2_RL1ius2-uNvQieGIA.text: My wife and I used to love Cafe Monte; went all the time.  Then we took my brother in law there a year or so ago for his birthday, and noticed a significant decline in both service and food.  We took a year off after that and tried it again this weekend.  It's actually declined a bit further still and I doubt we will be back.  French onion soup, which used to be pretty good here, came out tasting like dirty dish water (I think they must have actually made it wrong).  Steak was a poor cut - fatty and not remarkably prepared.  Prices remain pretty high ($20+ for an entree).  Menu hasn't changed at all in years.  Wait staff pushes you out the door.  Over the course of the meal, I noticed other customers complaining about one problem or another.  Given the competition in Charlotte, they need to step it up.  Perhaps freshen up the menu, retrain the wait staff, improve the food to justify the prices.  Positives: bartender mixes good drinks; great live jazz some nights.  We really did once love this place so I hope they get it back on the rails.

XAEoSv1RSP3AxIR4-rdk1A.text: I came to Cafe Monte for the first time today with two friends and everything was great from being sat, to service, to food, to paying. We had a great waitress who was knowledgable about the menu and offered suggestions. I love quiche so I just had to try it and it was to die for, baked to perfection  I will definitely be returning soon!

pLFoVuDYsFhUak0OqzDs5w.text: Wow!!! What an amazing place! Food is wonderful, but the real gem there is Kat. She works the bar and I can not begin to put into words how she has blessed my life with her kindness. She truly makes me excited to go back there.  The food is amazing, but for a broke college student it can be a bit pricey. Way worth it thought!! Splurge and pamper yourself with the great food!!  I will continue to go back there!

Jje2Ss8xjnrrhv7i9Z2hSQ.text: I thought $6.00 was a lot for french beer, but the bartender sold me (only three beers on tap and one was Stella A).  I was not disappointed, beer was great, with a hint of cinnamon.   We had a large party, so we had to remind the waitress for more bread and she forgot a few drink orders, but she was friendly.   I had beef over mashed potatoes and it was succulent, tender to the touch. Everyone was raving about the salmon, which looked good.  The creme brulee is awesome, I tasted the chocolate mousse , which was good but the brulee was great.  Tables are a bit close together, so I would not plan on a quiet conversation unless you go late afternoon.

cJ2jRKcQLOWRc7Uf2YnitA.text: My favorite spot especially for brunch. But let's get real seriously everything here is to die for. Always great service and the atmosphere is perfect. I wish I could dine here every day. Love!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab cake Benedict and the Benedict monte.

XVhqBoBL3DHUi18klByBMA.text: Arrived Monday at 1245 pm, it was packed. Had shrimp and artichoke crepe and chicken salad crosissant (sadly there were out of the short rib baguette as conveyed by our most apologetic server).Both lunch dishes were tasty, more than generous portions. Always feel you get your money's worth at Monte's. An added bonus was the arrival of Charlotte Panthers tight end Greg Olsen who was greeted with a mini standing ovation.

2Jip2dPUiByAncEiyH69wg.text: The side of sauteed Spinach was incredibly salty otherwise the color was wonderful and it smelled great. The side of sauteed mushrooms looked really good, but they were way too peppery. I never season my food, when its cooked right there isn't any need to but whoever made those dishes had a very heavy hand. I NEVER leave food behind and I didn't even finish half of them.   I had to ask for a steak knife. Waited until someone bothered to make eye contact with me to ask for it by the way. The steak was cooked perfectly - rare just the way I like it and the texture wonderful. The thin french fries were great too, very good! Flavor, texture etc. but as I ate the steak there was way too much seasoning on it as well. Seasoning shouldn't over power the flavor of a good cut of meat and this did.   The biggest issue I had: the staff really needs a lesson in professionalism. I heard one woman behind me talk about a female condom which was just PART of their conversation. They were all huddled in the back while there were people at tables on the floor. Totally turned me off. I saw waitress and waiter in disagreement in the middle of the dining area while setting up a table. One couple complained they had been sitting there ignored. The gentleman got up and said something to a waiter and the manager came over and appeared to make amends in a grandiose way.  My own waiter walked by and for some reason never made eye contact. I was not sure why  - to be clear I NEVER give anyone a hard time nor am I anything other than friendly. Even if the service and food are not up to par.   I was seated in the back, on the left (if you are facing the kitchens) so had a birds eye view - and ear - to everything. I told one friend that I actually felt like I was in restaurant boss type episode and there was a hidden camera somewhere, it was that ridiculous with the staff and how they were acting.   The Manager must have realized I heard what I shouldn't have heard because he gave me a box of free pastries and apologized. The staff treated him, quite honestly? - like crap. It was embarrassing. The fact that those kids (some of them - others adults) acted in such a manner in a restaurant that I'd heard NOTHING but rave reviews about? It was disappointing.   The fact I heard him trying to discipline them - they ignored him - was probably not smart on his part either. He seemed frazzled and angry and just disgusted. Lets just say the atmosphere that night was a 1 star. If the staff acts up like that? Get them in the kitchen and send them home, don't do it where patrons can hear.  In all fairness maybe (hopefully for the owner) this was not a regular occurrence because friends of mine RAVE about this place. For breakfast and dinner saying it was one of their favorites. I went on a Coupon to try it out, and at first loved the atmosphere but it went downhill from there. I also can't see paying that kind of money for a meal that was "eh"   I always eat every bite on my plate and I savor each one. I didn't take anything with me except the free pastries and my french fries.   I judge a place on different criteria and I have a sensitive palate and nose. LOVE food. To cook it, eat it, buy it, read about it etc. I think I am a good judge of what I see, taste, smell and - hear.  I'd recommend other places before this one for DINNER - may consider giving them a shot for breakfast type fare and will say the ONE WONDERFUL thing - the best thing about this place - the desserts. They were a little stale but it was after 9pm so that isn't a biggie in my book.   I bought a slice of Carrot cake and Tiramisu - the waiter had closed my bill without asking me about desserts at all by the way......I watched a waitress across the room RAVE about them to a full table of people ( I was solo) and she had me craving them. He was going to give them to me for free because he closed the bill out. I insisted on paying for them and will tell you that it was "THE BEST" carrot cake I've ever had! I'd order a whole one for my birthday cake if I could.   The free pastries the Manager gave me? Macaroons are awesome almond cakes too and croissants with chocolate in them. I would recommend this place as a BAKERY and I may give them a shot - after hearing a friend say the crepes were really good - for breakfast. However, not my first choice or even second for Dinner.   For the owner? You have your work cut out for you, I am not a professional in the food service industry but you should consider "Restaurant Stakeout" if you find your patronage decline.

uBes76nIA72Uoo9ZRGDuUQ.text: Good service, great food! We got the all you can eat mussels (Monday night special) and the beef & asparagus crepe. Both were delicious

_CTuRp8UIwJpkKxITnsArw.text: Would have loved to try this place out but we were turned away which is a complete first in my life! They said they were not taking walk-ins but offered the bar which was empty. We said we would sit at the bar but then were told we couldn't sit at the bar because we have a child. Why offer the bar when you see we have a child when it's "against the law" to sit at the bar with one? We have sat at other restaurants at the bar before so I don't know what's different here. We are new to North Carolina so out of curiosity I asked what the different rules were regarding children since we have sat at other restaurant bars in North Carolina with our child with no problem and the manager was very defensive and rude. I have a feeling they just didn't want a child occupying a seat that an adult could potentially sit at making the restaurant more revenue. Very disappointed.

bWaN7ErRQX7fbsuVe-oj_g.text: Service was very good      space is quite nice   location is good     My wife went recently .... All in all very good for brunch....   SC

UaZJ9rylksev6kB31hVn2A.text: This used to be my favorite brunch spot (mainly for their Eggs Benedict), but after the last three times I've ordered EB here I'm strongly considering looking somewhere else now. The main issue I've been constantly having is that they over-poach their eggs; the yolk is not runny whatsoever- it'll be of a gelatinous state. Even when I've requested that they be undercooked they'll still come out overdone. Also, their hollandaise sauce has started lacking the vibrant flavor it used to have; now it's close to being bland. The newest issue I experienced today is that they no longer serve a nice, thick slice of Canadian bacon on it... instead they have replaced it with two paper-thin slices of deli-style ham (per side). For around $14 I expect the better quality that they used to serve, not the poor excuse of an Eggs Bene they are now trying to pass off.

EkIYu3g60xk2Hote5jJ4Mg.text: I love Cafe Monte. I'm so happy that they continue to put deals on Living Social and Groupon. Even if they didn't, I'd still frequent this quaint little restaurant. Beware...it can be quite busy on Sundays for brunch, but that's my favorite time to go! Order a cafe latte and sit back and people watch. It's almost like being in Paris. And then the lovely waiter brings over a plate of delicious prime rib on a french baguette and piled high with pomme frittes. Oh my yum!! I admit, I order the same thing every time! I have tried other things on my friend's plates, and it's all perfect. Merci!

j_eTPWXJXNfP0lp8bsqIXQ.text: First time here for breakfast and I'm really impressed.  Excellent service, great atmosphere, generous tasty food.  Sorry I have been missing it for this long.  Started with the beignets and then had a wonderful egg white omelette.  Arrived here 5 minutes before opening and within 10 minutes the place was full of patrons.  Place was packed with a line out the door and still service was excellent.  This place knows what they are doing.

NsB8QvTZaE-rWokJvsp9bA.text: I've ate here a few times and did not really feel welcomed.  Well today JAVIER fixed that as he was quite pleasant and very attentive and made me feel welcomed as I dined alone.  My meal was delicious and loved my coconut cake for desert.  Javier thanks was your wonderful service - hope to see you again soon. Host up front,  you should greet guess with a smile and also acknowledge when they leave to show customers you appreciate their patronage.

Xp5ZAnt40uWhkDlE_mc2AQ.text: Love, love, love this restaurant!!  Rachel, our server was great!  Chef Justin is also incredible!! He normally works nights and I'd highly recommend getting a taste of what he creates!!    I ordered the croissant, mashed potatoes, and a side of sauteed zucchini and squash. Yum! Amazing! These croissants are very French.. So of the best I have tasted. There mimosas are also some of the best I've had. Really good orange juice with the right amount of fizz to it combined with a good pearing of wine.  Trout & Pom frites -  Loved it!! Way better than anything my friend has had here!!! Her favorite so far! She liked it best with mushrooms and no capers.   Cesar salad - croutons were the best part. The romane was wimpy, hardly any crispness to it.      Dressing:      Cesar- Not good, hardly any flavor bland with light fishy after taste      Champagne vignette-  good  My friend ordered the Salmon one time & salmon eggs Benedict another. She said they were both outstanding and perfectly cooked!   For dessert: The original coconut macaroons bring me back to my mom's cooking. Incredible!!  Highly recommend this place!!

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Omg! Yummy mashed potatoes
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Penne with butter wine sauce. A little too much seasoning for me, but good for the first few bites

ktX38RxCSGp7q_PwdFDK4w.text: The past two times my husband and I have eaten lunch here have been absolutely wonderful and we have had the same waitress (short blonde hair and glasses). Our service was al at stop notch, and except for the horribly loud yoga moms next to us this past time- it was great. Food is great, service is great, and I always get a kick out of the interesting south parkians who roll up there at lunch time.

U9q_Rqb4_bQz1kaV56Ya2Q.text: We' We' Cafe Monte' This place is amazing from the service to the ambiance to the food. The only reason I didn't provide them with 5stars is because it's ridiculous to charge $5 for a scoop of ice cream to accommodate a dish that is served hot and typically with ice cream in the perfect world (bread pudding).  We visited Cafe Monte for the first time during Queens Fest after riding past on a regular while visiting Whole Food. We were impressed with the staff upon arriving for our reservation and how nice they were and how quickly we were seated even though we were early. The 3 course meal plus a glass of wine went as follows: Salads: I had a tasty arugula salad with grilled peaches atop and my husband had a duck salad that he devoured  Main course: I had the scallop risotto and my hubby had the sword fish both were extremely tasty.  Dessert: we both had the bread pudding which was amazing and even better with the ice cream that cost $5 for one scoop to share (Really). The wine was tasty as well we were given the house Pinot Grigio and Pinot Noir . Overall we will give them another try and not order ice cream unless it's included with the dessert (-;

1AvcFOpgcBS0fvkfGDNcGg.text: Excellent quiche Lorraine. Crisp, warm & fresh!  Excellent chicken & mushroom crepes with cream.  Chicken club sandwich not my favorite. Skinny fries so good. Busy place!

Xaw7ZgmEg4HZdKKA5NQITA.text: This was my first time at Cafe Monte and I was admittedly a bit skeptical, but boy was I pleasantly surprised. The dinner service was very good and the food was excellent! I started with a French martini which was both delicious and potent (they do not skimp on the alcohol), followed by a spinach salad, and the most amazing roasted chicken (well seasoned and perfectly cooked, crispy skin, but moist and delicious meat). My husband had the duck confit which was delicious as well. If you want a taste of France right here in Charlotte, try Cafe Monte - highly recommend!

bWqsqbmY_Iq6UD6S_Nskeg.text: Loved that the mussels and fries reminded me of Belgium.  The cocktails were delicious and the wine choices were lovely.   I also had the creme brulee which was delicious.     I went with a group of 6 for dinner and everyone enjoyed their meal.  Service was good and ambiance was relatively quiet.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bar area

l85e-xcRccq3m5YWWXJswA.text: My first time visiting the South Park / Charlotte area and my brother suggested brunching at Cafe Monte. At first, I was a little hesitant (being that there's a Tupelo Honey also in the Charlotte area), but I LOVED it.   I ordered the French Country Breakfast and was extremely satisfied! My brother and I also shared the Brioche French Toast and it was delightful (with or without Nutella, my favorite). I was also surprised to find hot beignets on the menu!!!   Also, our server, Kyle was extremely attentive and hospitable. The French decor and the ambiance was outstanding. All this and more made this local French bistro a place to return to when in the Charlotte area. An "A++" in my book!

DsMrMpFnHj4N6G44zvBz4Q.text: Try the seafood omelet! Try the crab cakes! You can taste the sea and it's worth every penny. Absolutely delicious.

aYa6NZe2sSNMn6E427bCmQ.text: Used to be my favorite "go to" brunch. Lately service has slipped. This morning it was terrible. First - I had made a reservation a week and a half in advance requesting a half booth out of the way of foot traffic because we had a toddler in our party -- we get there and were told it was already reserved for another party. Second - service was horrendous. The party next to us came, got their food and left before we even got our food. We had to go to the front to ask for our checks to LEAVE. Third - it was sweltering in the place. I was wearing a knee length sleeveless dress and was still sweating. Fourth - the staff was extremely unapologetic and not at all conciliatory. I still left 20% tip - I usually leave more for brunch - they earned 0%. I will not be back after being a return customer for years.

JRnos3okuLVJzFNXNrf1cA.text: Very French menu, yet was just here for brunch, so perfect. Try the beignets. They had at least 3 styles of eggs benedict, so look no farther. Large dining area and a little outside tables too, but should have a reservation, it get busy.  Good atmosphere, great service. I like a little more hollandaise and they were happy to get me some. We were visiting from out of state, so remember that you can't get a mimosa or bloody mary til 10am. I'll certainly be back.

eWQ8Kzq4zRVylGYGp7Tszw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. Staff is great and the food is wonderful.  It is a special place for entertaining family and friends.  We love to go there on special occasions.

FWX7-UmixyIOIkPvr8YKbA.text: Tres Bien!   Hopefully that's right....I'm brushing off my high school French classes....so forgive me in advance.   I'd had this place on my radar for a while. And since I finally had a few days off I decided to give them a try. I'm sooooo glad I did!   The atmosphere is adorable. I loved the decorations and flowers on the tables, it truly makes you feel a bit fancy.   I stopped in for lunch and started with a bellini. That thing was delightful. It packed just the right amount of flavor and liquor and I could have helped myself to a few more. For my meal I went with a classic the croque-monsiuer. It's basically a ham and cheese sandwich on steroids....because it's got so much extra goodness!  There's crispy bread, it's stuffed with ham and cheese and then topped and baked with guyere cheese on top....OMG....seriously I can't tell you how good this sandwich was. I enjoyed every bite! It comes with a side of fries, they weren't my personal favorite a little too "crispy" (burnt) but if cooked a little less they'd probably have tasted a little better. But they certainly didn't take anything away from how tasty that damn sandwich was!   I figured why not go all the way out and splurge on dessert....so I ordered the beignets. And I did not regret my decision at all. They were by far some of the best I've ever had. My goodness. Basically it was hot sugary goodness in a basket....trust me you will want to give these a try. They are absolutely worth it.   I'm ready to go back, I want to try their brunch and other sandwiches and entrees....and I will make it a point to get the beignets EVERY time I'm here.

WvIu3i6SIzNkKQ9FW04B-A.text: This is cafe is a little on the pricey side but very doable for the quality you receive.  It is much more than the True definition of a cafe as far as I can tell bc they do much more than coffee and pastries (although they do both of these superbly well!).  their breakfast is top notch complete with Omelet and crepe choices in the classic French style.  Ive had their omelets, croissants, and espresso drinks and they are all top notch in my opinion.  In this respect I would highly recommend it as a breakfast/cafe/ and definitely a brunch stop.  I will have to return for dinner at some point but i have all the confidence that it is every bit as good as its True Cafe offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Croissants as good as any you&#39;ll find in Charlotte.

iAfaQnbFpajtqvpq3WxEPA.text: This is a gem in Charlotte that has both high quality brunch and dinner. I know of no other place that has beef Wellington (Saturdays) or a fruit de mer omelette on their regular menu.  Not only the rare items are what make CM special, but it's atmosphere screams class without being haughty or needlessly arrogant. Such a balance is tough to do.  As for economics, you get a greater-than-fair portion and quality for what you pay, so you won't feel shortchanged. I have visited 7 times in the last 16 months with my visits becoming more and more frequent.   I would only suggest that the beef wellington be served on more than just Saturday, but I understand given the labor intensity of the dish, that may be a tall order. It's possible they may accommodate a request for one on an off day given enough notice, but you'll need to ask.  Bottom line, go give them your money. You won't be disappointed

E0LIXpgO13JUSnGFjAeJyA.text: I recently realized that, despite being a very regular customer of this place, I have never checked in or written a review. Time to right the latter part of this wrong.   My boyfriend and I discovered Cafe Monte thanks to a Groupon his mom gave us for Christmas. It's not exactly convenient to where we live, and I might not have otherwise gone there. That was 3 or so years ago and I've lost count of how many times I've been, for both brunch and dinner. I read through some of the negative reviews and I'm genuinely perplexed; I've never had a bad experience here.   I love the atmosphere, and the service is always good if not outright super. But the food. Mercy, the food. I've tried just about everything on the menu at some point (either ordering it myself, or taking a bite off my dining companion's plate) and have never been disappointed. Certainly, there are things that aren't really up my alley, but that's the case wherever you go.   Some of my favorites are: the French country breakfast (that skillet potato is the best); steak and eggs; lobster & crab crepes; beef & asparagus crepes; trout amandine (I sub asparagus and mashed potatoes as my sides); beef short rib bourguignonne (very good on a cold winter evening); mussels & frites; roasted artichoke hearts; four cheese fondue; and the brie en croute.   They do nightly specials, too. Off the top of my head: Monday is all you can eat mussels, and Friday is lobster. I've taken advantage of both specials at some point, and really enjoyed both.   Prices are fair, in my opinion. But, PRO-TIP, keep an eye on Groupon, Living Social, etc. because they frequently have deals available.  I'd definitely recommend this place. In fact, when friends and family come to town we almost always go here. Hopefully the negative reviews were isolated incidents, which is unfortunate but, in my experience, not the way Cafe Monte normally functions.

NEzrSfKqxWlx-fhlmSByUw.text: Looking for a romantic, intimate setting for date night with live music - look no further. We found this place thanks to Groupon for their $17 for $30 option in an effort to try a new restaurant.   Upon arrival we were quickly surprised but the live band and European-feel decor. We were quickly sat and started off our meal with complementary home made bread with butter, and ordered the Charcuterie appetizer to start. We also ordered a bottle of wine to share, one of the cheapest ones they had at $28. Most bottles here range from $28-$130, but majority in the $30-$50 range.  The Charcuterie was a great spread of different cheeses and meats and pate with toasted bread to enjoy. My boyfriend ordered the salmon and I ordered the mussels. Would order the Salmon again, the Mussels were good not great, but sub your fries for the mushrooms and I promise you will not be disappointed!   Overall I would absolutely come back here for a romantic evening, birthday or anniversary where I don't mind spending about $100 on dinner for two people. Excellent service and food all around!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussels over white wine in garlic. Good, not great. I subbed my fries for the mushrooms and they were to die for!
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charcuterie Appetizer - Collection of meats, cheeses, olives and pâté served with toasted bread. Highly recommend!

ZH-_awL7C0kBFAYqqLVYTA.text: Excellent service. The coffee was very good, as was the crab and lobster crepes. Too many tomatoes for my taste, but I could easily move them out of the way and still enjoy the dish.

bh5TH2Yvuyg__j5YfCxqJg.text: First time here with both my wife *and* my daughter. Smiles and enjoyment all around!  Yes, Sunday brunch on a sunny day is going to be busy and we were waiting for every one of the twenty minutes that the hostess said it would be. No fault there.  We started off with a plate of beignets, which had the required heavy dusting of powdered sugar and also a small pot of strawberry jam for dipping/scraping. Very hot and very tasty. A nice starter while you look over the menu.  For mains, we each went with omelets or the crabcake benedict. Each was a good portion with plenty of filling and lots of hollandaise on the benedict. The hashbrown potato casserole was very yummt and the omelets also came with a small bowl of fresh fruit - blackberries and blueberries and such. Nice.  Very good coffee. Cappuccino was very good.  Service was good, ambiance was great and the food was very good.  We'll be back to Cafe Monte for sure.

qULEhbCZp1PRaDpXumC8Iw.text: Hands down, this is probably my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. Every time I go here it's wonderful service and great food. I typically like to go on Mondays because of the unique good specials they have for that day. But everyday of the week they have a special, just depends on what you like. Anything and everything on that menu rate great. They have a old school bartender that mixes and serves the drinks just right. The Moscow mule is delicious. My favorite dishes on the menu is the muscles, crab crepes, and chicken crepes. Spectacular place, I love it.

Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

qiw2fVlb_X7wuQsXQhJtGA.text: This hidden gem popped up randomly one morning on my search for brunch. We decided to make the drive and were thrilled with the service and food! The atmosphere is very much like a True French bistro (except much larger) and the wait staff are all dressed to the nines even for brunch.   I recommend getting a reservation if you would like a table in the main seating area because the food is truly that good. I had the crab cake Benedict and my date ordered the croque monsieur. They were both prepared excellently and the cheese on the croque was done perfectly. The side salad was also in traditional French fashion and was simple and delicious.   I am looking forward to trying dinner here sometime in the near future!

t6ny8xiap0uamiqDDK-SsQ.text: Nice little joint in South Park. A bit commercialized, but still a lovely environment. I went for brunch on a weekday and it was good as usual. Highly recommending getting a Group / Living Social for this place, it will keep you and your wallet happy.  Lobster Crepe, Crab Cake Benedict, Steak and Frites, a lot of good menu items. One point of advice, don't get the Beef Wellington when it's their special, they suck at making it, stick to their core menu items.

FkHTD5iuv00h9zuui6KCPA.text: My girlfriends and I had brunch here yesterday and it was DELICIOUS!! The beignets are so good! I got the chicken salad sandwich and fries... both were amazing! Also, the mimosas were big and so good. Our waiter was very polite and on top of it! Thanks for a great experience!

NwDQ00CBb9H1XnryRZI8vw.text: The service is great and the food is always delicious! The atmosphere is warm and welcoming and when the weather is nice enough to sit outside it really does feel like you're at a French bistro. Great place for Sunday brunch!

VenbxQ4D0tWN10Ev0IWj-g.text: Really hot place for brunch. Reservation is definitely needed unless U come around 9-10 is on Sunday morning. Nice food as well. I tried the lobster and crab crepe, creamy and fresh. Recommend.

Ul6JCgBruct4IBdnDAtsIQ.text: A friend and I tried this place for lunch one afternoon.  You feel like you stepped into a bistro in France when you walk in.  Our waitress was extremely polite but the wait on drinks and food was a bit disappointing.   We split a pizza and it was delicious.  Would definitely want to back for brunch.

ZxMh2pDuwLRW65BE-RjReQ.text: Just love this spot. Attentive service. Great food and ambiance! I order out for brunches and showers. Perfect to pick up a wonderful quiche for Christmas morning, and just pop it in to heat that morning. They have beignets and chocolate croissants...

TmgahGY2aZkUVxBcv07xoQ.text: Amazing!!! Totally recommend this place. The basil penne was melting in my mouth. And the dessert... wonderful!

u85uj3hdCoF8AdqGGuIzLg.text: Visited Cafe Monte for dinner last Friday with 3 friends.  The Beef Bourguignon was exceptional, as were the crepes, salads and desserts.  Pleasant, upbeat, casual atmosphere and attentive service.

Diz9vnAgHQ-GwZzimWaJFQ.text: Food was great as it usually is. Our waitress was almost nonexistent. Had to ask for refills and other condiments for our meals. We really felt like we were a distraction to our waitress.

EsZBHLD7RVhcjfSvVrhw2Q.text: Wonderful experience! Though I just stopped in for coffee before meeting a client, I was greeted promptly! The cappuccino was amazing, the staff kind and professional! Would highly recommend and I'm most definitely coming back. The patio area was tidy and chairs are comfy which usually isn't the case with outdoor seating. Beautiful inside and out!
