eGgd58mpawckD931ALS3KA.text: The crepes at this place are phenomenal!! I was very pleased with my brunches here.  The restaurant is unique inside with a lot of seating and even a bar area to sit.  There is a patio for warm days and nights.  An overall fun atmosphere.  Service is great.  I have had dinner here once for restaurant week and was very pleased.  Never a bad experience.

HDWs32bLzrIfZFhDAGiEQQ.text: Always our go to dinner spot. Food is delicious especially the salmon!  Waitstaff is very professional. Short wait time too.

PE8SJ6c9h_wl4GzVlkH-8Q.text: 3.5  I came here today for brunch. When we arrived (party of 4) around 11 we were told an hour wait. We ended up being seated after 30 minutes. They also take reservations through open table, but we found that out after the fact. Next time I'll book one.   I ordered the Florentine quiche ($12), which came with a side salad. The salad had tomatoes and cucumbers on it with a lite olive oil dressing. Very light. The quiche was good, but nothing that blew me away.  It was actually quite creamy, but that could have been from the cheese. I wish the crust was a little more flaky, but overall I enjoyed it.  Others in my party got the Benedicts and then all enjoyed them. However, the breakfast potato it came with was very bland. Again- good but nothing special.   Our service was great and fast, however I wouldn't be too eager to return again. Nothing stood out to me to come back again.

1U9TshTGc-8z132ydaUvYw.text: I can't say enough positive things about this restaurant! Brunch, lunch or dinner you can not go wrong. I love their Benedict's and beignets for brunch and their French onion soup and short rib dish for dinner. They have daily specials like half off bottles of wine and endless mussels... need I say more? Go and enjoy!

x6nBLCV9-9XZ0sIz33iLHQ.text: Visited here a couple of weeks ago. Food was great, but the whole reason we went was for the Beef Wellington, which is only prepared here once a week. We arrived 2 hours into dinner service to find out that they had already sold out... pretty disappointing considering we drove from Kannapolis to here just for it and it was only a quarter-way through the dinner service...  Oh well, better luck next time!

QwyboE0q2LMPNDl7EgzDAw.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! The food and service are always wonderful. Can not wait to go again soon, and enjoy another delicious meal! Yum, yum, yum!!!

UUgeSI4HOTLYdd8bR83l9Q.text: One of the best French Bistro I have eaten in outside Paris. My wife has the crepes and I the Benedict Monte and if not breakfast/brunch we get mussels. Javier is the best waiter in town.

z9a5Ei9nwWCoCsyIvov_hA.text: My son and I enjoyed this restaurant. We went on a Sunday so there was a wait but it was well worth it. We ate some macaroons while we waited. Breakfast was superb and I loved the people there.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

fU4JuJ6GGW1UpRJE1qWbmg.text: Our absolute favorite place for brunch! Fabulous service and the food is amazing. Awesome Bloody Mary. Recommend the Parisian omelet and the coffee is the best in the city!!

sm77jaw2rdCY6HykBGl7Qg.text: This place is totally about the atmosphere. Frequently attended by live musicians, it is a great venue for a drink and a book, or catching up with a friend. The service is extremely professional, and very attentive. They don't make everything - but they do have all the standards, and the outside patio is very pleasant during good weather.  It's adorable. If you're into adorable, you'll like it.

WQgHOeH65v1rrRaq93A5RQ.text: Smoked salmon eggs Benedict: AMAZING! The food here is great, I have yet to have any bad dishes here. The bread is also to die for. Salads as good, entrees are good, desserts are good, service is great. Love the atmosphere in this place. Highly recommended.

S5RtY4DkuPvxX70O4gXsbw.text: I am a huge fan of brunch and am always looking to try a new place. I instantly noticed the charm and french inspiration of Cafe Monte. The restaurant had a very cozy atmosphere.  The food also did not disappoint! I mean how can you go wrong with a buttery croissant? I decided to branch out from what I would normally order and ordered the steak and eggs. The steak was cooked to perfection. I ordered eggs poached, which doesn't always work out, but they were good extremely well. The potatoes where definitely one of my favorite parts, crispy and flavorful. Overall, none of the food disappointed!  In short, Cafe Monte is a french cuisine delight! I will definitely be returning for more!!!

mMM8Y3E4QUJByCBXN7guGA.text: This rating is based on the fact that this is a brunch spot. Our food was great and lived up to the hype I made up in my head after Yelp listed Cafe Monte in an email being one of the top brunch places. Make sure you grab a reservation because i heard them tell people that there was a 3 hour wait if they were trying to walk in. The bar was actually good as well. Making a brunch drink is typically rushed, causing inconsistency but I felt that they did a good job! We had the beighnets and the Monte Benedict. Couldnt have asked for more in our experience here!

kjnq4QuedVuKDD0ZwCqeKg.text: This is more of a 3.5star review as I will return but can't definitely say I'm a fan (right now).  Disclaimer: I had to bump up the staring  for Yelper readers but still say this is more of a 3.5 for my own quality control purposes.   We dined during Spring Break and had I, the Risotto kid chicken dinner (they served white meat - IMPRESSIVE)  sorority sister - braised beef (pot roast) THIS WAS BETTER THE NEXT DAY. THE FLAVORS CONGILED AND MWAH :* EVERYTHING WORKED.   The dine in isn't stuffy. Pretty relaxed. Didn't sit outdoors but on another occassion I might just. The risotto wasn't anything to write home about. The broiled chicken was seasoned well and juicy. The side dish wasn't memorable but no complaints from the kid. I tasted the Beef with the petitite carrots and mashed potatoes. Took pictures of the dishes as they were presented well.   The next day that beef dish was off the chain as the seasons really burst in your mouth.   Service - ok, 3 stars. Solid nothing spectacular.  Ambiance - ok. More like a cafe which precludes the best name for them and it's nice to have so many French options in CLT. It doesn't take me to France but it does remind me of WestBank Gretna/New Orleans. So it's French-esque.  Enough to get your fill.  Location - VERY SMART. This is the crowd/side of town to cater to.   I consider this place to be smart dining. Nicely appointed. Would feel comfortable having business lunch or dinner or a family gathering.  They get 4 stars for offering a GroupOn then graciously accepting it and not having a funky attitude like some places do when you redeem a GroupOn.   End Result: I will return.

bHtHe1LHdhRqDDa00O0dbg.text: I have been there twice and found the service and food to par with some of the best food in town and gluten free options to boot.

naowWQ-Moc3-0nE46R8zeg.text: I found this from a living social. And since then, I have been in love with this place! I will never get tired of their Charcuterie - various cured meat and pickled vegetables! It's just simply delicious and I feel like I'm in Europe.  I am a big fan of their moules frites and shrimp & artichoke crepes are very yummy and big.  I always like to treat myself to some macarons afterwards!   Very quaint place and so close to where I live. It's a win win situation!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. definitely going to enjoy this brunch!

mVh1Mxn_jN1Sme5sdTGjpg.text: My wife and I came for restaurant week. I had the tuna steak with risotto, she had the sea scallops. We had peppermint gelatto and bread pudding for dessert. All of the food was amazing. Out experience was made even brighter by our wonderful server Lisa. The restaunt feels upscale but not stuffy or too formal. Overall, a wonderful experience!

oOWyfAoLEOEhU7f666jllQ.text: My husband and I had brunch at Cafe Monte this morning and it was amazing! When we first walked in, I wasn't sure because the hostess was on the phone and took 2 consecutive phone calls without even acknowledging us, but a 2nd hostess came to the desk after a minute and seated us quickly. We had the beignets as an appetizer. An order of 3 was large enough for us to share and they were light and pillowy perfection! My husband had the Benedict Monte and loved it. I had the steak and eggs. I asked for a side of Brie cheese and Hollandaise and had my eggs over medium. My favorite part of the meal was my Bloody Mary! The waiter even made sure to get my husband's mimosa in a less girly glass. Service and food were great and the dining room is sunny and inviting while maintaining its high class feel.

_yiHqTuEHIdUPXEsg8iFTw.text: Superb service, great food and wine selection. Perfect mood for a date night. Loved the duck confit pizza. The place is small and intimate.

1mJ1L0H0mBt_23gtyebO0g.text: SERVICE WAS GREAT!!! My daughter and I went there for the first time the night before last. It was a pretty busy dinner crowd and we were greeted by two gentlemen at the front. As we did not have a reservation I fully expected to wait if necessary. The wait was brief and the decor was nice, along with the hustle of the crowed/staff the place was alive. That seated us at a small round table that my daughter loved. It had a little European feel she said. We were greeted be a young lady named Rachel she was our server and she was fantastic, very attentive with an easy approach. We started with some escargot and charcuterie. The escargot was great however the charcuterie wasn't my favorite. Not that it was bad I just found the pate a little dry and they gave me cheddar cheese with it and the very firm sausage was cut way to thick almost impossible to chew. But the veggies were great. We then moved in to entrees I had the Beef  Burgunion (sp)while my daughter had the Duck both were wonderful.  Now what really stood out in my experience was the all around service, you see before we where served but right after Rachel had taken our order it dawned on me that I had forgotten to request no mushrooms in my dish. So one of the gentlemen who sat us was walking by and I expressed the situation to him. He assured me that it would be no problem and walked to the back. What's impressive there is that I'm sure the kitchen hadn't gotten my order yet because I hadn't even received my apps yet. So clearly the communication amongst the staff is stellar.  In my experience the food was very good and the service was great, I'll defiantly be going back.

VabHV6aBfjI21ZrNpHk1fg.text: We regularly go to Cafe Monte, mostly for Brunch, but sometimes for Dinner.  Service is top notch and the food is some of the best in the city.  Authentic, fresh and lively, as if you went out to park yourself in your favorite Bistro in Paris.  The Benedict styles are my favorite, the quiche is very fresh, and you cant go wrong with the mussels, or any of the omelettes.  For coffee, I usually have an americano and my wife a latte, and they are also excellent, as good as any high end coffee house.  My only problem with the place is that we sometimes make the trip and there are just too many patrons waiting for a table.  I wish we could reserve or they could have more coordination in that sense.

vcOFHyQrQc91MngAwbkWtw.text: Delicious food! My fiancee have been here many times and we are always satified with the food and the service.  The bread is very fresh and the beef tips are always good!

96yQvXGPP3Z9WAPwnsVxJg.text: Disclaimer: I've only had take-out from Cafe Monte, so I can't attest to the ambiance or service.  What I can tell you is how amazing their pizza is, more specifically the Mild Mushroom pizza. Oh my this pizza is divine. It's a decent size for $14, can feed up to 2 people. The crust is light, not too heavy nor oily. There are mushrooms a plenty on this baked pie, nestled in with a heaping amount of goat cheese. If this doesn't sound yummy enough, the finished product is covered in a giant's portion of fresh arugula.  I totally want to try something new, but this pizza is so to-die-for I can't bring myself to order anything else.  FYI: bogo coupon in the Charlotte Citipass book!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States. wild mushroom pizza to-go

ZCk8hCRXfIJpQ3khhiObLQ.text: My wife's favorite restaurant in Charlotte. From the service to the bread to the burgers or fish - you basically cannot go wrong.  I used to have the trout and my wife the salmon. However, their burger is really good (love the frites, too). And my wife is now stuck on the trout. She also likes the various coffees and pastries offered.  Don't forget to ask for the bread. The freely give it, but sometimes you have to ask. It's warm - crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside. Perfect.  Nice atmosphere. Not too stuffy, but the place has some character.  This place is usually hopping on the weekends. Try a late lunch if it's a Saturday.

IHt0OEMXXJZH4uqCPLKs_g.text: Would only recommend coming for brunch. Because dinner items are good but are slightly overpriced. I guess you're paying for the ambiance more than the taste.

pm4wc8S4vLv-elELwnCZzg.text: I was very disappointed on Saturday, July 22nd.  We had reservations at 8pm for 5 of us.  Our service was horrible.  I drank 3 glasses of water (mine, my wife's, and my mother-in-law's) and the waitress never refilled our waters or asked if we would like anything else to drink.  We had to ask for another bottle of wine.   After we finished the appetizers, the gentleman that delivered the food was irritated because plates were never cleared.  They delivered the food and cleared the appetizer plates all at once.  No one ever checked to see if we enjoyed our food or wanted anything more to drink.  At this point, it was 9pm and the restaurant really was not that busy.  Our waitress must have been more concerned about getting off her shift then the service she was giving us. We have dined her before and loved it.  This was not a good experience.  The food was just okay and with bad service... it does not make us want to return.

PX7Dtn7OXU7rBc8RWt4Xpw.text: Worth a trip out of your way to go to.  Excellent food and super friendly wait staff.

zum3_Iv0i2pwmhyBqPGOsA.text: Our server Rachel was very friendly, knowledgeable, and made sure to replenish our drinks and check in a timely and professional manner. Our salad and entree was amazing and the ambience is elegant and relaxing. Love this little gem. Will certainly be returning to Cafe Monte.

p5HR8AgiMnkQYiDBjdUnSw.text: I loved this place! Our waiter Xavier was so nice! If you dont want to spend too much money on wine you can order the bottle of the day for 24 $ and ours was excellent! We had the escargots (delicious, especially if you love garlic). We also had the moules et frites, a must have, specially with their bread! Finally a creme brulee... To die for!

eHfpbIp0RTudUOloIFreOQ.text: A nice little place, tucked away in Phillips Place.  I just happen to see it from the road and decided to pop in for a drink and a bite to eat.  It was a Tuesday night and the place had only a few tables occupied and as I wasn't in the mood for table service, I opted for the bar.  The wait and bar staff were all buzzing around..........except they were not buzzing around the customers.  There were multiple instances that the bar staff and wait staff gossiped about everything which was unprofessional - but considering the average wait staff aged looked to be barely out of the 20's I'll give them a break this time. It took a while to get drinks....we had to ask for water......but we did get our order of a meat and cheese plate and an order of Crab & Lobster crepes.  The chesses and meat plates in this town continue to be small portioned and a bit disappointing......Vivace is the only game in town where you get a nice amount of everything.....Cafe Monte...take note.  The one plus is that they serve a VERY inexpensive breakfast during the week.  The main dish, which was shared between me and my GF was good...very rich.  All and all it was a good experience until the I was handed the bill which was fair pricing wise and had it returned to me with a larger around of over $10?  I asked the waiter and he had swiped my card for another larger bill.  He corrected the problem, but handed me the corrected charge slip that required a signature..but only one copy...the copy for the store....meaning if the correction didn't go through right I would have been screwed...so I had to ask him for my own copy.    So in closing, taking away the factor of either inexperience or just plain non-paying attention wait and bar staff, Cafe Monte is a cute little cafe in South Park worth checking out.......if you have the same issues I did.......then one time might be enough *grin*.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Cafe Monte - Charlotte, NC, United States

GZQ6qwmuaVgO2YE4MOb5Ww.text: Lovely food. My wife had the mushroom crepes & I had lox on a croissant w/Creme fraiche w/light dill. Great coffee and great cappuccino. Service very adequate & friendly. We sat outside and were annoyed by a mother who left her little girl in her car seat with the SUV engine running while she had lunch. obnoxious behavior with an entitled attitude!

duxGNaA58ECJG4c0HJwLWw.text: Good experience on my first visit to Cafe Monte. I love the casual yet classy atmosphere and the warm and welcoming feel you get inside. The service here was spot on. My server was very attentive, and receptive. For dinner I had the lobster and crab crepes with a side of pommes frites. The crepe entree is very filling and full of good flavors. The pommes frites are thin and crispy and nothing less than amazing. I'll definitely return again soon.

bENeWJ4tSEfTebA_ouVXnw.text: I'm a first time patron.  Service was very good, and it should have been - it was pretty quiet for late lunchtime.  Was expecting to fight a crowd, but I guess I am thankful I didn't have to but also curious that I didn't have to.  Got lucky I suppose.  Made a mistake in ordering the hamburger "medium".  It was tasty and I managed to eat the whole thing (waaaay too much bread) but it was also overdone, well beyond medium.    Got salad instead of fries and that was a good choice.  Used an Entertainment 2015 coupon which made my lunch price an extreme bargain.  Will definitely be back.

fXUf8wRzzdY1okr_tNR5lg.text: LOVE their brunch. I have never been disappointed. Their bread is so fresh and delicious. Always have great service too!

0LjD_o21rdISlMMvPjkwPw.text: I revisited this french restaurant again last night, taking my boyfriend for his first visit.  It was a very pleasant and delicious experience.  Our waitress was not only accommodating but was very knowledgeable about each dish.  The salad with goat cheese was awesome and they made something that used to be on their menu that is no longer for me as a special extra!  We own 2 restaurants and are very picky about service, food, quality, ambience & prices.  It was worth every single penny and we will definitely be back.  Thanks for a great date night!

y90l88QUlWF4XpQ2hQQamw.text: First time @ Cafe Monte for Brunch today. The food and atmosphere were great. The restaurant is a bit loud though. I had a Croque Monsieur and fries. I enjoyed everything we ordered. The wait staff was friendly. The service was a little slow but we were not in a huge hurry so it didn't bother anyone. Look forward to trying this place out again.

76ZbCpzxtDK_Q5jxZLCgqQ.text: I had a great date night here. First off the ambiance was very nice - live jazz at a good volume, crowded but not packed, and nicely decorated dining area. Our server was attentive and did a great job of presenting the specials.  The food came out at a good pace and we were never left waiting. We ordered the oysters and the escargot for apps, both were delicious. I got the risotto for my main meal - very cheesy with lots of vegetables and shrimp. Serving size was enough to take home. My boyfriend got the lobster which I tasted and was also very good (although I'm from Boston so I have had better lobster). Beignets for dessert were also great! And even with 2 apps, 2 main meals, 1 drink, 2 dessert, and 2 cappuccinos the total was less than $150 (before tip). Overall a great dining experience. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

9E9WVPysu2AHid0tTygQOg.text: I have visited twice, once for lunch and once for Sunday brunch - lunch was good but it's hard to beat Sunday brunch - get the beignets, they are worth every single calorie! Had a reservation, so no wait to get in, service was wonderful on both visits - would love to visit again for brunch or dinner

t2ixxFzztvzHI3kyODrBSA.text: Great Ambience! Great good. Service can be slow at times, but everything else makes up for it.

j6RMSbfrklSNJeLoVUAL0w.text: Went here for the 1st time on a Tuesday night, because my boyfriend's French acquaintance always goes here. Ambience was relaxed, cozy, & romantic with dim lighting & candles. The bread was delicious! I couldn't stop grabbing some before our food came. I had the duck salad & it was very tasty with a subtle but perfect sweetness, thanks to the dried cranberries sprinkled throughout. The baby potatoes were a great touch. I tasted my friend's risotto & it was great! Nice consistency (tip: ask for a spoon to eat it with). I also tasted my boyfriend's herb salmon & it was nicely done. No complaints on any of our dishes. Will definitely come again!

xB4rlIJvBAiqLGTHkrOa1w.text: Amazing breakfast! Always come here when I'm in town because the food is consistently delicious. Highly recommend the French country crepe with Brie, the potato cake has a hint of Rosemary which is so elegant. The coffee is outstanding and the entire mood makes you feel as though you are in a French cafe!  Back for dinner 2 days later!

ffrvT6_MejGa61bzXwMa8A.text: One of the best gems in Charlotte!   Food is consistently prepared perfectly, as well as amazingly quick! Dishes are out within minutes of ordering!   Escargot for a starter is fantastic, NY strip or duck for an entree are delicious!  Staff is always knowledgeable, and even excellent.  Check out live music on Friday's, it's a great atmosphere. It's one of our favorite restaurants in Charlotte!

B93sQ7rWZ0YfXLqHGAFbyA.text: We had a large group that attended.  The service was outstanding.  Our server was pleasant and very helpful, often coming to our table to see if anything was needed.  The atmosphere is also very nice.  Being in Philips Place, it has a comfortable feel and is very pleasantly decorated.  I personally got the seasonal vegetable risotto with shrimp.  The risotto was a bit undercooked as the rice had a bite to it, but it was edible.  A few people got the trout almandine and liked it.  One person gave me a bite of her beef to sample and it was like a pot roast - would have been better with a reduced wine or gravy sauce.  One lady got the crab cakes and said they were ok, but she was from Maryland and had some expectations  :-)  One person got the mussels and really liked it.  A couple of people got the pizza and it was so-so.  But hey, you're at a French restaurant afterall, and you order pizza ?  The cheese plates were VERY good quality cheeses and I highly recommend them for a nice starter.  Overall, go for the service and atmosphere.  You will have a lovely time.

zpQmkheL7wev8SAzuPVqMQ.text: Been here twice and the beignets are wonderful and breakfast was great. French roast coffee was really good also. The only down side was the service was slow and not that great.

uXA_d7Un54m3ftMD25ronw.text: I've never been to France.  I know people who have, and I know people who grew up in France, but from the stories I've heard, Cafe Monte sounds like it could exist quite easily on many Parisian corners. It's casual and sophisticated at the same time, unobtrusive and genuine. And the food is killer.  Cafe Monte has become my favorite brunch location.  Their cuisine is in the country French style: very comforting, a light hint of French sophistication, and features ingredients you would easily expect to find on the farm or at the market. My first venture included the Benedict Monte, a hybrid concoction that seems to fuse the French and American versions of this dish into a delightfully delicious meal. Soft, crunchy English muffins, oozing eggs, and a smooth Hollandaise.  I've also tried the French country breakfast, which is equally amazing. The coffee is great, too - nothing over the top, just good tasting lattes and coffees.  If the lunch and dinner offerings are just as good, I could see visiting here very often.

zU4fb8UpmqPCye-cOxgKug.text: We reserved a table at Cafe Monte last Saturday for a special occasion dinner. The front half of the restaurant really does feel like a french bistro, and with a wonderful duet of a trumpet player and a piano player, the music was great.  Service was attentive. We brought a bottle of wine from our cellar and corkage was $15. Our server noticed the bottle in its neoprene carrier as soon as she showed up and asked if we had white or red, and what style glasses we wanted.   My husband and I were both dying to try the steak frites, since we loved that dish in our favorite restaurant Paris. He ordered his au poivre, and I ordered mine with Bearnaise sauce. I'm docking Cafe Monte one star because they completely undercooked my steak. I ordered it medium, and I received a steak that was rare, as in cool in the middle. My husband ordered his medium rare and he also received a rare steak.  I prefer my steaks medium, but will eat just about any steak on either end of the spectrum of doneness so as to avoid sending it back and risking spit, so I kept my mouth shut. Be prepared to have your steak undercooked if you eat here.  Aside from that one issue, everything was great. Hopefully they'll get some more knowledgeable cooks in the kitchen in the future.

i6u_muCWAsMjTF6IS2EWhw.text: First time was a charm. Really liked the food. Had the crab cakes Benedict and it was full of lump crab meat. My wife had waffles and she said they were great. Feel good after the meal, not too full and not too hungry. Want to try lobster night on Fridays!!

RNYbnpW6dycevQ4p_ay0vw.text: Simply fantastic! Using Zaget categories, Cafe Monte gets 5's on all; Food, Decor, Service, and Cost.

YuEXxaYWuoKFc0hGmuIiEQ.text: Excellent food.  Excellent service.  Great for brunch or dinner.   Two thumbs up.  Way up!
